Reviews.Title: “Staff were amazing.”
Reviews.Author: mwcochran
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Metropolitan Hotel.The location downtown was great allowing me easy walking distance to everything I wanted to do.Room was nice and clean.Lots of staff and very friendly.I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianaZ84
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was in a great location. The room was wonderful, and the hotel staff were a delight. The next time I am in Vancouver I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Hotel April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Pam R
Reviews.Content: I used the Metropolitan Hotel for two days of meetings and overnight stay for some of our Board members. Everything went very well with the meeting space, catering was excellent and customer service top notch. The restaurant in the hotel, Diva at the Met, was outstanding and won rave reviews from those who ate dinner there. Would definitely use this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: zandrick
Reviews.Content: The hospitality of the staff was exceptional, from the doormen who were always there to the concierge who took time to take us to an early morning meeting, to the reception desk staff who helped with any need. The room was spacious and the bathroom was especially nice. This is a hotel I will highly recommend to my friends and family when they want to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times & will definitely be going back. Great decor, friendly, helpful staff & the restaurant 'Diva at the Met' is awesome. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_Nanaimo_BC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a NHL game this past week. There are some regular hotels that we frequent but neither of us had been to the "Met" before. Booking was excellent as they had fulfilled a request prior to our arrival. We asked for a good TV (non CRT) as we wanted to watch the post game reviews - we read on TA that there were some rooms with CRT. Our room was high up for low noise and with a nice flatscreen. Accommodations were clean, temperature set correctly, bed very comfortable, bath had separate shower which was handy. The location of the hotel could not be better - nestled across the main drag (Georgia) from the Art Gallery on a sidestreet (Howe). We first saw this hotel on a Travel show on Discovery Channel. Staff were very friendly without being too pompus - they have a 4 diamond award. Price / Value proposition was high for our booking - regular web search would be on par.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in downtown”
Reviews.Author: CathyOfCal
Reviews.Content: There are many nice hotels in town, but we selected the Met because of their indoor pool and free Internet access. The pool is great -- had it all to myself in the evening and the water is a perfect temp for swimming laps. The gym looks well equipped, too, and not too busy when I peeked in. We have the luxury king room with tons of space, including a desk AND a table and chairs, and a very large, well stocked bath with separate shower and tub, guest robes, and nice large towels. The room is surprisingly quiet, too, both from street noise and adjacent rooms. The staff has been outstanding--friendly and accommodating in every way. It was an odd way to choose a hotel, but we are delighted with the result!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: W0rldwize
Reviews.Content: The Met definitely holds its own in terms of its traditional first class service (the doormen are great!) and fresh modern accommodation. It's in the heart of Downtown Vancouver providing and excellent base to explore this fantastic city. The luxury king rooms are a great size with ample desk space and a small seating area and table - the bed is huge and sooo comfortable! The bathroom is very spacious with plenty of towels and a great range of Molton Brown products to cater for all of your bathing needs. The room itself is smartly decorated and spotless. Coffee making facilities are in the room and topped up daily. If you prefer tea (and there's a decent choice of teas) you can ask for a kettle as well. When it comes to geting on line, you have a choice of in-room wired or wireless internet connection. The wirless is quite slow so grab the ethernet cable out of the desk draw and get wired for faster access. There's a good sized flat screen TV with, as you'd expect, plenty of channels to choose from! The associated restaurant - "Diva" - is very nicely set out with friendly, attentive staff and has a good choice of very good quality food and drinks (it also provides the food for room service), although it is a bit pricey and you'll find great food everywhere across this city. There's a fully kitted out gym and indoor swimming pool to help you keep in shape - i haven;t used either but they seem well kept and popular with other guests. It's a top hotel in a great location with very reasonable rates - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Carla H
Reviews.Content: Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver is worthy of a two thumbs up. The location is fantastic. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, inviting & clean. Bed lines are great. The staff from the doormen,front desk & concierge are all so helpful, informative & friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel & stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable alternative if a little inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Stewart M
Reviews.Content: We visited the Metropolitan for an overnight stay in our local city. The staff were friendly and helpful as you would hope. The room was a reasonable size, with the finest linens and toiletries (Molton Brown). It was good see a room-safe in the room but the room taken up by all the snacks, bottled water etc seemed disproportionate. One thing about the room was the TV. I don't think I've seen such an old TV, (remember when they used to be deeper than they were wide?) a TV which sat unceremoniously on top of one a black metal stand I thought they had stopped selling in the 1980s. The picture was, as you would expect, poor. This all made no sense in the context of the rest of the room. We did visit the bar which seemed agreeable - however on returning to the hotel we found it closed at 11pm which was odd. This was a Saturday night in a top-rated hotel in the hear of the city and the bar was closed? The hotel offered 24hr Room Service, but clearly getting a drink was another story. Overall the Metropolitan was a reasonable hotel. I wonder if someone has simply taken their foot off the pedal?

Reviews.Title: “Contradictions...”
Reviews.Author: ednacloud
Reviews.Content: The welcomes we received from the valet and front desk were great; both friendly and helpful. No problems there. Nice entrance and lobby. The room itself was nothing special; quite dated. It had an old CRT TV on a black stand which had once housed a video or DVD player - very 1990s. TV picture wasn't very good. The room didn't look as if it had been updated for quite some time. The heating/ventilation system was good; soundproofing from street noise not that great. The bathroom was a nice surprise - large and nicely fitted out with great toiletries (Molton Brown). It had a cheap, white plastic shower head which seemed at odds with the marble walls and floor. Only one bathrobe was provided in a room for two. The supply of Frette towels (one of the most upmarket brands) was odd. The hand towels and face cloths were thick and luxurious, the mat too. However, the bath sheets - although supposedly of the same brand - were thin and frayed around the edges. Wasn't thrilled to find someone else's long black hair in the sink though. The bed was quite comfortable and the Frette linens were soft. There was a coffee machine - the cheap kind you can buy at a drugstore. Also horrible coffee and Coffee Mate powdered milk sachets - yuck. I think they could do a lot better with that. We went into the bar for a drink late on the Saturday afternoon. The bar was pretty empty. The server was not very welcoming. Later, a polite request to see the restaurant's menu for that evening (it was not ready) was also met with a surly response. We were surprised to see the bar closes at 11pm on a weekend - a bit too early for this kind of hotel. As we were finishing our drinks at that time, several people came in hoping to get served and were incredulous that the place was closed for the night. The hotel is well located for all downtown activities. With so much competition in the area I don't know if we'd stay there again or not.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: TigerGirl11
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Metropolitan Hotel. The staff could not have been more friendly or more accommodating and were very helpful when we wanted to make restaurant and sightseeing reservations. Our room was huge and beautifully decorated, with a spacious separate sitting room and large bedroom. We also enjoyed the hotel's restaurant, where again we had great customer service, and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend staying at the Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: first time at this hotel and overall I enjoyed my stay. Staff are very attentive to your needs, I didn't touch the main entrance doors - someone is always there opening it for you. The rooms are nice. It's is obvious that this was probably one of THE HOTELS in the 1980s and for the most part they have maintained it very well. I founds the beds to be ok, not as comfy as most 4-5 star hotels. Overall I would recommend the hotel but i wouldrecomend that you should not have to pay more than 180 here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mareliToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in every way. The rooms are beautiful and quiet and I wish I could pack those beds and pillows for my own home. Staff were always friendly and attentive. I can not think of one bad thing to say about this hotel and I do hope I will return to Vancouver again some day and enjoy the accomodations under better personal circumstances. We had a medical emergency with my elderly father during our stay. I can not thank the hotel enough for helping us out and expressing compassion and concern. A special thank you to Sabrina at the front desk for competently helping us out with the bill, which, due to our stress and confusion we had mixed up. A lovely hotel in a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Petr
Reviews.Content: I am frequently in Vancouver on business and almost always stay at the Metropolitan Hotel. It is superbly located with easy walking access to restaurants, shopping and transportation. As hotels go the "Met" is relatively small, but the rooms are excellent with comfortable beds, including exceptional linen and pillows. Large bright bathroom with great shower and separate tub. The staff are consistently welcoming, friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. A french style bistro restaurant - the Diva - serves great food at reasonable prices. I particularly enjoy their breakfasts. This hotel manages to create a "homelike" ambiance that cannot be matched by any of the other major hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The WOW Factor!”
Reviews.Author: JNHCalgary
Reviews.Content: On my drive to Vancouver I was in a minor car accident. When checking in, the front desk agent asked how my trip was and I told him about the accident. After a run along the Vancouver sea wall, I was in my room when room servcie arrived with two ice cold beers and some peanuts with a note from the front desk saying they hoped this would help improve my day. They saw an opportunity to do something special and they did!!! The rest of the stay was just as good!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the Met”
Reviews.Author: pacNWtraveler54
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver several times a year; this was my first time staying at the Metropolitan Hotel and I was not impressed. Although the location was good, the room was VERY outdated...no plasma TV (one of the big box TV's from the 80's), dirty carpet, and a tiny shower that I barely fit into (not made for tall people!). I had to ask for a bathrobe, towels (there was only one in the room), and creamer for the coffee. Apparently some of the rooms have been updated, but the "Luxury" rooms are the older rooms with the bad TV's--the pictures on the hotel website are very misleading, the majority of the rooms do not look like that. This is not a 4 star hotel, maybe 3 at best. For the same price, stay at the St. Regis, the Hyatt, or the Crown Plaza--these are true 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jon3766
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Metropolitan with our 11 month old daughter and it was perfect. The room was large with a nice bathroom. The hotel is in a great location, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, top service”
Reviews.Author: Fracman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated a block from the Art Gallery and from the Canada Line in downtown Vancouver. It's a few blocks to the water, so if that is your destination it's not ideal, but for the business and downtown traveller, this is excellent. Hotel is clean, with excellent staff and service. Doormen are very helpful. The martinis here are legendary too! Rooms are perfectly sized, but without any real view. Quiet, clean, fresh, with beautifully comfortable beds. I'd be back there for a business trip any time. The gym is reasonably equipped, but I had to go into the pool area for the equipment I liked because of a lack of space. The "business centre" is one room, so don't think you'll spend any time in there getting work done.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mikey350D
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in downtown Vancouver. Not inexpensive, but a very good value for the price. Very large bathroom: Shower and tub. When our train got cancelled (snow) they gave us an extra day a the same internet special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: SagMoonTravels
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel’s staff is friendly and their customer service is impeccable. The hotel is nicely situated close to Granville Street and within walking distance to shops, restaurants and sites. The rooms are spacious and modern. I loved their luxurious bath robes and high quality bedding – nothing like a climbing into a comfortable bed when you have jet lag. The coffee facilities in the room are adequate but perhaps not as modern as they could be. Breakfast was both delicious and beautifully presented. Wifi internet access is free although at times a little intermittent. The gym is small but has everything you need for a good workout. Whilst not the trendiest hotel in Vancouver, its well priced and the quality of their service can be highly rated.

Reviews.Title: “Met Hotel - Modern & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JetRTW
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in after 3 months of travelling with our children. As a family of five we stayed in a suite, with a king bed, sofa bed and pull-out bed and had enough room. The hotel's strong points are it's attentive customer service, (welcome cookies for the kids), location, (nice and central), and modern decor. We were a little disappointed that they didn't warn us at booking about their annual restaurant closure and found it a bit odd they only had a TV in the bedroom - not the room with the sofas. It was a collection of things like that which meant we didn't give it the full five stars. Would happily stay here again but would also check out the Four Seasons hotel across the road to see if it could better meet our needs. Photos and a fuller description can be found on our blog here: http://jet-rtw.blogspot.co.nz/2012/01/metropolitan-hotel-vancouver.html

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: salmonpg
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets/exceeds my expectations. Lots of little details that I appreciate such as: windows that open; bathrobes; real coffee maker (not the capsule kind-which can be good but typically low quality capsules in hotels and I prefer to bring my own coffee and fliter); good lighting; free wi fi; good shower products (molten brown); great location; professional and helpful service; free local newspaper; fair sized room and a good government rate. I have already booked my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SSSC1
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nites at the Metropolitan in Vancouver, great location next to Pacific Centre, close to subway and bus lines, as well as within walking distance of many interesting places in downtown Vancouver. Price was reasonable, rooms are pretty huge with 2 beds and nice big bathroom. A little noisy due to the location downtown, but that is a small price to pay for the location. There is a small gym with a pool, great for a simple workout. Staff was friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “across from Pacific Centre”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is nicely situated right in the center of Vancouver. Service is good, price a bit high but not too bad. Overall, a very pleasant experience Very friendly people and big, beautiful room. The view was not the greatest, but that could just be where our room was located, but not a deal breaker

Reviews.Title: “World class luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: AaronHeck
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Metropolitan where I was also attending a seminar. The room was thoughtfully designed, well equipped [iPhone/iPod docking alarm clock!] and beautifully appointed. The bed was supremely comfortable and the bathroom large with both a corner shower and a full tub. Hotel staff were *always* very courteous and helpful. The food and service during the seminar were also provided by the hotel, and were excellent. They were very accommodating for one of the members of the seminar who had a gluten-free diet restriction. One of the servers heard our instructor coughing while presenting, and came back with a specially made cup of tea with honey for them, in a big mug with a note that said "Hope this helps!". The presenter was very impressed, as were the rest of the attendees. I travel to Vancouver once a month, and this will now be my destination of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Supersimp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at this gem of a hotel. It's location is fantastic , directly behind the pacific centre mall and the major tourist attractions including Stanley park are short walks away. We were given a great room on a high floor with a huge bathroom both with whirlpool bath tub, walk in shower and his and hers basins. The decor of the bathroom was slightly dated but still very luxurious. The hotel has a great pool, jacuzzi and gym facilities which are generally not very busy so whatever time we would go down to enjoy, it was very relaxing. The thing that stood out the most was the amazing level of customer service delivered by the small team working at this hotel. Everyone from the front desk staff, the concierge team, the door men to the cleaning staff were amazing. They were friendly and went out of their way to deliver exceptional service. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable. We will definitely stay here again! Oh and the pancakes served in diva were divine.....yum!

Reviews.Title: “First class home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Cain
Reviews.Content: And I mean that, because from the moment you step in all the staff make you feel welcome and that your custom appreciated. Full disclosure - I rarely stay anywhere else in Vancouver, and a colleague has over 200 nights. But they keep track and reward loyalty - a box of chocolates may not sound much but shows a level of customer service I have rarely seen elsewhere and which I, for one, appreciate. Location - great. Downtown. Two hundred metres from the penultimate stop on the Canada Line and an easy walk even in light drizzle, but even if it is raining cats and dogs everyone takes their umbrella to Vancouver! An easy walk to the waterfront and Yaletown, a bit further to Robson Street or Stanley Park, but then you need to lose those extra pounds, don't you. Rooms are great. I haven't used the restaurant very often, but it is reputed to be very good and the one time i had breakfast there I had no complaints. I have spent many hours at the Diva bar, and the bar staff are great, although on my last visit they were cutting back the opening hours, I guess while everyone recovers from the fiscal shock of Christmas. Bottom line - I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: erezn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for 5 nights. The location is great. Ot iis close to both touristic and business areas. The rooms were spacious and clean. The stuff is friendly and helpful. They have an indoor swimming pool and (too) small gym. Good restaurants and pubs near as well as public transportation to practically any location you need to get to.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: susan_0002
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver in January 2012 while attending a training course that was being held in one of the hotel meeting rooms. The entire experience was absolutely top rate. There is a close "sky train" stop to the hotel - about a block away - single train to the airport for about $9.00. The hotel rooms are spacious, mine had a small balcony and view of the 4-seasons pool next door which was nice (although I did get a bit envious...). The bathrooms are huge, bright and light. The wireless connection is super fast so that you can even stream movies with little interruption. The staff is incredibly attentive . The concierge gave me great recommendations for restaurants and precise directions when I was seeking out local businesses, yoga studios etc. He also wanted to know how classes, museums, etc. were so he could pass them along to other guests. There are a ton of local restaurants in every price range, and the art museum is just a block away (open late Tuesdays). The workout room was great, and the pool small but servicable. The hot tub and sauna never busy and always warm and inviting. I can't think of a think I would change. The meeting room was also top notch - the catered lunches incredible, there was gold dust on the top of the small cakes provided to us! There were a couple meeting attendees with very specific food restrictions and the hotel bent over backwards to provide them with lovely alternative selections during the week. I will return to the hotel should business ever take me to Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “unflashy but top-quality”
Reviews.Author: Ridges012
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel, the foyer seems small and not particularly glamorous. However, this is entirely unimportant, as the hotel seems to strive to offer the highest possible standard of service. We stayed for five nights, and were very sorry to leave. The room was well appointed and comfortable, with a passageway from the door to the main room, thus minimising external noise. The bathroom was of a generous size, with a beautiful tiled shower and separate bath. Toiletries were regularly replenished, and the towels were huge and enveloping. When we requested one or two items, they were supplied extremely promptly and courteously. Given the fact that we were staying the hotel over the New Year weekend, we expected a lot of noise and disturbance. We received none at all. The reception staff were helpful, and the concierge Natalie is particularly to be commended in making enquiries on our behalf, as well as giving extremely clear directions. There seems to be a fair amount of job sharing going on, so that doormen sometimes double up as concierge, etc., and this seems to work smoothly. We had to check out extremely early (5.30 am), and this went very smoothly; an error in which we had been charged for a bottle of water which we had not consumed was corrected with the absolute minimum of fuss. If you wish to drink tea rather than coffee, they are very happy to supply a water kettle in addition to the coffee maker. The only slight criticism is that the teabag offered has a very strange taste. All in all, we were extremely happy with our stay at the Metropolitan. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and gave the impression of wanting us to be there, and to have an enjoyable time. The hotel is centrally positioned. If we revisited Vancouver, we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: LisaMD20
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel and great staff, so helpful and friendly (especially Cindy). The hotel is located right downtown with many attractions very close by - shopping right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: EH629
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip; the room was pretty standard, the hotel was in a great location, staff were friendly and helpful and wifi was included. Room was clean, Bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OMG excellent!”
Reviews.Author: hatespacking
Reviews.Content: - great experience - staff super friendly and super helpful (especially the Korean female receptionist, sorry forgot her name!) - very clean - have shower and bath - breakfast ok by the way, Vancouver is a great city. great times.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Lolo604
Reviews.Content: As a longstanding fan of the Metropolitan Hotel, it was my first choice when I needed a place to stay 2-3 nights a week for a few months, while commuting to Vancouver for work. The staff is exceptionally helpful and welcoming, the rooms comfortable, the location unbeatable. The Diva restaurant downstairs is well worth a visit, whether or not you are staying at the hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Doug W
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. From the front desk, the concierge and all the staff, they are all so helpful and courteous. We stay there at least once a year and each year it only gets better. The downtown location is great. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a Wonderful Staff and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Richard N
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and loved the hotel. We definitely would stay here again. It had plenty of room and all the amenities. My wife love the large bathroom which had both a shower and a tub. The staff was awesome and the concierge had some great suggestions on restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: touristinmycity
Reviews.Content: we were really looking forward to our stay in Vancouver - we do this every Christmas season. my husband and I checked into the Metro Hotel - the location IS excellent! while i was waiting to take the elevator to our room, suddenly, the bellman crashed into me with the luggage cart, knocking me over! - although he was very apologetic, i was a bit 'stunned'. Later that night, we were told we would have water bottles delivered to our room for the night - but that never happened. our room was freezing at night, i was very cold, but the heat showed it was on....i am guessing it may have been broken. the hotel was having a Christmas party that night (that we were not part of) - and i was kept awake until 3 or 4 in the morning, because our room was on the floor that many of the party guests were staying on . having stayed in many hotels, holding parties, i have never been kept awake at night like this. i think they should have put us on a quieter floor, as i am sure they know what guests are staying for the party. the bathroom , in our room, was also not very clean - the counters were dirty. the breakfast was truly disappointing - the service was good - but the food was actually disgusting - i could not eat it (the toast was cold, and the potatoes smelled bad and tasted worse). I am not too picky, but our stay definitely not what i expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: tanned_happy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a great value in the a fabulous location right downtown. The staff is great, the rooms comfortable with nice bathrooms and it was quiet. Will stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay :O)”
Reviews.Author: RuthajBC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our annual pick for an upscale hotel located right across the street from Pacific Centre and just a short walk from Robson. The staff are all friendly and helpful and make every effort to get things just right. After shopping for hours a soak in the hot tub and dip in the pool was really nice. The newly renovated jr suites are very nice with their separate living and bedrooms, both with their own tvs and a lovely marble bathroom with both shower and soaker tub. They are very nicely decorated in a fresh, contemporary look.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: natchee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business in November and definitely enjoyed my stay! The suite was great and included a very nice bathroom with a separate bath tub/shower and robe; nice little luxuries for a tired traveller. The bed was also HUGE and incredibly comfortable. Staff was very friendly at the hotel and it was in a great location, right across from the Pacific Centre. The only issue I had was the TV didn't work and I completely forgot to mention this to the hotel staff. It wasn't a huge issue for me as I wasn't in the room for TOO long. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Made my first visit to Vancouver memorable”
Reviews.Author: LadyWhy
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I ever visit Vancouver and I was also travelling alone for the first time. The staff at the Metropolitan made my stay very comfortable and memorable; they were very friendly, helpful, and courteous. The hotel itself wasn't too busy at that time of the year, so I got to check in early, plus I got a complimentary upgrade. The room was very clean, spacious, had a nice balcony, and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was my favourite part; had lots of room and a separate bathtub and shower. The location of the hotel is excellent! Close to Skytrain station (only 2 min walk from hotel) and right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. You can walk to most attractions; even Stanley Park is only half an hour walk away. Highly recommend this hotel, would love to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sandra700
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just in front of the Pacific Centre Shopping Center, as well as within walking distance of all the shopping and tourist areas, the Waterfront and it is close to the Canada Line easy access to the airport. The room was spacious, extremely clean and nicely decorated; by the way, all the hotel areas are luxurious. We appreciated the coffee facilities. The health club and the indoor swimming pool were fabulous. The business center was so useful too. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. My husband and I really loved this hotel, we, will probably be back soon. The only problem we found was the high price of the breakfast, but we could solve this by crossing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: IrishDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this beautiful hotel in Vancouver and wished we could have stayed longer. In a great location, about a block from train station that takes you direct to airport. Across the road from a large shopping centre, and close to plenty of great bars and restaurants. Room was lovely, really nice bathroom, large comfortable bed, plasma tv - couldn't fault it. We didn't eat in the hotel so cant comment on food. Staff were excellent, everybody very friendly and helpful. They allowed us a late checkout at no extra cost. The pool area is lovely, glass roof with a great view. Sauna in the changing room with a tv! I couldn't recommend this hotel enough

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: mksiemens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Saturday night get-away. We came into Vancouver on the Sky-train and the hotel was only 2 blocks away. The location is perfect: Everything is in walking distance. Pacific Centre, Shopping, Vancouver Convention Centre (and the ocean!), Resturants, Clubs.. all easy to get to. We walked a few blocks, had dinner, walked a few more and went dancing at a nice club on Granville St. The hotel is very nice inside. It is a bit older but is in perfect condition. We stayed on the top floor in a King Suite: the bed was comfortable, bathroom was huge, and there was a large sun deck that overlooked the city: Beautiful at night. It had rained earlier that day though so the chair was wet so we didn't sit outside, but would be so perfect for sitting together having your coffee/tea in the morning. The hotel was clean and well kept, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bell-boys always open the door for you and greet you, from first thing in the morning until late at night. We went to see the pool but didn't use it, it looked nice. They have a complimentary business centre so you can quickly check on-line to find a resturant you like. There are tons of restuarnts close to the hotel. My only suggestion is that if you want to have water/beverages/snacks in your room, that you bring them in from outside. They sell water ($7/bottle) in-room, which was crazy! I always want to have water on-hand so I just bought a bottle and brought it back to the room with me. Just a note! I would definitely stay here again when planning a night out in Vancouver. It was a perfect place, clean and quiet, and in a great location, and you can find King rooms for great prices! We paid only $144 booking through PriceLine.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Dov A
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Metropolitan Hotel in Vancouver. The stay was excellent. I arrived early and a room was available. The room had been recently renovated and very very comfortable. Great bed and nice washroom. I even had a little balcony with a nice view. Nice pool and whirlpool. The hotel was clean and well taken care of. The location is great, its right across the street from the Pacific Mall and easy walking distance to everything. The best part is the service. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. I will be back. My only complaint was the cost of the room service breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: possum2890
Reviews.Content: We are here as I type this, is a fantastic place, great and helpful staff, close to everything. Nothing to big of a deal A plus

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay and Conference!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: We have recently been travelling across Canada for a National Training session as the conference organizer I deal with many hotels from Halifax to Vancouver and nowhere did we receive better service than the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver! From my first point of contact setting up the conference facilities to organizing rooms, dinner one night a the in house resturant Diva, the front desk, the concierge recomendations there was not one part of this experience that did not run smoothly! Of all the hotels that I stayed at and all the staff that we dealt with this one property is at the top of my list! Thanks to the amazing team at the Metropolitan Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Treated like old friends - warm and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: HipHotelGirl
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about our night at the Met this past weekend. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make us feel as though we were Royalty. We were staying to celebrate our 5th Wedding Anniversary and it seemed as if everyone knew that's why we were there. My husband handled the reservations and said that it was so easy to arrange. I'm pretty sure that our room was upgraded (Thanks!) as we were checked into a two room suite. The room was well appointed, and the linens were incredible. We both slept like a log and managed to sleep in too which was a treat. The attention to detail was much appreciated, including a (personally written) welcome note and treat from the General Manager Mr. Koskela. All of the staff, from the doorman to the breakfast servers were warm and welcoming. Thank you all, we cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1962
Reviews.Content: I just enjoyed another fabulous stay at the Met in Vancouver. The service and the facilities at this boutique hotel are exceptional. The rooms are quiet, spacious and luxurious. It is located close to Pacific Centre and Robson Street shopping, the Skytrain, Chinatown and Gastown. I have yet to be disappointed. I used to stay at various hotels in the city, but I'm loyal to the Met now and can't wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: sue83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Metropolitan and it was great. The hotel is very well situated, right downtown Vancouver close to Stanley park, gastown, canada line etc.. The room is clean, quiet, the bed was comfortable. The service is also exellent. The only reason I did not rate this hotel 5 stars is because of the ridiculous price for parking: 40$ a day!!! It is way overpriced and It is probably worth parking a little farther away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: salutzo
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 nights. It was clean, my king size bed was confortable, the room is not very big but it was perfect for one person in the room. The furnitures and the linen were nice and clean aslo. The hotel is quiet and you can easily work in your room during the day or the night. There is always someone to open the door when you leave or arrive at the hotel. The hotel restaurant is a bit expensive, but it seems it's a very good award winner restaurant. It's in the middle of the city, 3 blocks away from canada place, close to many good restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: grevillia
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the hotel. We arrived from the airport using the transit train and then just had a short one block walk to the hotel, walking easily with our suitcases. Our room was spacious and very clean, the decor was very restful and we slept well. The staff in the Reception area were very friendly and helpful. We wanted a hotel located with easy access to Stanley Park. It was a reasonable 3.6km walk there and all downhill. However, we caught a bus back from the park in the evening with the bus stop conveniently located outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Vancouver by foot or public transit.”
Reviews.Author: platycodon
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location and convience to downtown restaurants, subways, buses, ferries..made it a great first visit to Vancouver. I love being in cities without a car and not missing it in the least. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, and from my research, less expensive then other hotels in the immediate area with a great leval of quality. Felt like we were the only guests there. They don't have much of a lobby area but I wasn't there to hang out in a hotel lobby after all. Restaurant and lounge looked very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to everything downtown!”
Reviews.Author: JenZiel
Reviews.Content: Staying here for 9 days & I got nothing to complain about so far (day 7/9). Located across from pacific center, 5 min walk to robson & skytrain station! Convenient store nearby & lots of restaurant ranging from 5 min to 40 min walk! All hotel employees r friendly & helpful! Wifi is super fast, view from room was great, rooms are roomy (stayed in deluxe room), bed & linens are comfy! Def would stay here again. Hotel also has gym, sauna & hot tub (didn't get to check out cuz didn't bring appropriate clothing).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: Melisa K
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel from the food, pool, workout facility, room, overall service, housekeeping, and concierge was absolutely great. I would recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Vancouver. I'm returning in January and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Vancouver base”
Reviews.Author: beekeeper16328
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan's staff are a strong selling point for this Hotel. From the Concierge team through to the dining room staff all are friendly, helpful and professional. We stayed on the fourth floor in a well appointed and maintained spacious room. Overall a very good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: bestengkc
Reviews.Content: After spending time in remote BC, a weekend in Vancouver spent exploring the city was made even better by staying at the Metropolitan. The price was excellent, service was super and this place is Clean, Comfortable and Classy. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back please?”
Reviews.Author: AlanMeerkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan at the end of August and loved it - the perfect city hotel. Fantastic location (close to Gastown which we visited nightly) and accommodation was lovely, great staff too. Our first time in Vancouver and would go back in an instant. nice to have the pool and jacuzzi to relax in after a day of eating great food and drinking local beer. Foodwise we explored and were more than happy with the chain restaurants Earls and Cactus City Club (the latter was the best I thought) which compared well with some of the more 'boutique' style eateries. Plus all the great breweries like Steamworks. Do try the Six Acre bar just by the statue of Gassy Jack. We hired bikes round Stanley Park, visited Granville Island (more beer!), Grouse Mountain - all the touristy things were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, for sure.”
Reviews.Author: jackarch
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night, but would love to stay here again. Sleek and modern. Just very nice overall. Good location. Nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Joseph R
Reviews.Content: The overall service, accommodation and dining was outstanding. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We only stayed for two nights, but I plan to go back to Vancouver and the Metropolitan would be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: 60pluser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011. It's a newer hotel with friendly helpful staff and free wifi. The rooms are extremely comfortable with large bathrooms and comfortable beds. Short stroll to restaurants on Robson St. or dine in their dining room. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: jcmrbc
Reviews.Content: The service here was excellent at all times. Everyone we encountered was polite and smiling at all times. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting some decent treatment in vancouver for a relatively cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: OADiver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days awhile ago and it was wonderful. Very nice rooms, clean, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area was gorgeous! A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Again full satifaction”
Reviews.Author: 154943Peter
Reviews.Content: On my business trip to Vancouver I stayed again in the Metropolitan Hotel. As usual a very warm welcome, all employees are very friendly and help where ever they can. The room I had #1714 was perfect, well equipped and a nice view. I like the fact that the windows can be opened and the small balcony is nice as well. The ideal place for business down town Vancouver. Free Internet access and nice working place in the room. A great hotel to feel like at home.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F
Reviews.Content: Looked at many hotels in Vancouver before settling on the three nights for two long weekend deal at the Met. Good choice! It was my partner's "big" birthday the day after we arrived and we not only got upgraded to a junior suite but the General Manager, Kari Koskela, helped make the occasion even more special by providing champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate as a surprise. The suite was immaculate, the shower was great and the bed was sooo comfortable. The pool was fine, the jacuzzi and sauna just what you need to relax. All the staff we met were courteous and efficient. You can't beat the location for all the downtown attractions. We liked it so much we returned for another two night stay and were upgraded again. Don't expect an upgrade every time you stay at the Met but do expect 5 star service, certainly while Mr Koskela is the G.M.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Husky20
Reviews.Content: Well located, good room, thoroughly enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip--Will return”
Reviews.Author: Kristy447
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service , and a great weekend. Went to Vancouver for a soccer match and can't wait to return next year. Will definately stay at the Met again. Location gave us many options on things to do. Had breakfast via room service which was delivered promptly and accurately. The Diva lounge was a great place to relax, and while a little pricy, was the first location in town that got my drink right.

Reviews.Title: “great room great service”
Reviews.Author: lou625
Reviews.Content: loved the met! We have stayed at many hotels in Vancouver, this one is now the favorite! The hotel is downtown and close to shopping, skytrain, waterfront.... close to everything Vancouver. Just hop on the skytrain to get to the airport! Always someone to open the door and help you out. Checked in early no problem! Beds are very comfortable and hotel was quiet. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great central city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brickinoz2002
Reviews.Content: Excellant location, excellant room, always somebody to help with information. Highly recommend it for a city break, we had a very pleasant stay. Oh and the Molton Brown soaps are amazing, and grab a light lunch at the the cactus club cafe just a block away!!

Reviews.Title: “meet me at the met!!!”
Reviews.Author: llcmygirls
Reviews.Content: this spot will wow you the minute you walk in the door. the rooms are beautiful with the best in bedding and the shower is awesome. love the towels and more than enough pillows. we got an upgrade right off the bat to two queen beds instead of two twins. the restraurant in house had great breakfast and the bar makes the best lemon drops. didn't have enough time in vancouver. we came to do the whistler bike ride, but we will be back and the metropolitan is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmsasis
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful, nice. They were always there to open doors, help with luggage if needed. The rooms are big - comfortable beds. We liked it a lot. Good location to shops and the waterfront. We walked easily to restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcaro
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights at the Metropolitan. Greeted by professional, friendly staff. On arrival there were staff to help with cases, in fact it is rare that you have to open a door for yourself on entering or exiting the hotel, we often found the staff calling the lifts for us as we walked in the lobby. We stayed in a luxury king room. The room was spacious, clean, the bed comfortable, the bathroom large with an excellent shower. Toiletries provided. There was a coffee maker in the room, and kettle available on request. Tea and coffee provided. The Hotel is very central within easy walking of Robson Street and the Harbour. We walked to Stanley Park from there. We chose to eat in local restaurants, the Joyeaux Cafe and Scoozi's in Howe Street both good for breakfast, and you are spoilt for choice with the number of restaurants in the nearby streets. We would certainly stay here again when next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: NycAlex_k
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with my stay at this hotel in August. They accommodated my early arrival with an available room very quickly. The single king room was well laid out and the bed was quite comfortable. Not overly luxurious as the tv was smallish and had few channels to choose from but I lucked out with good weather and didn't need to stay indoors too much. Only a 5-10 minute walk to Canada Place, and about the same to the metro that is very convenient to the airport. There's a small gym good enough for a short workout as was the pool, along with a hot tub. Didn't try the hotel restaurant but which was recommended by local friends. Overall a good value and great service and I'd stay there again, unless I were wanting to splurge a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Gem in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week and have enjoyed every minute of it from the time we arrived until we leave. I would classify it as a centrally located boutique accommodation close to restaurants, entertainment, shopping, tourist attractions and most important buses and Skytrain stations. All are within walking distances. The Granville station and the City Centre station are just 5 minutes away at a quick pace. Bell boys were friendly, helpful but not intrusive when we arrived. Reception was fast and we loved the large bowl of cherries to welcome us in the room. Housekeeping was very responsive; we requested an electric jug which was delivered within 10 minutes. The concierge was very patient and helpful with our enquiries. The most impressive of all were the front desk staff; they were friendly, courteous and helpful, remembering our names all the time. Nothing was too much trouble, going out of their way to assist. My son managed to book into this same hotel for 2 nights and when they found that it was for his wedding, upgraded his room to a suite. They even helped him booked a last minute holiday package to Las Vegas for his honeymoon on their system, which was better value than what he could get with travel agents outside. In particular we appreciated the extraordinary help and prompt services given by Kelvin & Natasha, very professional, efficient and yet friendly – truly top notch. The bathroom has been refurbished and quite large with separate bath tub and shower recess. The wash basin has plenty of bench space. The room size is alright for two but not as large as one would expect in North America. You can hear a bit of street noise in the morning but it did not bother us. The only drawback we experienced was the smell of tobacco smoke inside the room entrance. When we told the front desk, they immediately offered to swap our room but we did not take up as we’re quite settled in by then. There are two PCs in the business centre for guest to use free of charge. When we got home and found a charge was made to our credit card after checking out, we were annoyed. We contacted the hotel and their accounts department immediately started an investigation telling us it was for Mini Bar charges. When we insisted that we did not consume anything from the Mini Bar, they promptly reversed the debit the next day. Quite satisfied with the outcome. Again the backroom staff had been very responsive. We will definitely stay here if we visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: cnd_vacation_luvr
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding downtown in Vancouver so decided to stay nearby. This hotel was absolutely close to everything.... two blocks from our reception venue. It's right across the street from an entrance to Pacific Centre, a large underground shopping mall with access to Skytrain. Our room was spacious, had a wonderful comfortable bed, with a wonderful view of downtown looking towards the North Shore. The bathroom had lots of room for getting ready and featured Frette linens. The multilingual staff were all friendly and helpful, and we loved the turndown service! The swimming pool and fitness area were a nice oasis on a rainy day. We didn't watch much television, but seeing a old tube television in the room felt out of the place with the overall attention to detail and quality that was evident everywhere else. Nevertheless we had a good stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 854Islander62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Met in Vancouver Sept 8/9 2011. When I arrived the bellman and valet were very, very helpful in securing parking for my over-sized vehicle. Pretty impressive in downtown Vancouver. The staff was enthusiastic, polite and professional. The room was great! Found the whole experience very satisfying. Highly recommend these folks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine E
Reviews.Content: Excellant location, excellant room, always somebody to help with information. Highly recommend it, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing anniversary getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cashmere2402
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday after a fun train ride up from Everett, Wa. The staff was polite and helpful. The hotel is beautiful! Our room was so quiet and comfortable, we will be going back! We used the concierge service to get massages. We were directed to a wonderful place called "Smile Thai Massage." I also recommend them. Bed and furniture were comfortable and easy to enjoy! The bathroom was large and Nice! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay sooo enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BWCJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for 3 nights in August. We loved everything about the hotel and the service was excellent. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dadndoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for two nights and were happy and comfortable. The hotel provided for everything we needed and was central to Vancouver city. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly book that hotel on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, well located”
Reviews.Author: kb111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for 4 nights, on my way to the USA. The service was second to none. Great location,directly over the road, from shopping centre which houses a large food hall. Staff very helpful, and well informed. My room was a good size, very clean, modern large bathroom, bed linen was beautiful. Bed was very comfortable. Very impressed. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Free internet, business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aturkinnola
Reviews.Content: This was my first hotel on a 10 day trip. I had a great weekend deal ( third night free) which made the price very reasonable. Location is good ( but Vancouver is very menagable where ever you stay) . Attention to service is excellent. Rooms are pleasant and the bed is very comfortable. Hotel website said the wi-fi was extra but if you get a free membership at their iPrefer frequent guest program then it is free. Overall no complaints. Vancouver is also a very pleasant city if not overly exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Lacunar
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Metropolitan for 6 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. The room was well decorated and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and modern. The room was well cleaned each day. Our room included the breakfast package, and believe me, their chefs know how to cook breakfast. On top of all this, the hotel is in a perfect downtown location. Everything from Chinatown to Stanley Park was within walking distance. There are also several bus stops within the two blocks around the hotel, making travel to anywhere in the city easy. We couldn't find one thing "wrong" with our stay, and the next time we are in Vancouver, we will be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKoch66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in the downtown area directly across the street from Pacific Center Mall. The staff is excellent and I arrived at midnight and they were ready and prepared as if for a busy shift. The front desk team was terrific and friendly-- the valet as well. While I did not try the Diva restaurant, there are multiple locations to try nearby. Great place to stay only blocks from the waterside and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: notsofrosty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick visit to downtown Vancouver. Wow what a gorgeous city! I had no idea what to expect with the Metropolitan and went solely off reviews. I must say we weren't disappointed at all. The hotel is right in the middle of the city, only a block or so off Robson and a couple blocks from Canada Center. The decor is up to date and the rooms were very clean. We originally booked a junior suite, realizing that we would be getting two rooms for a lower price than a smaller, single room at the Four Seasons, which is across the street. We were notified upon check-in that we had been upgraded because of high occupancy. Upon opening the door, we discovered an enormous two-room suite complete with living room and a separate dining area with a table for eight! The staff is very friendly and courteous. Note that the underground parking is tight so drive slowly!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: wucie
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel in August. Clad in dirty red brick the building isn’t too attractive from the outside and our room on the seventh floor was rather beige and featureless, (and sickeningly looked out over the colourful, fresh, lush, treed terrace of the neighbouring Four Seasons hotel :-) though it was big enough. Service however was helpful and brisk. Uniformed bellhops held doors open, called cabs and whisked cases about, while a concierge was always on hand to provide knowledgeable advice. Location too was perfect, within easy walking distance of Gastown, Robson St, public transport and the Pacific Center Mall was located right next door. Morning papers are complimentary and there is a narrow pool, business and fitness centre (I think I even spotted a squash court) on the third floor. A quibble was that the coffee machine was not restocked with creamer on the second morning. Although somehow lacking character, this is a hotel we would stay at again should we need a more reasonably-priced downtown Vancouver hotel. If money is no object then the Four Seasons did look superb and we can vouch for the Fairmont Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel with Amazing staff...helped us when we had all our belongings stolen”
Reviews.Author: sarah w
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and have nothing but praise for every aspect of the hotel. Our experience of staying in this hotel was truly unbelievable. We arrived after being victims of a horrible theft. Our entire motorhome had been stolen including all our belongings and worst, our children's favourite cuddly toys. With only the clothes on our backs to wear - within 24 hours, the staff in this hotel had done a 'collection' and had been out to the shops to buy clothes and toys for our children. They raised so much money that there was also a gift card for me and my husband. The concierge organised for a free meal for us in a lovely restaurant and all our laundry was done. We were truly overwhelmed by the heartfelt kindness and generosity shown to us during our stay. We are still amazed and enormously grateful for this kindness. The rooms, the service and the food are exceptional. This must be the best place to stay in Vancouver. Thank you. All of you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, knowledgeable and professional service ....”
Reviews.Author: Arcand_Wrights
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night. We found the staff received us warmly and professionally ... arriving tired and I am sure we looked it .... as we were quietly and swiftly checked in and taken to our rooms. The room ended up being a suite .... I've stayed in my share of suites ... but none have been as warmly or smartly decorated. As a professional, travelling with my family, this is where we will stay when we come back to the coast. Walking distance to everywhere in downtown Vancouver - a few blocks from the harbour. I would definately choose this hotel again - as a professional or travelling with my family. LOVED Vancouver .... and who would not when the sun shone for 8 days!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Horst F V
Reviews.Content: the rooms,the amneties,the service,the pool & fitness area resemble more a 5star hotel than a 4 star hotel. Very nice, comfortable place in the center of downtown Vancouver.Just the lifts are a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “OMG LOVED IT. Make sure to book through Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: terriccha46
Reviews.Content: Make sure you book through www.hellobc.com. Got an amazing price and the hotel is amazing. We did eat dinner in the restaurant and it was ok but the second night we went out the front door took a left then another left at the first cross street then down two blocks to eat at a bistro on the opposite side of the street. Has outdoor dining and is easy to find. The food there was amazing and much more affordable. Anyway, back to the hotel. The bed was amazing, avoid the honor items $$$ and get free coffee on floor 3 in the am. Floor 3 is also the lap pool, spa and weight room as well as the library and business center. This is by far the nicest place we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: emanempress
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights after our Alaskan cruise - a perfect place to unwind. The room was very clean and contemporary with adjustable air-con, completed with a beautiful bathroom. Free use of the internet in the business centre. Good swimming pool, jacuzzi, fitness room and squash court - excellent facilities. Situated near the main shopping street on Robson and within sight of the cruise ship terminal. Staff were plentiful and very pleasant. The consierge was the most helpful I have ever known. In all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: blairsvillegal
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Metropolitan Vancouver immediately after our Seward to Vancouver Inside Passage cruise. Since the hotel is very close to the cruise ship port, it was very convenient for us. Also, it is a great location downtown. From the time we arrived at this hotel until we were in our cab heading to the airport to fly home, this hotel provided us with one of our most pleasant travel experiences. We arrived at the hotel around 9 AM expecting to have to store our luggage until we could check in. We were happily surprised to find our rooms were ready for us. Also, when they realized that we had booked rooms with twin beds, they offered us a room with a King size bed which we greatly appreciated. The large rooms were nicely furnished with comfortable beds and bedding, a Roman tub and a shower, and lots of "green" amenities. The concierge was very helpful and suggested that we make use of one of the bus services that provides "all day hop on and hop off " tours through China Town, Granville and Stanley Park. We chose the Big Pink Sightseeing Bus which contributes one dollar from each ticket towards the Canadian Breast Cancer Foundation. This was a great experience. The concierge also made sure that we were able to get a cab that would accomodate all of our suitcases. We chose not to eat at the hotel's restaurant, but it looked very good. We wanted to eat in China Town. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bang in the centre of town.”
Reviews.Author: JoyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this ideal city hotel. The hotel has valet parking, a concierge and many porters. We had a good sized room with a small balcony( bombed by birds you know what! ) The room itself was very good, up to date with all modern technology, including I pod console. The king sized bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was excellent, of a very high standard. It's a hotel that's probably a little more suited to the business traveller than a tourist, but the perfect central location makes it good for both. The hotel breakfast is served and is a bit expensive for what you get. The hotel has a gym and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: noting bad to say at all. we had a deluxe double room. grate view wit balcony. mini bar ect. free internet on the business floor. pool gym. we loved it. you get what you pay for! the resterunt was very nice. but at the same time an inquired taste. but again very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: hypedaj
Reviews.Content: Close to everything in downtown Vancouver Wonderful service Rooms are clean and spacious Overall, probably one of the best hotels I've stayed in for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge and best restaurant in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Cussons
Reviews.Content: Yes, everytime I stay at the Met is the same story. I get greeted warmly. By name. The Chief Concierge, Mr. Oliver Ng, and his team are always in hand to give ready to provide you with the best advice. What's cooking in the city? They know. Speaking of food, this happens to be another wonderful thing to bear in mind about the Metropolitan. Diva at The Met, the hotel's restaurant has recently been rated as one of the top eating places in town. Pacific Rim with a strong Mediterranean flavour I guess. Everything about it is magnificent. The way it arrives to you, beautifully presented. The amazing freshness of the ingredients. The blending of culinary cultures; Pacific Rim with a subtle touch of Mediterranean (almost Catalan!) i it. Nothing like it. Quite perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Ranavan
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Metropolitan in a Junior King Suite and loved it. Hotel is very clean. Staff was very courteous and friendly. Room was awesome. Separate living room and bedroom. Bathroom was spacious (had to be careful with bathroom door as it kept getting stuck.) Two small balconies overlooked Howe St. and the Four Season Swimming pool. Bed was very comfortable. Separate shower stall and bath tub were a nice touch. Loved that they had large flat screen t.v.s Hotel is right across from Pacific Centre Mall and a block from Robson Street. Easy walk to Davie St., Yaletown, Gastown as well as easy to get to Aquabus to go North Van or Gransville Island. Parking is expensive. More than other hotels we have stayed at but we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: silviahg
Reviews.Content: I stay here for four nights in august. Great location in the center. You can walk every place. No breakfast was available but there are a lot of restaurants to choose. The staff was nice. They left some pastries as it was my anniversary. Parking very expensive but it is the city center. My husband and me enjoyed here!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kerry B
Reviews.Content: Great stay.Staff were extremely helpful,nothing was a problem. Great location,close to shops,transport,cafes etc. Room was good,balcony a bonus. Would recommend this to anyone wanting to be close to all Vancouver has to offer as well as being reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kandykrista
Reviews.Content: The staff is very very very helpful and friendly. The room is beautiful and clean. It is in a great location next to shops and restaurants. I will stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes luxury without paying too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great room”
Reviews.Author: EllenAndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while in Vancouver with our young teen boys and stayed in a Junior Suite. It was quite large and comfortable for the 4 of us. The staff at the hotel were gracious and accommodating. My husband and I enjoyed having our own room and the boys slept comfortably on the pullout couch. The bed was very comfortable and we slept quite well. We were close to Robson Street and the hotel was convenient to anywhere we went. The hotel was very clean with contemporary decor. We'd stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Centrally Located Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camogli46
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel in the centre of Vancouver, close to Canada Place, restaurants, shops. Good service from the Concierge. Would stay here again if I was in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the problem, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelbug3371
Reviews.Content: We were 4 female family members staying for a special weekend. I booked a suite which had a pullout bed. I was hesitant but vaguely remember being told they had just renovated with new couches. I thought it'd be more fun to stay together. The first night on the pullout (I drew the short straw), was terrible. Neither myself nor my cousin slept at all. It was a thin mattress and I could feel the bed frame through it. It was also slightly on a slant. I went downstairs the next morning. I was transferred to the manager Stephanie who was lovely. She told me they were sold out (we were considering getting two individual rooms). She offered to get housekeeping to put a foamy on top and extra padding. A bottle of wine appeared in the room with an apology note. Many of the staff asked how things were. The next night was much better. It was like day and night. I was told I was the first one to complain about the new pullouts but they didn't have them very long. I have a sneaking suspicion that they may have even went and got a foam topper for me somewhere as the first front desk lady to phone housekeeping was told they did not have any foam toppers. The situation was handled with class and attention, above what I expected. I have stayed at this hotel many times and always enjoy coming back. The rooms are clean and well appointed. I love the Moulton Brown bath products. The location of the hotel is hard to beat. The Diva restaurant is handy and I love getting a quiet drink here after I arrive. The valet parking is quick and efficient. I would definitely stay here again. P.s. The regular beds are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanc0uver_Vacati0ner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel. It was located downtown, so we were very close to the action of the city. The hotel itself was very fancy The doormen were very helpful, always opening doors, hailing taxis, and sometimes even pushing the elevator button! The room was extremely clean, well-maintained, and felt luxurious. We also rented a zipcar one day and it turns out there was a zipcar pickup right in the parking lot, which was extremely convenient. The only complaint I had was that the room was a little dark and our hotel faced an office building so we had to keep the privacy screens closed so that they weren't looking into our room, which meant even less light. Also, the pool was just a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Far from my favorite hotel I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: ascanada
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver with a girlfriend in March, and stayed at the Metropolitan for three nights. We picked this hotel because the price was right (we purchased our voucher on Expedia), and the location was right downtown, in the thick of things, like we wanted, as we didn't intend to rent a car. The hotel looks nice from the outside, and is grand, but very dated. Service is great at this place, people holding doors for you, etc., but it really feels as if they nickle and dime you for every little thing. The lobby is pretty, but the decor is in desperate need of a revival. The elevators are shaky, and scratched up. The public areas (pool, change rooms, sauna, etc) did not live up to my expectations from the website. They are all dated as well, and they weren't as clean as I would expect in a hotel like this. Our room was okay, nothing special. The bathroom was large, with a tub (which we didn't use) and a shower, and a huge counter space but I felt much of the space was wasted. Our room was small, so having so much space in the bathroom felt a little bit like a poor use of space. We also had problems with the toilet, and the man that came up to plunge it for us told us that this is a regular occurrence in this particular hotel. We had two single beds in our room, not too comfortable, all of the electronics in the room were old. The mini-bar items were very pricey. I would absolutely not go back to this hotel. It was not at all what I expected, a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “NEAR THE BEST ATTRACTIONS, VANCOUVER COULD OFFER”
Reviews.Author: fileman5
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over a weekend for a trip and was so close to Gastown, Robsonstrasse, and the Staduim am happy I picked this one rather than others. Also the bellboy told me where to walk after hours and where to not go so I do not get caught in the problem areas after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Location Try for a Discount”
Reviews.Author: Prarie-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a family wedding. All of us had extended family staying with us so 7+ families with 2-4 members in each room and each family had 3-4 rooms. We had a discounted rate ($150.00/night) we could ( a couple of families)have rented a B and B house for slightly less but visiting with family was a must. Quiet,clean,upscale hotel. front desk very accomodating. On occaissons when I would have used the concierge he was busy and unable to break away to indicate how much longer he would be. It appeared cruise ships used this hotel for their client's hence the continuous stream of guests. Possibly hotel/front desk could moniter this situation and graciously step in to assist?Front desk can directly view the concierge desk. Lovely Vietnamese restaurant down the street for quick pick up meals(breakfast ,lunch, dinner) also wonderful location to try other delightful restaurants and coffee shops. You really are downtown, close to Art Gallery and shopping, delightful location. Let the valets park your vehicle, very tight drive to parking garage. We somehow had scrapes on our wheel wells, should have paid to have them park. View out windows was another hotel downtown, so blinds drawn for most part . Able to walk most places or quickly hail a cab. As a note we have 6 members in our family and no taxi or van would have taken more than 4. When we asked about a six seater van/limo the front desk called and said yes it would be no problem.(WE gave plenty of notice day before). When the van arrived they told us they could only take 4. Had to get to wedding so split up party, not happy with mis-information. Have they never had to call or indicate to guests before about numbers in cabs/vans?? Lovely pool, exercise location. Good use of WI/Fi room if you did not bring laptop/tablet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect End to a Long Trip”
Reviews.Author: PPSEA
Reviews.Content: After arrivng in Vancouver after a 192 mile bike ride from Seattle it was awesome to check in and head straight to the hot tub! From the extremely efficient check-in to the last farewell, the staff were all professional, firendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the newly renovated suites which I would highly recommend. The hotel is ideally located in downtown Vancouver and within walking distance of all major attractions. We showed up on our bikes and were treated the same as if we had arrived in a limo..... Great first impression!! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “First class!”
Reviews.Author: haroldthedog
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (late 20's) have just spend 4 nights here. Service (both reception and concierge) have been first class! Nothing has been too much trouble. Each afternoon we asked Doug for some eating ideas and having picked one he would book the table for us, followed by giving us some coupons and directions. Room was really nice, cleaned to a very high standard each day and elegantly decorated. The jacuzzi, pool and gym were really nice and never particularly busy. Hotel is ideally located. 20-25 minute walk to Stanley Park, 35-40 minute walk to Granville Island, 1 minute walk to London Drugs store which has all basic needs like water, milk, cirsps etc and 10 mins max to all the best restaurants. I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Ride188
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for our stay at the Metropolitan and the staff was able to get is in. The staff was cheerful and eager to help. They went out of their way to provide secure storage for our bikes. We made great use of the hot tub, pool and athletic facilities. The view from the Athletic facilities was first rate. Our suite was wonderfully appointed, modern and more comfortable then home. It was our best stay ever in Vancouver, we loved the Met and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to stay in downtown Vancouver - business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1962
Reviews.Content: Great location. Luxurious rooms. Excellent service and amenities. I have stayed at many properties downtown and this one is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: SFHotelero
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for three nights and had a very busy schedule. Everyone on property was warm, courteous and attentive. I was waiting on several packages and every time they were delivered to my room without even asking. Everyone from the front desk, concierge, room service to housekeeping were sincerely warm and professional.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Colts_Fan_44
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here twice during a week-long trip to Vancouver/Victoria B.C. I especially liked the doorman, who was always ready to open the door for you as you were entering or exiting the hotel. The room was very nice and elegant, with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was large, with a bathtub and a separate shower. The staff was helpful and hospitable. Check in/check out was very easy. The concierge helped in making restaurant reservations for us. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of a nearby mall, as well as coffee shops, and other local retail stores.
