Parking is below the hotel, and you can choose to self park or use valet parking. On our next trip to Vancouver, we will more than likely stay at the Metropolitan Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jmeyersforeman
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location for walking around the downtown area of Vancouver - everything is just a short walk. We arrived at the Vancouver airport, took the Canada Line to the downtown station, and had a short 2 block walk to the hotel, it couldn't have been more convenient. the room, was spacious enough, we didn't spend a lot of time there, it was well taken care of, clean, and very comfortable. the bathroom was large with a walk in shower, and great light for putting on make-up! the staff in the restuarant and hotel were friendly, helpful and efficient. All and all it is a great place to stay while visiting Vancouver. www,jmeyersforeman.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed the hotel, the service, everything and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: joraymond
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. The room service is perfect; cleaning in the morning and night, little attention such as fruits in the room, chocolate, San Pelligrino, etc. The amenities were of very good quality. The personnel were polite and professionnal. The room was also perfect: the size, the quality of the furniture, etc. For sure, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: mwhitmoe
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and wanted to find a hotel that was not horribly expensive. I found the metropolitan at a rate that was 35% cheaper than many of the luxury hotels in the area. I found it to be a great value. The rooms are very clean. My only complaint was that despite requesting a room as high as possible, or at least one with a view, I was placed on the 5th floor staring into another part of the building. Oh well. Cindy was the my chambermaid, and she was so very friendly and conscientious, as well as being a 20 year employee. Impressive! One other minor issue was a long wait at the front desk when checking in. Only one person was on duty and there was another issue related to a guest. No biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Dec2010Visitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location in the middle of downtown. The restaurant is pretty good (fine dining) but the rooms are a bit tired and the staff, although not rude, are a bit on the indifferent side. We requested two wake up calls - first one failed to come through and the second one came through early. One of the elevators was broken and took two days to fix - in the meantime it took an exceptionally long time to go up and down between the street and the rooms. I was staying at this property for a business meeting - the meeting spaces were also a little sub-par. On average I would say my stay was OK, but not great. There is a newly renovated and expanded hotel next door (Rosewood Hotel Georgian), which is beautifully done with an exceptional restaurant (Hawksworth) - Met will need to pick up its game to compete!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: CGray0222
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fabulous weekend at this hotel! The rooms are surprisingly spacious for a downtown hotel. Everything was very clean, modern and super-comfortable. The staff was especially hospitable and friendly. The location is perfectly centered between everywhere you want to go!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!! Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: thebethe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel one night before boarding our cruise ship to Alaska. This hotel was truly excellent. Not only is it gorgeous but the staff when out of our way to accomodate us, help us with directions, etc. The room was very clean and was very large with a nice view. The hotel's location is probably the best part. It is a short walk from the skyrail station, so from the airport we just rode the skyrail and then walked the short block to our hotel. Also, it was only a couple blocks away from Canada Place where we caught our cruise ship. AND it was only a few blocks from the fun GasTown area which is fun part of town with bars, restaurants and a lot of history.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JohnM8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July 2011, and report as follows; Location: excellent / near centre of town Decor: modern /marble floors/ swish Rooms: beautiful! / Quite large / clever design with rotruding windows/ bathrooms super. Bar/restaurant: part of the hotel / very modern / beautiful / great for a drink before going out on the town / meet friends / restaurant looks lovely / could be pricy Lobby: marble / classy / nice. You will feel that you have arrived at a nice hotel. Smart doorman very attentive. Internet: yes / free in the business centre Has pool and fitness centre but did not use Final opinion: quiet pricy but stay here to treat yourself to a lovey hotel. Hard to get into as very popular. Book early with Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Lady_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here on a whim after getting a good online deal and found it to be a wonderful 5 star hotel experience. We arrived from the airport 4 hours before check in and were given a room right away. The room was very large, luxuriously furnished and had a large, clean and elegant bathroom. Equal to any 5 star hotel I have stayed in previously. The room-service was pricey, but not overly expensive and was delicious (we both had the cheeseburger). During our stay I was also struck ill and the hotel sent up a hot water bottle and kettle for my comfort. Located downtown in a good location for touristing. All in all, a perfect hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cheekychic1964
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of our tour of the Canadian Rockies and Alaska. The service was excellent, the room was spacious and immaculate and most of all, the bed and pillows were comfy!! The hotel is situated near many good bars and restaurants as well as shopping centres, so there's plenty of things to do and places to spend your hard earned Canadian dollars. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Metropolitan again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations and overall reat experience!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine34102
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this terrific hotel in a perfect location. The entire staff was particularly warm, welcoming, and efficient. When we checked in, we mentioned that this was a surprise birthday trip for my husband. Sabrina, the duty manager, later sent champagne and a lovely fruit tart to our room...truly "above and beyond!"

Reviews.Title: “Central and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: davidkenny617
Reviews.Content: The Meropolitan was well located for central downtown Vancouver - close to the harbour, the best shops, the art galleries etc. Reception seemed genuinely interested in us as people and upgraded us to a penthouse suite where snow capped peaks could be glimpsed between the high rise skyline. The Diva restaurant seemed a centre for local people and we enjoyed an evening meal where local Canadian wines were suggested to compliment the various courses.For breakfast we were presented with a proper menu rather than the usual breakfast bar -it was good to be served and we could not fault the choice or quality. The Metropolitan was chosen for us - it wasn't overtly grand or glitzy but it had the knack of making us feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It met all my expectations. It is in a central location with close access to everything! From drugstore (London Drugs is a block and half way for you to get snacks, water, etc.), metro (Granville station and Vancouver City Center station), food (for example, there is a food court in the lower level across the street if you go into Pacific Center, restaurants are all around, there's a supermarket called marketplace with hot food/salad bar about 10 minutes walk), and tour stops (Hop on Hop off tour stop is half a block away). Shopping on Robson is also just walking distance. If you do take the train from the airport, it is so easy and you get off at the City Center station. The room is very clean, the bed is super fluffy and comfortable, the hotel staff is courteous and so helpful (especially Sabrina at the front desk and Oliver who is the concierge), and it was amazingly quiet for a city hotel (walls are thick I never heard my neighbors, no kids running around hallways). I highly recommend this place. I definitely will return if I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ryanandtina
Reviews.Content: Don't look any further for a great hotel in downtown Vancouver. Not only are you close to shopping, the art museum, great restaurants and transit to get you anywhere you need to go but the hotel is classy,clean, the beds amazingly comfortable and the staff will go out of their way to please you. I really can't say enough positive things about this newly renovated,chique, boutique hotel. Also if you're looking for a nice place to dine on well presented,delicious seafood check out Coast restaurant just a few minutes walk around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: DWD2723
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotle with wonderful staff and a great location. This is the place to go when starting or returning from a Cruise. Thank you all very much.

Reviews.Title: “It was marvelous and hope to be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: imiselinos
Reviews.Content: Me, my 11-year-old son and my parents stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed each moment from the very first minute. Location is perfect; walking distance to Gastown, Canada Place and Robson Street. Staff is so kind and gentle, always helpful and smiling. Very clean and spacious rooms. Comfortable beds. What else can one ask for? Definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and hope to be back soon myself...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mattpsu77
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver for a 2 day stay after our cruise from Alaska. The minute we drove up to the hotel, we were greeted by two bellmen who immediatey welcomed us, unloaded our luggage from the cab and advised us to register, go to the room and they would deliver our luggage - which they did immediately. The service when we registered was outstanding. They could not have been more accomodating, pleasant and nice. The rooms were beautiful, large and equiped with all the luxuries you would expect. Our concierge, Kurt, was above and beyond and gave us recommendations for restaurnts that were spot on. The hotel is located in an area where walking anywhere is easy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tracey011
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute and were looking for a central hotel. We found the Metropolitan to be fabulous. Spotlessly clean, professional, courteous staff, comfortable bed, lots of space and well appointed bathroom. Great location for exploring the city - lots of cafes and restaurants on the door step and easy walk to most attractions. On the package we booked we received free parking which was a bonus - but we did book only the day before! Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice; Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: MustangSally01
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for one night by Rocky Mountaineer railways on a trip fro,m Vancouver BC to Calgary via rail. Had never heard of the hotel before. Smallish hotel but rooms very clean and open feeling. Very secure parking and security and super service.. Since it's a boutique hotel they know who comes and goes and I really like that.. We left out car for 7 days... not cheap but very secure... The room we had had a great view and a luggage storage area that reminded me of the train cars of old... a wooden cabinet area right inside the entry door to unpack belongings. Nostalgic without being old or outdated!! Not huge rooms but decent size . Very comfortable stay. Pleasantly surprised!! I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: anngre
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a deluxe room for the three nights of our stay. It was spacious, spotlessly clean and had a lovely, large marble bathhroom. The staff were efficient, courteous and helpful in every way. They made our 30th wedding anniversary very special. The hotel is situated in the centre of the city, a block away from the Art Gallery, a few minutes' walk from thequay side and surrounded by shops. A taxi rank is directly outside. We would certainly stay there again if we were to revisit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobInKent51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the cruise line terminal but far away enough to be away from the crowds. The staff is impeccable, and the hotel has great ammenities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We'll definitely be staying there again when we vacation in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karan19
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel if you are travelling to Vancouver. Location is great, walking distance to everything in downtown. Rooms are very nicely appointed and with great amenities. Great staff with superb service. Room service and the restaurant were First Class. The hotel has a beautiful gym with an indoor swimming pool. Overall a great experiece and icertainly reccomended to anyone travelling on business or leisure to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “All That We Expected......And More!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaGirl52
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel the Metropolitan turned out to be. From concierge to room to service, excellent in every aspect. The Diva restaurant lived up to it's reputation and more. We would not hesitate to recommend the Met and Diva to anyone visiting Vancouver and we very much hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: johnjanly
Reviews.Content: Wonderful starting point for our cruise to Alaska. Terrific room, friendly and helpful staff, restaurant and lounge enjoyable. Very nice touch to include champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries to celebrate of our 45th wedding anniversary. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BadgerBlind
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Metropolitan for an entire week. The location is ideal, and the hotel's great restaurant, Diva, is another draw. But perhaps what I enjoyed the most was the highly-personal service of the staff--from the bellmen, to the front desk, to the maids, to the room service. For me, this hotel strikes a perfect balance: the amenities and services of a large hotel with the personal touch of a boutique. Needless to say, this will be my new "pied-a-terre" in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: Romangirl79
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Clean and spacious room, big and luxurious bathroom, and it's conveniently located, only 10' walking from water street and with easy access to the airport, station waterfront of the skytrain only 5' minutes away. The breakfast was good, i had the european one with ham and cheese and yogurt. Some friends of mine had a problem with the breakfast, cause the coupon we had was for a room, but they wanted it for every person. At the end i explained that our tour guide had organized it with the hotel receptionist, and they Let us go, but i think they should organize it better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service as always”
Reviews.Author: acornford
Reviews.Content: This hotel continues to provide the best service and friendly atmosphere of any hotel in Vancouver. Location downtown is close to everything and the quality of the rooms and food (both room service and Diva restaurant) is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed!”
Reviews.Author: yorick2
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable markup on laundry! Charged over £100 for a poor job on 3 shirts, 2 slacks, 8 pr socks & underpants. Staff just laughed and agreed it was costly when I complained. I later stayed in a Lodge in Banff where I could do my own laundry for $1.75! The hotel had warned about construction nearby, but said this would not affect us. What they omitted to mention were the early morning deliveries to the construction site which were very noisy. Our room was overlooked by an office block, meaning the blinds had to be down most of the time. The view was also of a concrete wall. We requested a different room, but were told only a lower floor on the front was available, which was likely to be noisy. We stayed on floor 11. We will not stay here again, such a contrast to all the other places we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayfair46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise and three nights post cruise. Great central city location. Clean rooms, lovely bed- linen and towels and the room was cleaned to a high standard. Extremely helpful concierge who gave us many details for visiting Stanley Park and other places. We requested a kettle for our room - coffee machine was there but we drink tea - and this was delivered within five minutes. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was nice and huge!”
Reviews.Author: Kahanalei
Reviews.Content: What really stood out for us about our room was definitely the bathroom - it was most certainly the nicest bathroom at a hotel we ever stayed in, spotless and the size of it was huge. We were here for two nights and stayed on the 17th fl in a room that had two twin sized beds. The view from the room was of other high-rises and office buildings - at times I felt a bit uncomfortable since you could clearly see people working in the building that was right across, and I'm sure they could see you as well, but in reality, I'm certain the people working there could care less and we just closed the curtains when we were ready to go to sleep. We didn't bother to eat or drink any of the drinks or snacks that were provided at the bar, since it was for obvious reasons way overpriced. For example, the AERO chocolate bar was priced at $4, but at a nearby grocery store, it's sold for $0.99. We were surprised though, that the water that was provided there was not complimentary. I knew the mineral and carbonated waters wouldn't be free, but I at least expected the non-mineral and non carbonated waters to be free, but it was not. It's good and helpful to note that if you do want bottled water here, you will have to ask for it, and they will bring a couple of bottles to you room, during the turn down service. Their is ICE, but it doesn't appear to be on every floor, as we had to go to the 16th fl to get some, but there were three elevators so that was not a problem. The staff that we encountered here were all friendly and helpful. Checking in and checking out was easy. We didn't visit the pool or the fitness room, as we were tired when we got to the hotel and were out and about during our short time in Vancouver. I wanted to initially check out the restaurant here, but ultimately we felt it was a bit expensive and as such we went elsewhere to eat, so I'm not able to comment on it. I didn't know this until it was time to check out, but don't make the same mistake like we did and listen to the music channel - I had no idea that they charge you for that, at all, seriously. It's a good thing we only listened to it for around 7-10min, as upon checkout, we were told that we were going to be charged for around $11 or so for listening to it. Thankfully, I explained in all honesty that I didn't know that it wasn't free to listen to the music, and they waived the charges, so we really appreciated that gesture. If I ever come back to Vancouver again, I would stay at this hotel again, as we had a pleasant and positive experience here. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: RuthBaum
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is located right in the centre of downtown Vancouver, but the rooms are quiet and spacious, and the attention to service and detail is superb. Staff are friendly, courteous and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaOdie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days, booked as a package with our hotel through Expedia. I don't know the exact price we paid for the hotel portion, but it seemed quite inexpensive compared to other hotels booked separately. The staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful. Doormen were always there to open the doors for us and a staff member often rushed over to press the elevator button for us before we reached the elevators. The decor seems a bit older, but the place is very well maintained and clean. The rooms were nice. Note that if you choose a room with two beds, these are *twin/single* beds. We were aware of this when booking. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom had a large tub and separate glass-enclosed shower. The towels were large and fluffy. The location was great, directly across the street from the Pacific mall, less than a block from the skytrain station, and about 5-7 minutes walk to the Vancouver Convention Centre and the waterfront. I have no complaints about this hotel. It was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: CarolC4
Reviews.Content: Every staff member within the entire hotel was pleasant, professional, efficient and courteous. The services and 'small things' like free wireless made my stay extremely pleasant. I've been in a number of hotels on business in the past 3 months and this was by far the best experience I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great, a well kept hotel with a very dated room”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryBoy
Reviews.Content: I actually commute to Vancouver daily but live far enough away that my wife and I regularly spend a night downtown and mix business with pleasure. We've stayed at several 4 stars hotels in the downtown core and I would say this is in the middle of the pack much nicer than a Marriott or a Coast property but not quite as nice as the Hyatt or the Westin Grand. We got a pretty good deal on Travelocity using what I call their blind booking feature (if you're curious about term look it up on Twitter @blindbooking). Our initial impression of the hotel was great, as other people have commented the location is superb. It's across the street from the Pacific Centre shopping centre, the Vancouver Art Gallery and the Canada Line and within a few blocks of most of the citie's theatres. We were working at an event at The Centre theatre and it was less than a ten minute walk to get there. Door men and check in staff were very friendly and efficient and we were on our way up to our room in no time. We almost always book our rooms using a blind booking website so we are used to getting the most basic room and were not surprised to find ourselves right by the elevator in a king bed room. I had a love hate relationship with the room. The good: Huge marble bathroom with a large shower separate from the tub. My wife loved the fact that there was a large vanity area with a stool and make up mirror that she took advantage of. We loved the fluffy bathrobe but there was only one! The room was quite spacious and well laid out. There was plenty of room for the king sized bed, a desk and a table and two chairs that would be very convenient for in room dining. Our room also had a small step out balcony that overlooked the pool area of the Four Seasons across the street. There was also plenty of glassware that we appreciated. There were glass tumblers, wine glasses, real ceramic coffee mugs and a cork screw. A small thing but much appreciated by us. The mediocre: The bed was okay but not the comfiest and neither of us liked either of the pillow options. The room was clean but very dated. The carpet was ancient and actually bunched up in areas, it clearly needs to be replaced. We never watch tv when we travel but the ancient old tube televsion and ugly stand looked very out of place in a high end hotel. Sounds were also an issue; although not obtrusive, we could hear the regular ding of the elevator as it stopped at our floor. I was also woken by the sound of voices from the room next door in the morning. The room we had looked nothing like those on the hotel's website but it sounds like most of the rooms have been updated and are much nicer. You might wonder why I gave four stars consider my complaints but I am factoring in the fact that I got a great deal. As well the location really is superb, the staff were nice and the bathroom was on par with those at the Westin Grand and the Pan Pacific. A quick note on parking, with tax it came to $40.00 a night (we didn't pay it but I asked). We parked three blocks away by the library (well worth a visit) meter parking by the library was $2.50 an hour and it's free from 10pm to 9:00am. Depending on your schedule you may want to go this route and save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a well-kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: mphopkins99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on business. Definitely a modern feel to the decor. Lobby area is small. Bar and restaurant very attractive, didn't eat there, but had a few trips to the bar and the waitstaff were very attentive and professional. Free wireless worked with no issues. Room is a decent size and everything was very clean. Minor complaint is that my mattress was pretty well shot. Very good location, within walking distance of train station and many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “THis should be a 5 Star NOT a 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: carlitguy
Reviews.Content: We used the SkyTain to go downtown from the airport and it is only about a 100 paces away from the City Centre terminal. We were greeted by the doorman and the front counter check in was quick and friendly. We had a King bed on the 7th floor and it was large and super clean. The bathroom had to be seen as it was very large and spotless. There are tons of restaurants within walking distance and it became a chore to decide which one to eat at. We got a discounted rate and thought they would give us a lousy room. Boy were we wrong! Highly recommend! Used the parking garage as well and the elevator to the lobby was appreciated. They have free internet and printer on the third floor. Definitly will stay here again! Dean in Canada

Reviews.Title: “The best option in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tchelooh
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly, them room is big and clean. I'll be back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissiel
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay here when we're in Vancouver. Rooms are very nice, and the service is excellent! They have the best concierge, he can arrange anything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Herm0sa
Reviews.Content: Barely a block from the Canada Line which makes travel from the airport inexpensive and easy, the hotel is within easy walking distance to all of the downtown sights such as Robson St., Gastown, and Chinatown. The rooms are nice (although not very large) with very nice bathrooms, and impeckably clean. Staff are vey courteous and helpful. The concierge even gave us passes to the Yale Club (a music venue) and drove us there in the hotel car, which saved us over $40 and gave us a great evening. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfortable With Excellent Location and Restaurent”
Reviews.Author: frenderio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located and features an excellent restaurant Diva. The service is friendly and helpful. The rates are also excellent for a hotel of this calibre in the heart of Vancouver. I highly recommend it and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “On A Spring Break & It Really Felt Like A Break!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasoo
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for an overnight stay in Vancouver with my two kids over spring break. We all had a great stay at the Metropolitan from start to finish. Valet parking and help to the room. I booked the suite with the separate master bedoom. Two TV's a must !! No arguing over movies or gaming :) Huge windows and lots of natural light. Less hassle for me (mom). Each time we left we were welcomed back by friendly staff and treats in the room for everyone. By our evening return the beds were all ready, dimed lights & soft music greeted us upon entering our suite. The beds are extremely comfortable & I was really tempted to stay another night but had other plans. Great location, across from Pacific Centre, we could walk to all kinds of shopping and restaurants. Then took a short drive to Granville Island to the Toy Market and played some tennis. Great time!! I will definately stay there again, and plan relax in their pool :)

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: just_me123_11
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Metropolitan Hotel in downtown Vancouver. I got a great deal on a room. The room was very clean and comfortable. I did not hear the construction that was going on near the hotel. The gym could be a bit bigger with a few more treadmills but overall it was good. The only drawback I thought was the adjacent restaurant while good, is expensive. It would be nice to have a cheaper option say for breakfast. There are lots of restaurants in the area though so consider going out.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: kak883
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, the rooms are lovely. Great staff, both in the hotel and in the restaurant - all the staff I interacted with went out of their way to be helpful, including accomodating my request for an early check-in and a late check-out, and providing unsolicited assistance to my cab driver when he obviously did not understand my destination instructions. The staff at this hotel looks after its guests in a 5-star way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: swordibis
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great city. I only wish the British could match the kind of friendly and genuine service routinely received here. Perfect location for Downtown Vancouver. Great rooms. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Sylish, Well Appointed, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jillthomas
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a business meeting. The rooms are really funky and cool with sliding doors to the big bathroom. Really great choice if you are looking for something out of the ordinary with a stylish vibe. It feels imaginative and boutique while having all the services you expect from a nice business hotel. The business centre is actually roomy and functional. The service was perfect and the bed was comfortable. Liked the ipod dock and flat screen TV. Lots of room to move around and great bathroom with nice shampoo and soaps. The pool and hot tub are amazing! The meeting rooms are stylish - a nice break from boring a corporate meeting rooms. Great high speed wireless. The restaurant is amazing as well. The lounge is a comfortable place for an after meeting drink or morning meeting with coffee. There is a comfy lounge area as well as dining room. The food is great! Don't miss the pulled pork tacos with fois gras. Wow!!!! Make sure to eat here. Then make sure to go to the Joyeaux Cafe just down the street for cheap great asian noodle bowls!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlmca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful night away at Metropolitan Hotel. We were impressed with the hotel. The room was beautiful and clean. It was a very relaxing atmosphere and I'd have to say it was probably the best sleep I've had in a long time. The location was great as well. We were in walking distance of all our destinations for the weekend. The front office staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all, it was a great experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: GroperSeattle
Reviews.Content: This lovely property is tucked behind one of Vancouver's historic monuments Hotel Georgia, and across the street from a well known 5 Diamond property. It is located directly across the street from the mall downtown and has all the amenities of the neighboring property. Fretta Bathrooms and towels, incredibly soft feather pillows and pillowtop mattress. The patina is modern but not trendy. The restaurant Diva is great as well as the service everyone provides in the property. Be sure to try their Chocolate Cookies! Literally mmm chocolatey goodness! Don't let the lack of major branding fool you, it is actually very refreshing to have an experience at a hotel that stands on it's own. Nice fitness center and indoor pool. Very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Beauitful htoel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: smcdougall
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I spent the last weekend in February 2011 at the Metropolitan Hotel - what a beautiful hotel! The room was gorgeous (we stayed on the 17th floor), the pool & hot tub facilities were clean and very nice. Had a great atmosphere with the glass ceiling. The staff was wonderful. Doug the concierge knew practically every restaurant nearby and sent us to some great restaurants for dinner. The front house staff was very friendly and helpful. Although we didn't see the housekeeping staff, they did a fabulous job, though I would recommend putting out the 'do not disturb' sign overnight as they knock on the door quite early (8am is early for me). The location was GREAT!! Right downtown! We parked the car for the weekend and walked everywhere!! Would definitely recommend everyone stay here :) It's a bit pricey but what you'd expect to pay for this kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was above and beyond expectations in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: BobParrotta
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to discribe this amazing hotel... WOW! As a service industry professional for over 25 years, you know when you come across something special and The Metroplitan Hotel was truly exceptional in every category. Although the room, equipment, facilities and location were superb, what put it over the top for me was the staff. In every regard and with every interaction, staff were friendly, informed, professional and .... here is the clincher... everyone was totally dedicated the our service and comfort, and it was genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, very helpful, staff”
Reviews.Author: michaeldcook
Reviews.Content: Excellent, hotel with particularly helpful and attentive staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Have stayed in first class hotels around the world and this equals any..

Reviews.Title: “great location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: NathanO
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan staff must work well together - the smoothness of service was outstanding. The rooms were very clean upon arrival and tastefully decorated. Beds were very comfortable. Great shower-heads and lots of space in th bathrooms for 2+ people to get ready at the same time. Free WI-FI is a bonus as many hotels of this caliber often charge for use of WI-FI. Visited the hot-tub - great temperature and whole area was very clean and kept up. Valet service was prompt and very friendly. Would definetly stay here again the next time an opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Met and Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mraddatz
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver and was pleased with my stay. The room decor was well done. The bathroom was fanistic better then what I was expecting by a long shot. Also while I was there the I used the pool and hot tub facilities. The were clean and pretty standard. Lastly, the service was quite exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and inviting.”
Reviews.Author: Charlenez
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights in the Metropolitan Hotel in mid February. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. The beds and bedding were extremely comfortable. From reception to valet to housekeeping, the staff were accommodating, efficient, and interesed in meeting my needs. I would recommend this hotel to any traveller looking for good value and great surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values, staff, locations and hotels ever .”
Reviews.Author: PeterPattyAlicia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of places in Europe, Eastern Europe, Asia and Mexico. Surprised at the value and quality of accommodation. Staff "Top Drawer". No better location being downtown and close to shopping, business and sky train. Room is a little small but pool, exercise room, business center, dining room as good as it gets and better than expected. We will definitely be back. MacLellan Family. Halifax NS.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: mecarr101
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in central Vancouver location. Staff wonderful & friendly esp. doorpersons and valets. Stayed in Rm 1107; gorgeous, spacious, comfortable. Bathroom was spa-like! Very luxurious. However, kept bumping head on upper cabinet over coffee/mini bar area. Probably from shock over mini bar prices! :-) No worries, there's a 7-11 close by. Whirlpool was fabulous in Recreation area. Pool too small for me to do lengths unless alone in pool. Location is A++. Close to everything incl shopping, cafes, Art Gallery, Rogers Arena (hockey). Walked until feet protested. Super experience!

Reviews.Title: “All we wanted and more”
Reviews.Author: SwedishCanadian
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Vancouver as a part of a trip to Whistler and Vancouver. We found a good deal on the Internet, but with the upgrade we were given it became a great deal! We had a spacious King bed, a small balcony, nice view, tub and nice shower, plenty of space. A really nice room! Service was very good, both by concierge and at the reception. We got good advice and were swiftly assisted all the time. The upgrade was also a pleasant surprise as well as the fact that we could keep our room until 2 pm on the check out day which made our traveling day so much more enjoyable. We had dinner at the Diva and that was great, service and food was impeccable. The hotel could not be better located. It's close to all the sights and to buses and trains which makes it very easy to get around. Even though we carried skis and lots of luggage we could easily walk to the train and get to the airport quickly and conveniently which saved us time and money. We did not use the fitness and pool facilities. I would stay at the Metropolitan again any day and I recommend it! The way we were treated made us feel like we were on a second honeymoon. If I was to say anything negative, I would have to say the free wireless needs an upgrade. It is really, really slow...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MarkAndersen
Reviews.Content: Great night at the Metropolitan! The night started out wonderfully with drinks at Diva and ended even better with an amazing night sleep in the most comfortable bed ever. Thanks to the staff for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - clean & beautiful, attention to detail, great staff - everything I hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: jazzydrummer7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent visit to the city for a recording session. Upon arriving I was pleasantly surprised by the friendliness, helpfulness and efficiency of the hotel staff. The lobby was bright and modern, and instantly I had a great feeling about this place. Walking into our room, I immediately noticed the attention to detail in the beautiful decor, large bathroom, large TV, and the great bed. Nothing really to complain about here. The bed was comfy, with nice soft pillows which provided a restful night's sleep. We used the hot tub and pool area, which was very nice and relaxing. All-in-all we had a great stay here and I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! What an amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Singing4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was amazing! It was very clean, beatiful and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Three's a Crowd”
Reviews.Author: ksmith33
Reviews.Content: We made reservations online for a party of three. Upon arrival we were informed that that the rooms do not accomodate three. All rooms are for two only. We were given a room with two SINGLE beds and told a cot would be delivered. I haven't seen a single bed in a hotel room ever! There was barely room for the cot (which was larger than the single beds). We thought we might be more comfortable in a room with one queen bed and a cot but were informed that we would have to pay extra for this...despite many vacant rooms. There was virtually no ventilation in our room or in the bathroom. Also, hotel amenities are not listed accurately -ie. no steam room for women. Excellent location. Service average. We travel on a regular basis to Vancouver and there are several hotels with better rates and rooms that can accommodate three and management that wants to make customers happy.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: travelchic43
Reviews.Content: We booked an overnight stay and booked the Valentine's Day package which included a 4 course dinner at Diva and valet parking. Having never stayed there we read many reviews here and were looking forward to it. To put it mildly, our stay was just okay and a bit disappointing...but it wouldn't take much to make it great! The room itself was nice but very small, nothing special. The king size bed was very comfortable and linens wonderful! The bathroom while big, had a small shower stall and no soaker tub! The TV was small and not mounted, sitting on a table that was too low so you couldnt see it when laying on the bed. As for a Valentine's Day package, it really wouldn't take much effort to make it a bit more special. What we got was a 6oz bottle of sparkling wine..not a chocolate or flower to be found! In the morning, we also couldn't find a newspaper anywhere..The lobby is tiny too with only two small benches to sit on. It really is the little things that make people happy and comfortable and all of these things could easily be taken care of with some attention to these small details. The meal at Diva was wonderful..no complaints at all! Just expected more overall from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sj7
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our son stayed there as we were over for a hockey game. The staff was excellent, we arrived at 9:30 just wanting to drop our bag off and head out til check in but they had a room available and allowed us to check in early, fantastic as it was raining and we were wet and cold! The room was fantastic, junior suite which was an upgrade from what we had been given. Beautiful room, large, spacioius, bathroon nice, wished I would have brought a camera! They definitely make you feel welcome, while we were swimming in the pool, a card and cookies, brownies and milk were delivered to our room as a thank you for staying there! Turn down service was very nice, have never had that before! Some hotels we have stayed in say they have it but we have never experienced it! We will definitely stay there again, the location is perfect, within walking distance of everything. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked nice and smelled good when we went through it by accident. (took a wrong turn!)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: SMcNaughton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vancouver several times over the years and the Met is a hidden gem. The service each time is incredible and the location can't be beat. Room size is also definitely a plus. You could pay a lot more to stay at the Pan or the Fairmont, but why bother?

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Relaxing Escape”
Reviews.Author: sabrod
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Metropolitan for my husband's birthday. We were so surprised at how beautiful the room was and how we were treated. The housekeeping staff was more than willing to accomodate us. We were impressed with how the room was set up at turndown as we had stepped out for dinner. We were treated amazingly. The room was so clean and so romantic. The decor was amazing. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. A special thanks to Alijia from housekeeping as she went above and beyond to make our stay at this hotel very special. We well definately be back!! I will be recommending this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “HELPFUL - they are the definition of helpful -”
Reviews.Author: DarinS
Reviews.Content: Recent business trip - 10 flight took 22 hrs and they lost my luggage..... Business meeting Monday 7:00 am Where do you find clothes @ 11:00 p.m. on Sunday evening??? The front desk was sympathetic and helpful...but the concierge Doug really pulled it through, went far out of his wat to assist, saved my business meetings and turned around a truly horrible day. the staff continued through the week to assist me in several ways with clothing options, dining, transportation and financial changes. I can not say enough good about these folks. By the way the rooms are very clean, comfortable and pleasing to a weary business traveller. Doorman always there day and evening...just real good folks happy to assist and make your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, first class 'dine-out Vancouver' weekend, nice room, beautiful linens, friendly welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: LJLtraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for dine out Vancouver rates, in a lovely prime location downtown Vancouver hotel. Enjoyed the pool, hot tub and overall luxury. Tip, Pacific Centre mall parking offers low rates for weekend parking (pd $12 for 22 hours vs the hotel's $40 plus tip) and the parking was located right across the street when using the parking located below the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! I hope to return soon...”
Reviews.Author: Donna_S_11
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending three wonderful nights in this hotel. I was very impressed with the size of the rooms, the cleanliness, the friendly staff and the convenience of having a shopping centre right across the street! During this stay I also attended a training session in the hotel during the day and we were treated like royalty! The food was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Job!”
Reviews.Author: Backle
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with my stay. Newly renovated room. Really enjoyed my room service meal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautfiful hotel, friendly staff, and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Harris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated an early anniversary in Vancouver. We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel. The atomsphere was warm, the staff was friendly, and the service was good. We would recommend it to others and would stay there again. This was in mid June, 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a couple of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Wildwood26
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Friendly staff & super location. Rooms clean and well appointed. Fitness centre was a major disappointment - only 2 treadmills for cardio. They need and elliptical & a cycle. I can't run because of an ankle problem so this will stop me from staying here in the future. WiFi extraordinarily slow also.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room”
Reviews.Author: jkt_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night for a stopover before flying back home, the location is great, right at down town. The room was modern with big bed and spacious ensuite bathroom with both shower and a tub.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug19159
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver not only for its accommodations but for its great staff. The front desk staff are extremely personable and very helpful. I had some special requirements for my stay and Lani, one of the staff members, went out of her way to make the arrangements, follow up and ensure I had what I needed. The accommodation itself is great - the bathrooms awesome - they are huge, luxurious and rare. Everything else is excellent quality - for a downtown hotel it is exceptionally quite. I will always stay at this hotel when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good with Flaws”
Reviews.Author: coffeechik
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for an evening function. I have stayed before and found the catering to be among the absolute WORST meal I have ever had. I was not hopeful this time around even thought Diva is supposed to be a top restaurant. To my surprise the catering this time was excellent and they served the best creme brule I have ever had. The banquet hall itself was Way too hot and drove most people out early. We complained a number of times but nothing was done. The service staff was great but the bar selections were not. Limited drinks available. Eg. no martinis or many other mixed drinks. The elevators were fairly slow and the room was quite small. It is well done though if not a bit dated, but the bed was exceptional. There was a flatscreen tv. This room too was so hot that even after we turned the heat off, we had to keep the window open all night in December. The room was very quiet. The location is great. However the 2 worst aspects were 1) THe tub. When i stay in a hotel to relax I like to soak in the tub. You cannot do that when the tub is child size and only holds a few inches of water before it hits the overflow drain. It actually ruined my evening. 2)The poarking. OUTRAGEOUS. I have never paid that much to park anywhere in the world. And then even when you pay that much like $45 you have to line up and wait to get out while all the other people have the valets load their cars with their baggage. There is only one line to get out. Even the self parkers have to wait. WHat a stupid set up. If I had already bathed, took the bus there and was wearing a bikini it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mooredescendant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located right in downtown Vancouver - near the Art Gallery, Pacific Centre, Skytrain stations, etc. But really, we were so happy with the sincerity and kindness of all the staff we encountered. Such a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Johnny K
Reviews.Content: Had a great night with very accomodating and friendly staff. The room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to book for your business group.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine182206
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel far surpassed our expectations in terms of service. Our group of 24 business guests enjoyed the 2 nights we spent in meetings. The hotel staff were exceptional, the food was fabulous and the location was convenient for spouses to enjoy shopping and sites in the downtown area. As the organizer of this event, I was very pleased with the professional approach of every single staff member I encountered during my stay. I also appreciated the responsiveness of each and every request I made. They made my job easier and more importantly, made me look good! Diva is to die for - most definitely one of the best restaurants in Vancouver. I wouldn't hesitate to book our group again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Small Rooms and Lousy Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: msfpower
Reviews.Content: Pros: -- friendly, helpful staff -- comfortable bed -- great location -- free wireless Cons: -- restaurant over-priced -- rooms too small -- fitness center had two treadmills and that was it for cardio machines Regarding the fitness center, the issue is no low-impact cardio machines such as ellipticals or stair-climbers (important for those of us with artificial joints). I asked the concierge, Oliver, whether the Metropolitan had any cooperative arrangements with other hotels or fitness centers. He said no, but suggested I pay for a day pass at the Steve Nash Sports Center around the corner on Granville Street. I did that -- $28 Canadian for a pass that got me in that day and the next day. Exceptional gym -- probably the best I've ever been in. But the point is that a hotel that charges so much money should have a first-class fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER ROOM, SUPER STAY”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMikey
Reviews.Content: From the time we made the reservations...to the time we left, we had a great stay. The reservation agent was very friendly and all arrangements were as we had expected. When we checked in, we were treated to great service from Leah who took the time to upgrade us to a Junior Suite as we were celebrating a special occasion. Approximately 1/2 hour later, Leah had arranged for a plate of chocolate and strawberries to be delivered. A very nice touch. The room was spacious, clean and had everything we could ask for. We weren't affected by any construction noise nor were we inconvenienced in any way by the construction next door. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and professional. As this was our first stay, we weren't sure what to expect, but based on the experience we had, we will most definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value, Beautiful Room, and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CountessLV
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver for one night after finding an incredible, almost too good to be true deal on their web site. I was not disappointed. The room was large, luxurious, extremely clean and had a balcony overlooking downtown Vancouver. After checking out and heading home, I realized a left a personal item in the room. A quick phone call was all it took for their housekeeping staff to track down the item and promise its return. Two days later it arrived and it had been packaged with much care. I appreciate that the staff took the time to go above and beyond in assisting me. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Great Rooms and Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: RayRayYJ
Reviews.Content: I found the Met to be wonderful stay that definitely enhance my stay downtown. I've stayed at a number of hotels in downtown Vancouver, held seminars in a few and I would stay at the Met everytime...I'd say it's my new place downtown. Hands down the most helpful staff I've ever encountered: check in and parking were seemless! Great room layout, nice view, well appointed, but my favorite part was the lighting (simple things really made a huge difference). Solid location, plenty of great food at the hotel or the surrounding area, good atmosphere overall. Loved the bathroom layout as well, huge bathroom with fantastic soap scents and towels...seems small, but I can't stand lousy soup scents! All in all a great stay, will definitely stay at the Met again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver’s ultimate hotel destination”
Reviews.Author: JShannon2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver, this was our first visit and at was excellent, the rooms are very clean, beautify finished and they have spacious nice bathrooms. Check out the restaurant Diva at the Met; they have a caramelized lamb sirloin that is to die for. Room service was friendly and fast, we travel a far bit within North America and I would give the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver a 10 out of 10, it has an intimate feel to it with loads of amenities and a great staff to boot. Sorry we did not take any photos, will next time..

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!!! Why would you stay anywhere else????”
Reviews.Author: LadyDi027
Reviews.Content: Starting off with the location which is wonderful, you are in walking distance to all the beautiful places in the very heart of Downtown Vancouver. I was so pleased with absolutely all the employees of this hotel, they were so nice, polite, friendly, helpful and always with a smile upon their faces. The room was so clean and comfortable (thanks to all the hard work of the very terrific members of housekeeping), truly feeling like a magnificent option of a home away from home. I was very pleased with the very clean pool and gym( along with all the equipment that was offered for all your fitness needs). I love this hotel and I assure you that this will be the only hotel I stay at when I will visit Vancouver. Affordable;clean; and friendly why would you even think about staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was the little details that made this hotel so fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RyderLakeresident
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Met. The staff were very courteous - the front desk staff, the valet, the bellman and especially housekeeping who delivered me a toothbrush I had left at home. The bed and linen were divine, the towels the size of sheets, I had a nice view, the stay was quiet. My room was well laid out with a GREAT place for my suitcase that was convenient and well lit so I could get in and out of it without hassle or unpacking for a one night stay. I had dinner and wine at the Hotel's restaurant - Diva and it was divine, adequately priced and the staff was very attentive. The location across from Pacific Centre and my conference hotel was invaluable. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: deepow69
Reviews.Content: A great experience! A warm and helpful staff made my friends and I feel very much at home. The central location made walking to everything we were interested in a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Dining at "Diva" is superb!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaTaste
Reviews.Content: Spent a superb weekend at The Met in downtown Vancouver! The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the hotel is so well located downtown that we never once used our vehicle. The art gallery and all the great shopping is right out the front door. I usually prefer to scout out the best local restaurants, but had heard a lot about Diva so we decided to dine at the hotel’s own restaurant. Well, we were certainly not disappointed. I had a fabulous dinner; tuna tartar, a stunning Dungeness crab salad, seared Quadra Island scallops, then incredible black cod/sablefish…all paired with British Columbia wines that were stunning. There was no hope of even tasting from the enticing dessert menu after such a wonderful meal. But we were ready for breakfast the next morning; crab and spinach omelet and I had the black cod hash with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce which was divine. We also had a drink in the Diva lounge one afternoon and their truffled popcorn is incredibly addictive! Our deluxe room was very quiet even being directly across from the elevator. It was spotlessly clean and I just love how big the bathroom is. Of course you can’t go wrong with Molton Brown amenities! Our room was very comfortable and we slept so well. We hated to leave…

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: MattRempRemp
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great manager, great room, great location. There is nothing I could have asked for to improve our stay. Thanks Jarrett and staff of the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: haroldatbirks
Reviews.Content: Service always efficient and polite. Room sumptuous, very clean and most welcoming. We were spoiled by the lovely treat left in the room for our arrival to celebrate our anniversary.Hotel very close to so many attractions.We would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Corinne40
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me by booking us a room at the Met for my birthday. Our first time staying there and we couldn't have been happier with our experience. We were greeted by very friendly staff and were pleasantly surprised by room servicing bringing me a special complimentary Happy Birthday berry tart shortly after our arrival. Delicious! Our room was fantastic, the location is great, staff was wonderful. The only thing that would have made our stay better was if we could have stayed longer! We will definitely be returning to the Metropolitan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelerpls17
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Metropolitan Hotel in Vancouver. The room was not big, but it was comfortable, had free Internet access, and most importantly it was very quiet. The conference I attended was in the hotel. The catered events had good food and it was nice to have all the meetings on the same floor. I also liked how the hotel was conveniently located in the center of town. I just had to walk a few blocks to major attractions. The minor issues I noticed were the limited availability of elevators (2 for the entire hotel), fitness equipment in the hot pool area, and no view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pigcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel for a long weekend of sightseeing and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is conveniently located in the center of the downtown core. We took the Sky Train from the Vancouver Airport (hands down, THE BEST airport we've ever had to travel through) and the hotel is located 1 block from the Vancouver City Center station. It was an effortless way to get to the hotel. FYI - The fare was $8.75 on the weekday to leave the airport (airport fee included) and just $2.50 to return on Sunday so that was much less expensive than a taxi would have been. There is construction going on next to the hotel, but I had specifically requested a room away from that side of the building, and the hotel happily complied. The room was clean, quiet, spacious and well-designed with little things such as a light inside the closet, a large built-in ledge for luggage, and a small 'Juliet' balcony where one can step outside for some fresh air. There was a coffee maker in the room as well as an honor bar. The bed was very comfortable, the towels were plush, and the hotel also provided thick terry cloth robes. The four fixture bathroom was spacious and clean with stone tiled walls and floor. The complementary toiletries are Molton Brown, a high-end British brand. The hotel also has an indoor lap pool, jacuzzi, and fitness center. The website says there are steam rooms but we were unable to find them and didn't bother to ask where they were. There is also a business center which is fully outfitted and can accommodate several people at the same time. The staff is friendly and courteous, and the concierge was very helpful. If you're a good walker, most of the city's main attractions (harbor, Gastown, Yaletown) are an easy walk away. The Vancouver Art Gallery, the city's biggest venue for art, is less than 1 block away and has a very nice cafe with indoor and outdoor tables. The Art Institute of Vancouver has a culinary arts division, and their restaurant with students staffing the kitchen - Culinaria - is located around the corner. We had dinner there one night and would recommend this to anyone looking for an excellent meal for less cost than traditional restaurants. We also enjoyed several good and inexpensive breakfasts at Joyeaux Cafe, a little eatery run by some hard-working Vietnamese immigrants, located 1 block away on Howe St. toward the harbor. Eggs, toast, fried potatoes, and some fruit salad for less than $5. They also offer different types of pho (Vietnamese noodle soup) and what I had was some of the best I've ever tasted. The number of patrons - business people, students, and tourists - coming to Joyeaux at lunchtime to have big bowls of it attests to its quality. Our trip to Vancouver was very enjoyable. The Metropolitan Hotel contributed in large part to our positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this immaculate hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: bandlizzie
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference at the convention centre. Firstly, the location was perfect, convention centre one way and great food and shopping the other. The price was so resonable, pleasantly surprised is not good enough to describe the gem that we found! The service was fantastic, as was the complementary fruit basket and the free wifi. The room we stayed in was not huge but the bathroom was clean and best of all for me a separate shower, no sticky shower curtain! I can't reccommend this hotel highly enough and as someone who uses tripadvisor regularly but has never felt the need to post before, that's saying something :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb city hotel with the wonderful Diva restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: malr
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my sister stayed at the Metropolitan for 2 nights prior to our Alaskan cruise on the RCI Radiance of the Seas. The Met was absolutely superb - lovely spacious rooms and attentive staff at all times. We breakfasted in the Diva restaurant - which was wonderful - and also had dinner each night - the standards were of the highest with impeccable service - we particularly liked the waiter explaining exactly what was on our plate - may seem a minor thing but when you order a dinner you do not always remember every element of it! Great location - easy local transport. Would not hesitate to stay at the Met again and dine at the Diva - very highly recommended. Mal,Jim and Gill from Blackpool, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Very Special Staff, Fantastic Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers625
Reviews.Content: Our 4 nights at the Metropolitan Hotel were excellent. Our room was spacious, nicely decorated, and clean. Having never been to Vancouver before we utilized the concierges many times. They were the best. From walking directions to the many local sites of interest to restaurant choices they were always friendly, patient and made wonderful recommendations. The restaurant DIVA is fantastic. We ate breakfast there every day and dinner 2 of our 4 nights. The staff at the hotel and the restaurant really enjoyed their jobs and we truly enjoyed our stay at the Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jseba4220
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed one night, I was highly impressed with the Metropolitan. It's located near public transit and plenty of shopping and entertainment. Although construction in the area was annoying, the comfort of the room --- and the bed, in particular --- more than made up for it. The bathroom is spacious with fabulous amenities. The restaurant, Diva, was on the expensive side, but the quality of food was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaan6458
Reviews.Content: Lovely room that was spacious and very clean. Fantastic location just a couple of blocks form Canada place one end and great shopping at the other. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and we would recommend it to anyone. Just further down Howe Street is Scoozis, where you'll get the best breakfast in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: BurnabyJoe19
Reviews.Content: Great central location! We wanted a hotel close to the Sun Run start and finish so we picked the Metropolitan Hotel. Not only was it right at the start, it was within a 10minute walk from BC Place. The staff at the front desk were great and allowed us to stay in the room a bit after regular check-out time of 12pm so we could take a shower, eat breakfast, and relax after the run. The boutique feel makes special, the bell staff even recognized us on our way back in and inquired about our run times.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back again”
Reviews.Author: vinniey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night for New Years Eve in a Deluxe room with a king bed. They accommodated our early check-in no problem. The bathrooms are massive! We had two girls getting ready and there was more than enough room in the bathroom and bathroom counter. Kurt, the concierge was very helpful and even organized a limo last minute for us! Didn't use room service or Diva because we spent our evening out but we did enjoy the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gracat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a deluxe room - we would have ideally stayed in a luxury room but our travel agent was unable to book this room type for us. Unfortunately on check in, we asked if we could upgrade and it wasn't possible due to the hotel being full....this was our only disappointment with the hotel. The hotel is in an ideal location, as you are in walking distance of everything you need... There is building work going on nextdoor, you can see it when you arrive but the hotel also lets you know about the potential noise, which will be going on between 7/8am till around 6pm. Its not too bad, but you do hear it; we had a room at the front, and so it was more obvious. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, we opted for a room only rate so that we could get out an explore the city starting with local breakfast diners. We did have room service one night, and it was good, we were pleased with what we got. The hotel has a business centre where you can access the internet for free, its handy for checking in / printing boarding passes. The staff are friendly and helpful; the location is great, we'd go back and will recommend this hotel to friends/family/colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ireland1991
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Metropolitan, I was greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. I am a disabled traveller and found the facilities at this hotel to be excellent and a great place to stay at on my own. With it being located in downtown Vancouver, the location could not be better. A lot of what the city has to offer is easily accessible from this base. I can highly recommend it to anyone visiting Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: katherine_e_lea
Reviews.Content: I came for the first time to this hotel on business with clients for 3 full days. The experience was wonderful! Sales and catering were just a pleasure to work with! The service was amazing and always with a sincere smile! The meeting rooms are quite nice and fit my group which was a decent size. The food was great!! the rooms were very clean and the bed quite comfortable. First hotel that I have slept like a baby during a meeting! I would highly recommend this hotel for a good group, less than 100 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fun for Families”
Reviews.Author: DCinWhistlerBC
Reviews.Content: Our weekend at the Metropolitan in Vancouver was fantastic. Central location for shopping, sightseeing, aquarium, grouse mountain, and riding the sky train - a big hit with our 3 year old! The attention paid to our little guy made the trip special - having his own bed in the living room of the suite was a pretty cool experience for him! The Concierge was wonderful and even arranged for a nice appetizer for us at AquaRiva when we dined there. The indoor pool was also a big hit, and the team at the door were great with facial and name recognition - making our little guy feel like a king everytime he came back! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: meka26
Reviews.Content: i stayed 4 nights in September and really enjoyed it. It's a business type 4 star hotel (so dont expect anything quirky), but it does it well. Excellent value if you're prepared to splurge a little. It's across the road from the 4 seasons, but cheaper. Location was great for everything - harbour, shopping, meals out etc. There was also a bus literally outside the hotel going to Stanley Park. I didnt have any food, it was a bit expensive for me especially considering the choice in downtown vancouver. the staff were excellent, and the rooms so clean and lovely. the bathroom was particualrly nice, especially with the Molton Brown products i didnt use it bus has a swimming pool and fitness centre i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “An ideal, centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oli51
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in total in 2 different rooms. Both were extremely well-appointed and very clean. I was particularly impressed by the Molton Brown toiletries! The staff were very helpful and responsive, providing a tea-kettle and fresh milk and additional towelling robe within minutes of the request being made. We made very good use of the swimming pool and hot tub, often having these facilities to ourselves. Contnental breakfast was included in our room rate and was very good indeed. When we left for a night visit to Victoria, the hotel retained our main luggage with no problem at all. Our only quibble was with the very high car parking charges. $30 CAD a night, whch with additional taxes came to $121 for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great central base for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Baillie3370
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after returning from an Alaskan cruise. I thought there may have been a problem checking in so early (before 8am) but was delighted to be greeted with helpful staff who checked me in easily, with no hassle. The room was clean and spacious, fantastic bed, big bathroom with powerful shower, tv with lots of free channels and plenty of space for my growing luggage. The hotel has a gym, pool ( big enough for lengths), jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. There is enough equipment for a decent workout or just relax in one of the spa rooms. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting restaurants for whatever food I was looking for and phoned ahead to make sure I had a reservation. Best thing about this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of Downtown - a step across the street and you're in the Pacific Centre, a couple of blocks up you're on Robson, a few blocks down your at Canada Place - perfect if you're just wandering around. It's also near a drop-off/pick up point for the city tour, very handy. One fear I had was that construction work was going on next door - I never heard a thing and I was at the side that I expected to hear building work going on. All in all, a great place to stay if you want to be in the heart of downtown Vancouver..!

Reviews.Title: “Where we wanted to be...”
Reviews.Author: GurminderSingh
Reviews.Content: We ended our 10 day journey through Canada with 3 nights at the Metropolitan Hotel. The hotel was fabulous, it’s located right in the middle of Downtown Vancouver, walking distance to Robson Street, and short cab rides from places like Stanley Park, Yaletown and Granville Island. Vancouver is a unbelievably beautiful city and we look forward to going back, there’s so much we missed out on seeing. We will definitely be making a trip back to Vancouver and the Metropolitan Hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location/great comfort”
Reviews.Author: hobobound
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is always a safe bet for quiet comfort in the downtown whether for business or leisure. Lovely pool and workout area. Rooms well equipped. Beds super comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great ending to the honeymoon + incredible resturant”
Reviews.Author: Suur_D
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our honeymoon. I booked the romance special and we got upgrade to a junior suite. Included in the price were $150 at the Diva restaurant, a bottle of sparkling wine, chocolate covered strawberries, $15 iTunes card and breakfast in bed. The room was very spacious. The service was quick (room service, front desk and valet parking). The Diva was the cherry on top.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL + GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: christina051
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, in a very good location, very helpfull staff, especially Oliver on the concierge desk!. Try Joyeaux Vietnamese Cafe for breakfast, one block from the hotel, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aud347
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights prior to joining the Rocky Mountaineer end of aug. early sept. Excellent rooms, very clean, quality toiletries. Desk and door staff very helpful and friendly. Used Gym (old equipment) and pool/spa which were excellent. Woul definately use this hotel again. Good location and value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value + Best Service”
Reviews.Author: mBahareth
Reviews.Content: A Good Hotel with Excellent Staff , one of the best hotel i have seen , spacious , fairly priced , 24 room service , free internet , an incredibly intelligent and helpful staff especially at the concierge . Never Had any complaints . Security always present at the Door , Helpful Porters . i Recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre accomodations with good service”
Reviews.Author: jsmOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: Was dissapointed at the overall condition of the hotel. The room was somewhat spartan with arpet that was old and worn, and a small picture tube TV on a portable cart. Not what I was expecting for the price and the ratings by Travel and Leisure. Location was good and the staff was friendly and helpful. Valet parking was a rip off, but that is essentially true of any downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to spend your 1st night in canada”
Reviews.Author: jacky1959
Reviews.Content: thanks to all the staff at the hotel we were so well looked after on our anniversery, the hotel is perfect to explore vancouver on foot althought the resturant was a little expensive there are many good options in the shopping centers that surround the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything you require when visiting Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: HaggisAndWhisky
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days exploring Vancouver on foot from this excellent location during the height of summer weather. Particularly spacious room and bathroom. Superbly comfortable bed. Great pool and hot tub were perfect for unwinding before preparing to go out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “probably ideal for business trips”
Reviews.Author: RomfordSue
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good central location - you can easily walk to Gastown, harbour, shops etc. The environmental policy is taken to the extreme - when we arrived there was only one tea bag (big tea drinking families will understand my concern!) and one bottle of shampoo and body lotion and a couple of towels. There were three adults in our room (2 female) and I requested more towels and amenities which were promptly brought to our room - 3 towels each, 3 bottles of all the amenities plus a dozen tea bags - fantastic I thought! However they were all removed again the next morning. The staff, apart from Natalie the concierge who was brilliant and the bellman, all look as if they suck lemons first thing in the morning. They are all very efficient and polite but a smile is necessary to make guests feel at ease, that is why I think it is ideal for business rather than leisure. The hotel is very clean and modern but not a lot of atmosphere. There is only one restaurant and adjoining bar which were were told we couldn't even go into because our daughter is only 16, so we had to sit outside on the patio to have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Still High Quality”
Reviews.Author: Pete_HWare_UK
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Metropolitan and its still a high quality hotel.
