Rooms are spacious with everything you expect and the position in the heart of town couldn't be better. Only two things stop a 4 star rating. Generally compared to rivals while very clean the hotel looks just a little tired and one thing definitely to watch is the high car park fees $120CD including tax for 3 days! That said if you want a good place to stay in a great position the Metropolitan is still the one.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: wendyusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights after our cruise. We arrived very early at the day we left for our cruise. We were able to leave our bags with the hotel staff without any problems. The lady in the front desk was very friendly and helpful. She gave us a city map and even showed us the street we should avoid walking through. The location is perfect for a short stay in Vancouver. The hotel is very clean, quiet and a solid 4-5 star.

Reviews.Title: “$99 can either buy a lot of good publicity or a bucket load of bad publicity”
Reviews.Author: Slenda_Glenda
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel in Vancouver.We had two stays actually. One at the end of May for two nights and a return stay in the middle of June. I had chosen the hotel but had my travel agent book it along with our other extensive travel arrangements. I had done a lot of homework and knew exactly where the hotel was and how easy it was to get to it by the skytrain from Vancouver airport. As we were walking towards the hotel we noticed the building construction next door. When we checked in we told reception that we did not want to be put on that side of the building. We required a room with TWO beds. Sabrina the duty manager was very helpful and we were offered a couple of rooms. We decided on Rooom 912 which was at the end of the building. No view but nice and quiet. We were both greatful for her assistance. The room was lovely. It was late so we had a small meal (a plate of soup) at the hotel restaurant. Very expensive fancy soup but that was okay. We decided we would not eat there again. The next morning my sister was unwell due to a previous fall and needed to sleep. Unfortunately I had not put out the "do not disturb" sign and we were wakened at 9am. My fault. When she did wake I suggested she take a bath to try and help her back. The bath leaked and would not hold water. I phoned reception and asked to have someone come upand fix it but finally got tired of waiting and used a face washer to keep the water in. Not to worry. If the hotel is not told about faults they would not know. The internet did not work for our entire stay. This had been one of the drawcards for me staying there. All in all, everything was acceptable and we were happy to be returning. On check-out I requested that we be put in the same or similar room and definitely not on the construction side of the hotel. They had 2 weeks notice of this request. When we arrived for our 2nd stay Sabrina was once again on duty. This time we were told there was only one two bedded room available on the construction side. We explained that we had requested not to be put on that side on our previous visit and was told "rooms can't be guaranteed". Hhmm. Why bother taking down our details on our previous visit. She did offer an "upgrade" to a suite BUT one person would have tosleep on a sofa bed. At first I thought that would be okay, until we went to the room and the springs in the sofa bed were broken. A roll a way bed was to be brought in. My sister did not think it was fair that I should have to have a roll a way bed. After all we had booked and paid for this accommodation some 8 or 9months earlier. We asked to speak to the Manager and was told they were not on duty. Well I am sure they can be contacted by phone. Things deteriorated from here. I suggested that it would be good PR, as we were repeat guests, to give us 2 single rooms, thus we would each have our own bed. YES, that was okay, at a cost of $99. Not likely. All we wanted was what we had booked and paid for. A BED each. Well to cut to the end, we had started to check in at 6.30pm, it was now 9pm. We were now offered the Executive suite. Still a sofa bed. Beautiful suite but what did we need with a 10 seater table and huge living room at that time of the night. Still only one bathroom. I finally pressed Sabrina and she coughed up 2 continental breakfasts and two glasses of wine. That would have cost at least $68. Sabrina kept saying she did not have the authority to give us the two single rooms. What is the point of having a duty manager if that person cannot make any decisions in order to diffuse what had become a very upsetting situation. At one stage I asked for a refund of my money and we would go somewhere else, but the reply was that we had booked through a travel agent and could not get a refund. We certainly got the impression that because a travel agent was involved we were considered an inferior booking. My point is, for the saving of now approximately $31.00 Sabrina has made us very disappointed with the Metropolitan Hotel and not likely to stay there again. I finally did sleep on the sofa bed in the Executive suite and this sofa bed was almost brand new. This is a sad situation because as previously mentioned, the hotel is lovely (except for the bath plug) and in a very convenient location. I believe that when a hotel has construction going on around them, it should be obliged to notify guests when the booking is made and they can then decide if they will still stay there. Forewarned is forearmed. Would I recommend the hotel again, well possibly, but only if I knew the construction was finished. The word is that it had been going on for nearly a year but I cannot confirm this. Also, give the duty manager the authority required.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Sharklet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while visiting Vancouver and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone thinking of where to stay. It is in a fantastic location, a short walk to the harbourside and Gas Town and easily accessible for other attractions like Stanley Park and Granville Island. Very nice little swimming pool and gym. They let us leave our luggage there while we went up to Whistler for a couple of nights and were really helpful. I asked for an extra duvet in our room and one was there instantly. Dont be put off by the building work going on next door, it doesnt really make any impact. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality 4 star hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: roddy1401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and was impressed. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the doorman. The rooms were fine although twin rooms are single beds but were still comfy. Bathroom was very big and had good facilities and was very clean. The restaurant attached for breakfast is quite swanky and breakfast is not cheap if you go for the full breakfast ($24). The spa area was good with a pool, steam and small gym. The hotel is ion a good spot for night;life or eating out and we found a good foody bar on Glanville Street which was only 15 mns walk away. All in all a good value for money superior hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: payeman
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in the Metropolitan Vancouver for almost a week in July. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice though we had a shaky start! When we arrived, tired and hungry after our 24hour journey, we were told the hotel was over booked. Disaster - you would think. However, the duty manager dealt with us straight away. We were offered a free room in a higher rated hotel across the road for the first night and were upgraded to a junior suite for the rest of our stay in the Met with a guarantee that it would be ready first thing in the morning. This seemed reasonable to us and when we arrived back at 9a.m. the next morning (having had a lovely stay in The Four Seasons!) our room, to our surprise, was indeed ready and immediately turned down for us. The reception staff were very welcoming, we had a complimentary turndown service each night and bottled water provided. Our room was lovely, complete with fridge and microwave. The head concierge, Oliver, was lovely to deal with and would always say hello/enquire about any trips we had taken. Our one gripe would be that perhaps there were not enough concierges as when we met two others on our first days they seemed rushed and distracted. The hotel is ideally situated...steps away from Canada Place/ Robson Street and the Pacific centre. Would we stay here again.....absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigB_UK
Reviews.Content: very nice centrally located hotel. staff very friendly, free upgrade to junior suite (which was huge) after they had trouble finding our reservation. highly recommended for downtown location, shops and restaurants only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: frannick
Reviews.Content: Not only did we have superb weather during our recent trip to Vancouver, but we had a great stay at the Metropolitan. The location is excellent...close to everything. The room was very comfortable andt he pool was very nice. We would definitely stay here again. Have no complaints except perhaps for the internet connection, which was slow and often dropped out (it was free however). Staff were efficient and helpful. We weren't bothered by building construction going on next door since it only occurred during the day when we were out sightseeing anyway. Otherwise, the double-glazed glass blocks most noise anyway. Believe this hotel used to be the Mandarin-Oriental so in it's heyday (80's), would have been a very swish hotel....you can tell now that it has seen some fair wear from those days but is still of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PhillyPAgal
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very comfortable beds. Nice bathroom with separate tub and shower, Molton Brown toiletries. Helpful staff. They came right up with an extra bathrobe, etc. The concierge (Oliver?) was especially helpful. He helped get us tickets to the Bard on the Beach which was very enjoyable. Location downtown was good. We would stay there again. We enjoyed looking around downtown, Gastown, Granville Island and Stanley Park. We did not enjoy the Vancouver Trolley Company hop-on hop-off bus. For $38, it is not worth it. They advertise 6 stops in Stanley Park but the trolley took so long in coming after our second stop (about an hour as opposed to the 20 minutes that they advertise), that we didn't have time to get off anywhere else. Several people waiting actually called the office to see if another trolley was ever coming. We were worried about we were stuck in the park. Their last pickup at the park was about 4:45 pm which for a Saturday in the summer seems too early to me. If you can get to Stanley Park by cab or public transportation, there is a park trolley for $10 which seemed to run more frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: asava
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice room and amenities. Helpful staff. QUIET. GREAT restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive eating!”
Reviews.Author: frequent-flyer21
Reviews.Content: Overall, we found this a very good hotel, especially its excellent location. We stayed here before departing on a cruise, and were able to walk with our bags (its all downhill!) to the cruise terminal! Our room was very smart, and the bathroom excellent. Service is very good both from the concierge and also from reception. We did find the meals pricing to be exhorbitant. Continental breakfast for CDN$20 including tax is a rip-off! Try one of the excellent cafes just a few blocks down from the hotel. We didn't even dare look at the dinner prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: andrewlwalsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only a few days. Location is perfect for CBD and for tourists has enough access to all the attractions. Great sized TV in room. Not over the top. Four seasons over the road is probably over the top. One of the most useful things while Vancouver was raining, was brewed free coffee in foyer. In June 2010 there was construction in the building next door which I imagine would be noisy during the week, but this didn't affect me over the short work period I was there. Didn't have free wireless internet but did have free wired internet. Would have been better to offer wireless in room. In the bar/restaurant free wireless is available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for all you wanna do and see in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: petervanminderhout_9
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan hotel in Vancouver is close to Canada Pier when you plan a cruise and close to everything else you might plan to see or do in Vancouver. The very pretty Art Gallery is on walking distance; spend time to see the expositions and enjoy the terrace. Busstop to Granville Island is 50 meters away. The hotel is a perfect choice. Parking and breakfast are -as usual nowadays- overpriced. Very good breakfast with eager and friendly Vietnamese people hundred meters on your left. Peter van Minderhout, the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, excellent room rate, a great first night in Canada”
Reviews.Author: JarvisCockertiel
Reviews.Content: After having had the flight of nightmares, arriving at this hotel - with the exceptionally welcoming and capable staff - was a real pleasure. Room was spacious, bed comfy, and the hotel overall one I would recommend to friends, and indeed stay in myself if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: psmconnor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel after a cruise vacation. It is located downtown about a two minute drive from the cruise ship terminal, and also located directly across the street from the Pacific Center shopping mall. The hotel staff were wonderful and easily accomadated our request for an early 8am check-in. We stayed in a Luxury King room which was spacious, clean, quiet, comfortable and from the 11th floor we had great views of the city. The bathroom is huge and unlike the previous reviewer my 6'2" husband found the height of the shower head to be just right. The hotel restaurant is very good and there are several other eating options within an easy walk of the hotel. Yaletown with shops and restaurants is about a 20 minute walk or take the Canada line rail system located just one block from the hotel to explore the city. There is building located next to the hotel that is under going renovation, so there is construction noise during the day; we requested a room on the opposite side of the hotel and the construction noise did not bother us at all. Overall great stay and highly recommend this hotel for it's pleasant staff, great location and wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service. . extras are a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: TravellingHombre
Reviews.Content: We were able to get the room for about $145 out the door. a great price for a hotel in the heart of it all. Everything is very clean, the staff very professional. The room felt very European to me in the way it was cruise ship space-efficient. small entry, built in cabinetry, small room, but very large bathroom. That was a nice plus, but the ceiling was only inches from my head and the shower was only as high as my shoulder. . once again, very Euro to my American frame. And the room had two TWIN beds, which was unusual for me to see in North America, but mine was surprisingly comfortable. The bar is beautiful, very pleasing colors and music. Of course it is pricey, but the drinks are stiff and the pours are good. No complaints there overall. Upon dropping the car off at the valet, $45 set a new record for parking, especially in proportion to the room price. But everyone holds the doors for you and assists in carrying any burdens you might present. I felt like the captain of a ship upon entering and exiting every day. So, at the price I paid, I feel it was a good value, and I consider myself pretty fancy,but if I had paid $300 a night for two twin beds and a shower I had to kneel to use, I would not be as happy. So this hotel may not be for tall people.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations for the last night of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MiraxH
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of their "Sweet love in the city" package for the last night of our honeymoon. It was well worth it! We arrived and everyone was extremely friendly. We got to our room and they had upgraded us...to an incredible suite with a living room, private dining room, bar area and extra bathroom. Incredible! This was a lovely surprise. Our bedroom had a little balcony with a beautiful view of the city and a huge bathroom that had great lighting for applying makeup. This is hard to come by in hotels! Our package included champagne and strawberries which the delivered shortly after we arrived. It also included a floral bouquet which I was surprised when the brought it up. I was expecting something very small but the gal arrived with a huge bouquet of beautiful yellow/orange roses tipped in red which she put on our dining room table and took one of the roses and put it in my bathroom. Our package also included dinner at their restaurant Diva. We called to find out if it might be possible to have dinner served in our room and they were more than happy to accommodate. We had an absolutely delicious dinner- we enjoyed their tasting menu which was wonderful! Everything was very fresh and very tasty. We greatly enjoyed it. The next morning we received a Canadian breakfast delivered to our room which was also part of our package. It was also delicious. We didn't experience any of the construction noise that others have mentioned. We had nothing but excellent customer service. We had a wonderful time and would definitely go back and would recommend to friends. Thank you to the metropolitan for making the last night of our honeymoon very memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: Mlounc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful central location, can walk almost everywhere. Very near the Skytrain station with Canada Line service to and from the airport, very convenient. Top of the line service, I felt like a valued and respected guest. I asked for a high floor, room had large windows with city lights view......no street noise at all. My second stay there, I'll be back. Traveled with my 14 year old grandson, he really enjoyed the lovely indoor pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...except for the construction next door, which wasn't their fault.”
Reviews.Author: Mikosmommy
Reviews.Content: Just spent March 25-26 here on leisure weekend w/hubby, first time to Vancouver. Location was perfect, .5 block away from subway (easy trip from YVR) and we walked everywhere else. We chose this one from reading positive reviews from others and it didn't disappoint. Hotel was very clean and well cared for. Also got company discount on rate, so we couldn't complain. Concierge helped us figure out the Canadian liquor store differences, delivered our things to our room from the lobby and was extremely friendly and professional. Our king bed was really comfortable and pillows were dreamy. We were unable to sleep in late (after 8 or so) on Friday and Saturday due to the massive neighboring construction project (they said it was going to be done in the fall), but what can you do...when construction wasn't going on, hotel was quite quiet. Had a drink at Diva and the service was excellent. Right next to everything and very walkable to Stanley Park, Chinatown & waterfront. Rented bikes near Stanley Park and biked to Granville Island and really saw the city. A+ experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbatty
Reviews.Content: Although they were doing construction next door during our stay, this was a great hotel to stay in. The hotel staff was very helpful. The rooms were typical hotel rooms, but the bathrooms were amazing! The location was also perfect for our needs. We utilized the fitness equipment which were up to date, and the small indoor pool was a pleasure. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, but save money for parking!”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the metropolitan! The room was lovely and spacious, the bed was comfy and there was a balcony with a nice view of the mountains. The pool area was really nice, all under a glass dome. If you havent been to Vancouver, this hotel is in an ideal location, pretty much in the centre of it all. The staff was very helpful and friendly as well. They advised us of some construction next door and put us in a room the farthest away from the noise. They were also very helpful in assisting me with finding some information about general motors place, as we were attending the hockey game that evening. I would love to treat myself to a stay at this hotel again in the future. My only small issue was the parking fee. When I booked, the reservation stated self parking was $30, but came to find out it was actually $45! Thats pretty stiff. I dont know if it was because it was a weekend, but I have stayed downtown before and this was the most exspensive parking charge I have ever incurred. That aside, the hotel was marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “A great 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Vancouver. I would say it's a 4 plus. We loved the room - which was a standard room. The little amenity kit in the bathroom was similar to those of a 5 star hotel. Bed: just perfect. loved it. Front desk agents were friendly and helpful. Would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: AlisonN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights as part of a tour. Arriving off a 10 hour flight to find the restaurant closed was not the best start, but things did improve! We had room service breakfast the first morning. It was excellent but pricey, so only did it once. On our free day in Vancouver when we weren't so rushed we wandered down to the White Spot for great food at the right price. We found all the staff at the Met to be extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge even called a lift for us when we returned from a shopping trip absolutely dripping wet (lovely Vancouver weather). Housekeeping were also very obliging, and anything we requested (kettle, milk, extra coffee etc) appeared within minutes. The hotel is well placed for walking to Gastown, Robson Street, and either Granville or Waterfront Skylink stations. I would certainly stay there again if I have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Has become a regular stop.”
Reviews.Author: Faithful_Suitcase
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last January on our yearly stopover and decided to choose the place again this year as we were quite happy with the previous stay. BOOKING: Both times have booked online with no issues; our bookings were exactly what we chose. One word of advice is to check their promotions page when booking as they have quite a number of different packages that suit a wide range of tastes and provide some very good value. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: Check in each time have been very quick. Everything was waiting and after a quick credit card swipe we were on our way to our room. Checking out each time has been a bit of a hassle as we’ve confused the front desk staff a bit. Our flights always leave in the middle of the night so we book, and expect to pay for, our room the whole day. The staff always seem confused on what to charge us, (even though we indicate we are fine with paying for a full night), and discussion ensues. Not a big deal, but a small indication of the level of experience the front desk staff has. LOCATION: Location is right in the heart of downtown, across the street from Pacific Center Mall and 1.5 blocks from Robson Street. It’s super convenient and the main reason we chose this hotel in the first place. For the past two January’s there is construction occurring to the building next door which disrupts foot traffic slightly, but we never found it a hassle. COMMON AREAS: Non-descript would be the perfect way to describe the lobby. In fact if you were rating hotel lobbies, it would probably rate in the bottom of any list you were making. It is lifeless and not particularly functional. We have never used the pool or gym during our visit so cannot comment other than to say that they exist. This place also has probably the most awkward car parks I have ever encountered. If the place was ever full you’d really struggle to get more than a mid-size car into it. FOOD: Each year the “Diva” restaurant closes during the first week of January for renovations, so if you’re going during that time be aware. We did have room service the one night and the food was decent, the one comment I would make is that the portions were HUGE. There are plenty of restaurant options in every direction of the hotel as well. ROOMS: We have opted for a Jr. Suite both times. The rooms are spacious and face out onto Howe Street. The bed is huge and comfy and the bathroom has both a tub and separate shower. I’m not sure if it is the same for the normal rooms, but the suite’s have quite a large amount of closet space; something that would definitely not be lost on a business traveler spending a decent amount of time in Vancouver. SERVICE: The service provided is decent, but certainly not outstanding. There is definitely a “pretentious” air among the staff as a general rule and anytime you engage them there is a hint that you are “putting them out” with any request. OVERALL: We love the location, and the rooms are very comfy. Also, we find the hotel is great value. We walked across the street to the four seasons to see there rooms and at the MET you get double the room for half the price. Outside of maybe trying the new Shangri-La next time, we will definitely recommend this place to others and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GobiDesert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times and every time is just as great. Great rooms, great amentities,great location. Great service from the sales, catering and valet. Front desk, when busy, is a challenge but nothing to complain about. Great for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location, fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelM09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Met for 10 nights on business, and was extremely pleased with the hotel. There's a good sized mall right across the street, which also has a skytrain line for getting to places like the Metropolis Mall in Metrotown. I was working in UBC, and there's a bus stop right outside the door for the #4 bus. My work colleagues stayed in the Empire Landmark, and complained about a 15 min walk to and from the bus stop. Nightlife is right down the street, as are many other restaurants. The hotel's own restaurant, Diva, was expensive, but pretty good. I opted for room service a few nights, and the level of service was great. For such a large hotel, they have very friendly and accomodating staff, who are always eager to chat. Free WIRED internet too, but I was too high in the building to take advantage of the wifi in the lobby. Construction is taking place next door, but I didn't notice it. In fact, the huge canadian flag on the hording was my landmark to find the hotel! A huge thumbs up to the Met. Would recommend 100% if you get a good deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HunterBoss
Reviews.Content: I booked at this hotel based on the reviews I read on this site. I'm so glad I did. Every element of the stay was wonderful. I've stayed at Four Seasons Hotels in Canada as well and I enjoyed my stay here more. The staff was great and very attentive. My wife and I went for our second honeymoon on our 25th wedding anniversary. I strongly recommend staying at the Metropolitan if you're going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dov A
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Metropolitan and found it to be a very nice hotel with friendly staff. The location is great with Pacific Centre and the Skytrain right across the street. I used the fitness facility and the health club facilities and everything was in good working order and very clean. I only had two slight problems. The first was that my room service coffee ($11.42) was removed from my room while I was out for a few minutes. I called down and they sent up a new pot immediately. The other was the construction noise. I had about 2 hours at the end of the day to relax before a dinner meeting, however there was such a loud noise coming from the construction next door that I was unable to relax and developed a whopper of a headache. I mentioned it to the desk clerk and she apologized although there wasn't much she could do. All in all, I was impressed. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the facilities were clean, the location was good and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit dated but good...”
Reviews.Author: Flying_dad
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent and most helpful. Location is good especially if you need access to the skytrain or other train line. Granville Street Mall is just a short walk as is Gastown and shopping is just across the road. Yes the hotel rooms are a bit dated but they are clean, tidy and of a reasonable size. Note however that the hotel next door is undergoing significant re-building, not a problem but it can be noisy during the day. Views limited as well. Business suite more for conferences however access was 24/7 by the front desk. Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. . . Restaurant? Not so much. . . .”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasTraveler68
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vancouver Saturday mid-day, for overnight before embarking on cruise Sunday afternoon. Could not get early check-in, but hotel was very gracious, receiving our luggage and responding to inquiries about the surrounding area. Hungry and tired, we thought to perhaps hang out in the hotel restaurant over a bite of lunch. Prices were outrageous, but we were prepared to indulge that. No, what turned us out on unfamiliar streets was the breath-taking SNOBBERY of the restaurant staff. The restaurant was open, but completely empty, and apparently they wanted to keep it that way! Ignored us totally, leaving us standing at the door, looking expectantly back at the staff clustered around the bar. . . It was imPRESSive! We looked at the menu, ascertained that the restaurant was INDEED "OPEN," so to speak, and finally left before our laughter overcame us. We were guessing they were 'WAY better than some middle-aged US woman with her grey hair in a bun! ! ! We wound up walking about three or four blocks out to the Vancouver Museum of Art, where a very attractive little restaurant was serving lunch - - and managed to score a little art, besides! The next morning at checkout, we wanted to leave our luggage at the hotel while we completed the (terrific) trolley tour we had begun the afternoon before. The head bellman said they would be happy to keep it for us, but recommended that we take it on to the dock and check it in, thus missing the crowds that would develop that afternoon. GRAND advice, and we took it, leaving us free to just sail through the rest of our day in Vancouver until time to get on the boat. Vancouver is a spectacular city, and we wished so much that we had scheduled another night or two there, so as to more fully enjoy the beauty. The trolley tour runs in two loops, and is the ideal way to hit the sights quickly. With extra time to get off and back on, we could have seen most of the city from that tour. Even so, we got a thorough introduction to the great beauty and fascinating charms of the city. A-Plus all the way. And we entirely recommend the Metropolitan - - just not its self-important, supercilious, snobby, snooty naught of a restaurant. Of course, if they kept up that level of "service," they're probably out of business by now. Maybe a Wendy's takeover? ? ? :~)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a pre- cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: sentosa54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before a cruise to Hawaii and it was perfect. Room on 14th floor had a lovely outlook, very comfy bed, lots of storage space, an elegant bathroom with Molton Brown toiletries, and was very quiet.We also had a tiny balcony that looked onto Howe Street. Free wireless Internet in the Lobby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast our first morning in the restaurant,and thought it was very expensive, no wonder it was so quiet!!Lukewarm coffee, bacon and eggs,no side plate for toast,service not as slick as it should have been. Next day, we walked out of hotel ,turned left and found Mario's Coffee Shop, where he will make you "the best coffee in Vancouver" and it was!. Across the road is a large shopping mall with a food court which is very good. On the morning of our cruise, we took a ten minute stroll down Canada Place and were able to watch the passengers get off the Rhapsody of the Seas and some of the stores being loaded on for our cruise An excellent hotel with a great location,lovely quiet rooms and very friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: jem234
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly helpful and polite. It's also in a great downtown location - walking distance from great shops, restaurants, clubs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: elliepoppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before our cruise to Alaska. Perfect location, right opposite a mall. Very quiet, good sized room with everything we needed included free internet connection. Staff very helpful. Didn't eat there as we were out and about most days and apart from charging a huge amount for a very short overseas call I can thorougly recommend staying here (just don't phone abroad!)

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: lfcjimmy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was amongst the more affordable hotels in the central downtown area, and also based on previous reviews. From arriving, the service was excellent and all of the staff encountered were helpful and friendly. The room, at the front of the hotel, was spacious and included a small balcony from which Canada Place could be seen at the bottom of Howe St. The room facilities included everything you'd expect from a hotel of its class. Location wise, it could hardly be in a better location. For breakfast options outside of the hotel, there are two recommended places further down Howe St (going towards Canada Place) which are within 5 minutes walk. A shopping centre across the road features also features a large food hall. If you are staying for a few days and plan to explore different areas of the city, attractions in all four directions are within walking distance, especially if you don't mind a bit of a stroll. Alternatively, two Skytrain stations are close by and plenty of bus stops are within a minute or two of the hotel. Highly recommended, and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & elegance in centre of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunkies13
Reviews.Content: Vancover was our starting point for our 3 week tour of Western Canada. We wanted to start relaxed and in luxury and thats what we got. We stayed on the 10th floor for 4 days in a room with a small balcony looking down to Canada Place. The room was well equipped with tea coffee robes hairdryer iron and ironing board. The bathroom was massive and had an assortment of useful cosmetics. Bed was extremely comfy and we didnt hear anyone next door or in the hallway. Room was cleaned and made up everyday. We arrived at the hotel before check in but were given our room which was great after an 11hr flight. Reception staff very polite and friendly as were all staff we encountered. As we were out exploring everyday we didnt use the breakfast or dinner facilities. The pool was great for relaxing after sightseeing and after 8pm we were the only people using it, very relaxing. The hotel internet in the business suite is free for a limited time but WiFi is enabled in the rooms. Hotel is in an excellent location for exploring all Vancouver has to offer. When we return we will definately stay here, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “I'm staying here next time I'm in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: silverlakemom
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were in Vancouver 2 nights before a cruise. It's centrally located in downtown 4 blocks from the Pan American Hotel where we were to embark on a cruise. The hotel is across the street from the Four Seasons Hotel but most importantly next to a huge underground shopping center that is a stop on the Skytrain Transit System which canvasses the city. (We could have taken the Sky train from the airport) The room on the 12th floor was large and tastefully decorated. Service was wonderful! The bellhop even ran to a nearby newsstand to get my mother a Chinese newspaper! I'm staying here next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Voyager28
Reviews.Content: Great room with a small balcony at a very good price through Expedia.Free parking was included.There is building work next door but the double glazing cuts out all noise.I think the hotel is giving away great rates because of the building works so now is a good time to grab a bargain. Had continental breakfast at a small italian restaurant which if you turn left out of the door of the hotel is only about 50 metres away.Very nice food and atmosphere. Eat at Diva one night as a treat. We had the Tasting Menu with the reccommended drinks.A bit expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but lacks the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagged72
Reviews.Content: This hotel was billed as a 4 star hotel and certainly it was that. All the facilities are available at a cost. The location was great. I booked a King bed through Expedia but when we arrived I saw that we had twin beds. I did complain but I was told that that was what Expedia had put on the form to them. The breaksfast was very expensive for what you got (not that I had it). Everybody seems to eat in food courts in Vancouver and I must say you can get fed up of eating fast food. A lot of work is going on in preparation for the Winte Olympics in February 2010. I was shocked at the number of people who sleep on the streets and beg. The one thing I found was missing was the personal touch. Like all 4 and 5 star hotels, a service is provided in return for payment. Having stayed in 3 star hotels in San Francisco and Honolulu on the same holiday, the personal touch was very evident there but it was certainly lacking at this hotel. OF all three hotels, we enjoyed this the least. There was a lot of construction going on next door at their sister hotel but we were not advised of this until we found a letter in our room on arrival informing us of the fact and offering a simple apology. Do visit the Observatory and Stanley Park and the area around Canada Place. You can get by bus from the Airport for $14 each one way but I would recommend using the new Skytrain into the city for $3.75 each one way and it is much quicker by far. We also went to Whistler and I would recommend it to anyone visiting this area of Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up! Certainly would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkOntario
Reviews.Content: booked this room through "Travelzoo" where they send one the top twenty specials of the week - Vancouver appears quite regularly - received an excellent rate through them - free parking and an upgrade to a king, luxury room room extremely clean with great attention to detail small Juliette balcony with windows that OPENED! construction going on but didn't bother us huge bathroom with marble throughout - separate soaker tub and large shower lobby rather coldly decorated with seating that doesn't provide support for backs restaurant expensive - breakfast for one (without coffee or juice) - $25 for bacon and eggs - in talking with relatives, they stated that the food is excellent would definitely recommend this hotel - central (very close to Art Gallery) and good for walking to explore Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silvermouse82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from the 9th-12th Sept. This hotel and its concierge were amazing. The in-room bar has crazy prices for stuff (actually cant see how anyone would buy anything at that cost) and the parking is $24 a night but dont let that put you off because the location of this place is absolutely perfect and the rooms are great too. The concierge was so helpful and friendly. In a nutshell, location, comfort and welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Tr_uno
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Metropolitan back in early summer in between the peak of summer and after the winter high so got a superb deal. It was a while ago but I wanted to make sure I wrote a review as our stay was top notch. The rooms are brilliant and it is in a great location. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: lamija
Reviews.Content: hotel was great, the stuff as well, it looked really like a 4 season's hotel, but it wasn't since that one was across the street :) the health club is not so special thou, but the rooms were spacious and clean and nicely designed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelling55
Reviews.Content: We decided to return to Vancouver after spending a few nights there last year before and after an Alaskan cruise and we loved the city. We chose the Metropolitan as it was central and stayed for 14 nights late August / early September. We found it fantastic. We have travelled a lot and stayed in some nice hotels but this one had it all. We were upgraded to a mini suite, possibly as we were staying for so long and the room was fanatstic. I had emailed the hotel earlier asking for a room high up and away from the building work and got a super one on the 17th floor. The only noise you could hear was traffic noise but it was not loud enough to keep us awake and you can't expect anything else staying so centrally. As for the room, the bathroom was huge and the separate shower a big bonus. The room was kept spotless and the lovely Molten Brown toiletries replenished daily. The bed and the pillows were so comfortable we wanted to take them home with us! I am a poor sleeper and have never slept so well for years, just what we wanted after a long day sightseeing. Other nice touches were the bottles of water and a card showing next days' weather which were waiting for us every night when we came home after our evening meal. Reception staff were friendly and the doormen always had a friendly hello for us leaving and coming back each day. People have commented on the poor lift service, yes it is slow but you're on holiday, chill! The location is perfect, bus stops right on the doorstep almost. Vancouver is a beautuiful city, loads to see and do and the lovely weather was a bonus. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, in miniature”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This hotel began its life managed by Mandarin Oriental in the mid 1980s--the Mandarin fan logo remains engraved in the front windows on the first floor--was a Delta hotel for many years after that, and most recently became The Metropolitan. The location is great, just five blocks from the harbour, and a block away from both the Vancouver Art Gallery as well as the new Canada Line directly to the airport. If you are a fan of Mandarin Oriental, that this hotel was up to their standards at one point might surprise you. Then again, over two decades have passed, and when it opened, The Mandarin in Hong Kong had small rooms as well (though recently thoroughly renovated and enlarged). Everything about this Vancouver hotel--other than your bill, potentially--is small. The lobby is likely no larger than your living room at home, and the guest rooms (mine was dubbed "Luxury" and was an upgrade from "Deluxe) are compact to the point of verging on the claustrophobic. Think somewhere between a luxury cruise ship cabin and a dollhouse. It is a credit to the designers that the room works despite the lack of space. Nearly everything is built-in. . .the closet, the drawers, even the nightstands. While the room is large enough to accommodate a king sized bed, the television might be the smallest flat screen I've ever seen in a hotel room (possibly larger than one you would mount in your kitchen, but just), and the balcony is barely large enough for one person to walk onto. The bed looks more comfortable than it is--great duvet, but some might find the mattress overly firm. Nice carpet, good upkeep, umbrella and bathrobe are nice touches. A hotel of this calibre should have wireless internet, and The Metropolitan does not--but the broadband works well. Construction on a 50 floor residential tower next door means the noise starts at 7:30a most mornings--light sleepers might look elsewhere if rest is important--and the progress on the tower (just beginning) means that the noise will continue for at least another year. The 14th floor room had a view over gardens and pool at the Four Seasons across the street, but not much else--nearby towers are too high to afford the rooms at The Metropolitan views of mountains or harbour. The bathroom is floor to ceiling marble tile, and has a separate tub and shower--but it may be the smallest four fixture bathroom anywhere--in part to a barely usable tub, and a tiny shower enclosure with a head that might not be much higher than 6 feet off the ground. The decor was elegant 25 years ago, but the mirrors and smoked glass around the shower are beginning to date. There is a phone in the bath. If you like your luxury paired with spaciousness, this is not your hotel. I've stayed at the Renaissance, the Pan Pacific, the Sutton Place, and all three Fairmonts in Vancouver, and this is noticeably the smallest room of the bunch. I could overlook small rooms all the same--but can't overlook small minded hospitality, This is where The Metropolitan fails. My rate included parking as a promotion. With my plans changing slightly, I contacted the hotel as I'd not be using a car during my stay--and therefore parking was not something I needed. Parking, by the way, is $28 nightly, so four nights of parking is worth $112--not inconsequential. I sent a note to reservations via e-mail, and waited nearly a week without a reply. Finally, I sent a second note to follow up. A reservations agent then sent a note, rejecting my request for coming up with something of equivalent value--I initially suggested breakfast instead. Since this was worth over $100, I then followed up with the GM of the hotel, the once controller now acting as GM, Ms. Ahmadi. She had one of her associates call me back to yet again tell me that my rate was too low, and they had no interest in providing any substituted value. As it was now the day before my stay, I kept my reservation, and the hotel never did provide anything to substitute the parking. And the GM never deigned to communicate with me. Still hasn't. This small minded hospitality disappoints me. What sets a small hotel apart from the rest is the individualized service provided. it is not unreasonable that when a guest calls the GM, that this individual returns the call him/herself. And if the room package included, for example, a fruit basket and a bottle of wine--and I were not a wine drinker--it is perfectly reasonable, perfectly in keeping with a true luxury hotel, that I might request a bottle of sparkling water instead. A real luxury hotel, where hospitality came as commonplace, would make such a replacement immediately, without thinking--of course, it would reply. Failing to honor such a small request reflects the hospitality of bean counting--making sure that nothing is provided, and every extra is charged for. If the beans balance, things must be fine. Of course, this is a false economy when the guest experience is compromised. Which brings me to the next item that reflects the sad slippage of a hotel that had a Mobil Travel Guide Four Star rating but lost it over the past two years. The hotel charges guests a $9 "facility fee" per night. What, you might ask, does this include? I'm not quite sure, as the fee was never disclosed or explained on check-in. Believe there was some mention of internet (again the broadband, plug-in rather than wifi) or the health club--but the front desk agent was kind enough to remove it when questioned at check out. If it does include the health club, such a charge is even more offensive--as the "club" is the size of a standard hotel room, and includes a few aged exercise machines, some barbells and dumbells, and an exercise ball. The room is so small that a few more machines have been scattered around the south end of the indoor swimming pool. It will not surprise that the indoor pool is, well, small. Small rooms, small facilities, and a shrinking sense of hospitality. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: b3b
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there were no attendants present. We had to carry out suitcases up a small set of stairs. This was awkward. We had to wait more than 15 minutes to check in as there are only two front desk staff and there was a long line up of people checking out. However, the hotel is very nice. The location is great. Close to art museum, restaurants, shopping, waterfront and subway. The building beside is under construction and although there is a note in the room apologizing and stating that construction noise might start around 8 am, I noticed the noise by 6 am and we were on the 15th floor. Get a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Modern Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pdxian
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and received a great rate that included parking and internet (they normally charge extra for both). The room was furnished with modern furniture and the bathroom was quite spacious. The location is right downtown and close to everything. I agree with some of the other reviews here when they say that the staff was less than friendly. They weren't outright rude, but they were not particularly friendly. We stayed at another hotel in town on the same trip where they were much warmer and seemed genuinely happy to receive our business. If you can get a great price like we did, book it. You will be glad you did

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: beetraveller40
Reviews.Content: Just a block and a half off Robson Street. The concierge was very helpful. Helped with directions and suggestions for places to eat. Ask about the breakfast place just a block down from the hotel, it is a small Asian place that serves great omelets. The room was comfortable. Sitting area, super soft bed, flat screen tv. Nice size bathroom with separate shower and tub. My only issue was the construction noise in the morning. There is a new building being build right next door so you hear the crane, crement truck beeping, pounding etc so don't expect to sleep in. Otherwise a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not as expected as booked based on all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDans
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ this hotel for 3 nights with good location, but unpleasant experience with one of the front desk receptionists Pamela, very rude, not even a smile or welcome to our hotel, and when our credit card was not scanning ( coming from the states our bank had placed an immediate security block ) she had the nerves to tell us to use a PUBLIC PHONE around the corner, instead of a nicer option of using their phone right there, under her nose. Unbelievable!! Finaly getting to our room and another surprize; nasty carpet and room odor, and when back to reception ( we talked to somebody else)to ask for another room we were told to wait until next day due to all rooms beeing occupated or to try one of their air purifying room devices for that night. So you would think that someone the next day will follow up with us to see if that worked or not or to offer again the option of switching rooms, but no, that did not happen so the cleaning crew took the device away that next day. This hotel needs major remodeling in specially for the upcoming Winter Olimpcs, unless that Pamela gave us the worst room she had avail just for us. The construction going on right next to it is very disturbing and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Bad customer service and ignorance from their management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant modern hotel with good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Booked through travelzoo.com - half price. It was very good all round. Bathroom had a tub and separate walk in shower

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start of our honeymoon. The hotel is in a great location for visiting all the main sights. The hotel is clean and modern and the staff were always very helpful. Our room was spacious, modern and had quality fittings. The bathroom was spacious with a shower and bath wilth molton brown toiletries. The bed was very comfy, with proper duvets. We used the indoor pool area, it's fairly small but nice for relaxing in at the end of a day of sightseeing. We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on this. Try the banana leaf malaysian restaurant in downtown for a great meal... it gets very busy though! I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and confortable”
Reviews.Author: TJandTR
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite for 4 nights, and our Internet rate included free parking under the hotel. The hotel is centrally located, and the 2-room suite was very comfortable for an extended stay. The bed was extremely comfortable. Both rooms had light-and-noise blocking drapes, a sound-conditioning option on the radio, MP3 player, and fridge. The double-pane windows actually open. Among the amenities was a large umbrella in the large closet. We recommend the hotel's restaurant, "Diva."

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BC_lovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Metropolitan for 9 nights of our honeymoon. Firstly I should say that we booked through a travel company and paid £150 a night, had we not experienced other hotels in Vancouver which in our opinion were better and charged less we may not have been so dis-satisfied. Firstly the bad points: It has been mentioned before but there is major construction work in the neighbouring building. We were aware of this when we booked but were told that clients who booked through our travel agent were guaranteed rooms on the other side of the building. However, when we checked in we were told there were no rooms available away from the construction. I explained we were on honeymoon and had been told this would not happen but they could not do anything until the next day. It wouldn't have been so bad but the lady at reception was quite cold and unsympathetic. When we got to the room it was overlooked by a big crane in addition to this the room itself was very dark and dated. The curtains had a pelmet which had a thick layer of dust covering it. We later discovered we were in an older style room, only some of the rooms have been renovated. The construction work began at 7.30 am in the morning and wasn't too noisey but certainly not ideal. There was also not so much as a congratulations to the fact we were on honeymoon (we didn't expect to automatically receive special treatment, especially since we were staying 9 nights but a congratulations off someone would have been nice). To their credit we were moved to another room the next day, although we wasted a morning trying to sort this out. The second room was better, it was a renovated one so had a more modern feel (like some of the pictures other guests have posted) and it was clean. It was still pretty small and quite dark, it did have a tiny Juiliette balcony but this isn't really the hotel to go for if you are looking for views. The other issue we had were the lifts were extremely slow. Its a pretty tall building and only had two lifts. These got very busy particularly around check in and out times some times we had to wait 15 minutes for a lift and there was no alternative (no obvious stairs). One day the doorman took us up to floor 3 in the service lift and showed us where the fire exit stairwell was from there. The hotel has a business suite which has two computers, however they are pretty mean with the internet access (only 15 mins free), having said that I guess thats not a huge issue if you're on holiday! The reception staff weren't as friendly or helpful as we'd experienced elsewhere (apart from Magic Doug the concierge who was ace!) We had a meal in Diva (the restaurant) one evening and although it was ok, it was nothing like we expected it to be having read the reviews and it was pretty expensive. Ok, so now the good points: It is a very central hotel so well placed for exploring Vancouver without the need of a car -public transport is excellent and most of the city is in easy walking distance. The concierge service was good- particularly (as already mentioned) 'magic' Doug (he does magic tricks) who sorted out all manner of daytrips and restaurant reservations for us and was always very friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfy and housekeeping seemed to change them and provide fresh towels daily. You also get a free newspaper to your door everyday. In summary, The metropolitan is a servicable hotel which pretty much does the job, if you can get a good rate then fine but for the money we paid there are better and friendlier hotels in Vancouver (we also stayed at Pacific Palisades-cheaper and better service and visited The Wedgewood- same price and really classy)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room, Functional and Aesthetic Design, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ccollins0822
Reviews.Content: This hotel embodies a certain architectural era that I really enjoy. Sort of postmodern meets brass and wood luxury. Angular rooms in irregular shapes with custom designed fixtures provide amble storage space, soft, recessed lighting, and a feeling of luxury. The bathroom is a real treat with a separate soaker tub and stand up shower. Mirrors abound, giving a feeling of spaciousness. Our room even had a little balcony next to a sitting area where we were able to enjoy some champagne overlooking the city. The location is perfect, and just became more perfect with the Canada Line to the airport opening right next door. The art gallery is right around the corner, you can walk to shopping on Robson and nightlife on Davie and Granville. The city bus just outside the door goes straight to Granville Island in 12 minutes. There is some construction going on next door, but in our room at the front of the building, we could not hear it and were not disturbed. The desk staff, concierge, and bellman were universally friendly and helpful. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, although my partner was not a fan of the feathers. We got all this for an unbelievably low price. We had only two complaints: first, that we couldn't stay longer, and, more seriously, that the elevator is dreadfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodging for business travel”
Reviews.Author: kamiahkid
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at Vancouver's Metropolitan hotel this past week (2ne week in August)on business. The location is great and within walking distance to many of downtown Vancouver's restaurants, shopping, SkyTrain and sight seeing. I asked for a business travel upgrade and didn't get one due all rooms being booked, but I believe I would've received one had their been vacancy. So, make sure you ask. The rooms were well appointed with a very nice built-in closet, cabinets and drawers. The room I had faced Howe Street and had a very small balcony with a sliding glass door through which to access. It was nice to open the door and get fresh air, and the room was very sound proof with the door closed. The bed was very comfortable, and the bed and bath linens were all Frette.....a very nice touch. Each morning, a Vancouver newspaper was delivered, and a fresh bottle of water was on the night stand with turn down service in the early evening. I didn't use the fitness center, but I did use the jacuzzi one night. The men's spa locker rooms were nice, clean and provided towel service. I imbibed in desert one evening at the hotel's restaurant/lounge, Diva, and was very pleased. The only negative comment I have is that the room showed slight signs of needing updating, such as the television (not flat screen) and the bathroom fixtures. Otherwise, it was a very nice stay, and I would highly recommend checking out the Met given reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: abcdmerseyside
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from Manchester to book in for one night pre an Alaskan cruise and were told that we had been upgraded... to the TaiPan penthouse suite!! We thought it was a wind up! The Bellhop said that this was the best bit of his job-seeing peoples faces when they walk in the room or should I say rooms! It was fantastic, huge sitting room, massive plasma screen, dining room,full kitchen,three patio areas,patio dining suite,gas barbecue,patio heater, loungers.Back inside, past the baby grand piano,up the spiral staircase to the mezzanine bedroom,a huge bed( very comfy),TV,chaise longue,work area,fax machine, big wardrobes and into the huge marble and gold plated bathroom with jacuzzi, shower cubicle and another tv!! The curtains in the suite were operated by remote control! We obviously had no need for most of these extras but it made a really fantastic start to what turned out to be a brilliant holiday! We are not usually lucky enough to get an upgrade on anything so this was a great surprise! The staff were lovely and very helpful. They thought it was great when they could upgrade guests! We stayed there on another two occasions during our holiday, and the'ordinary' rooms were great as well.We would highly recommend The Met to anyone! PS the Alaskan cruise was also fantastic and we would also recommend this too!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: anthem281
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is a little dated and there are only two elevators. The elevator situation was a problem only when we got to the hotel because our arrival coincided with a tour group's arrival. Overall the hotel was a great value and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: LVLisaAu
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train to Vancouver from Seattle. We had booked the Metropolitan through Orbitz, based upon TA reviews, and were not disappointed! We got there around 11:30 in the morning, well before check-in, expecting to store our luggage and explore the city. To our surprise, a room was ready! Our room was on the top floor, had a full balcony, and a HUGE bathroom with 2 sinks, a separate shower and a Jacuzzi tub. There was no wait for our luggage as the bellman escorted us to our room. He recommended a few places for lunch, so we walked around the corner to The Keg. He also suggested the Cactus Club Café which we had on another day. Both recommendations were excellent! The only issue we had the entire time we stayed at the Met was the temperature of the room. It was very hot in our room the first night, and we all had difficulty sleeping. Apparently the area was experiencing record heat, and the hotel’s air conditioning system was not built to handle it. The thermostat in our room would not drop at all (the dial just kept spinning), and someone from engineering came up to look at it. He said that it would be a 2 man job and would take at least a few hours to complete (it was around 5 on our check-in day). We agreed that he could come back in the morning, and we would get up early and be out of the room by 9 am so he could complete the job before noon. Since the hotel is nearby everything, we were in and out several times, and it appeared as if no one had done anything. (We found out later that they did come in to change the filter) After talking with Jeremiah at the front desk, he personally showed us a few other rooms that we could switch to if we wanted. We decided to stay in our room since it was much larger and more comfortable than the others, and Jeremiah brought us a fan. We decided to leave the curtains closed while we were out to keep the room cool. The room did cool down so we were very happy that we had stayed where we were. Everything about this hotel is excellent…especially the service!! Jeremiah at the front desk is amazing! He told us that we could get in touch with him even though he would be off for 2 days of our stay, if there was anything we needed. Gilles in DIVA restaurant is also wonderful. He was so delightful, and you can tell he is proud of his job! We ate in the hotel’s award winning restaurant several times, for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Not even a little disappointing! Totally worth every penny!! After each day of exploring Vancouver, Whistler or Victoria, we came back to a turned down room that included the next day’s weather, a bottle of water for each of us, and the radio playing quietly. It was a wonderful touch. We may not make it back to Vancouver, but if we do, you will find us at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marianne88
Reviews.Content: We visited Canada for my husband's 50th birthday and upon checking in I was first informed that they had given us a twin room. Oh Nooo, I thought, and upon realising my concerns the male receptionist informed me that he would see what he could do. He then came back to me and asked if a queen bed would be okay. I confirmed that it was and the service from him was outstanding. We walked into our room to find a lovely birthday cake and a chocolate banner with happy birthday wishes written on it for my husband! We found all the staff at the Hotel extremely helpful. We stayed on floor 12 and the cleaner came in every day and we had clean bedding every day of our stay. Unfortunately we never had chance to actually eat at the hotel but from what I saw that too was outstanding. A fantastic Hotel with exceptional staff. We love Canada and we love the people that are in it. Thanks to them all they made my husband's 50th birthday celebrations so much more memorable. We hope one day to afford to be able to return!! If you have booked the Metropolitan Hotel you will not be disappointed. The pool is great and the Sauna has a TV in so you can chill (or steam!) and watch the TV. Plenty clean towels by the side of the pool. Happy holidaying!!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: darksecret1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple nights last year w/ another person (after he looked at the reviews to make up his mind). So here's my view: the location really is the best and that made the hotel worth it, but everything else was pretty average. So the question is fdo you really want to pay all that $$$ when you can get a hotel with a similar location but cheaper in price (especially if you get the perception that it's "average")? Bottom line: yes I would recommend it because I saw nothing wrong with it. But me personally? I can find something more modern (and at the same comfortable) for a cheaper price nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay Worth Repeating”
Reviews.Author: tusli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for our Vancouver stay. We were able to walk to most attractions, and valet service was impeccable (if a little pricey) when we needed the car. Our room was extremely clean, and elegantly and tastefully decorated. We felt at home the minute we entered the room. The bedding was luxurious. The large spa-like bathroom was appointed with many extra touches like a magnifying mirror, a vanity seat, and yes, pampering Moulton Brown products. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only drawback (not so much for us) worth mentioning is that we would not recommend this hotel if you plan on enjoying the pool. It is strictly a lap pool to be used in conjunction with the fitness equipment. We quickly got over that because there were so many other positives.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pbggirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend prior to an Alaska cruise. Nice hotel with European flavor. Not the typical "high-rent" chain. Location was the best. Easy to walk to most things. Took the trolley to other things we wanted to do. They upgraded to king room with lots of space and nicely appointed. In-room coffee and they brought a teapot at our request. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Have confidence. The Metropolitan is great!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: It's right across the street from the Four Seasons. That should be enough for you to choose the Metropolitan when in Vancouver. We were very happy with it all. There is a new building being constructed right next door, but it wasn't a problem for us. You will need a cab to get to Canada Place to board a cruise ship. You really cannot just walk there with all your stuff. The location was great for us. It's within walking distance to everything you will need. Really, the Met is a great, safe, clean place. I give it an A. We paid $191 a night. We spent two nights in Vancouver before our cruise and loved the city! We started the afternoon at the Cactus Club on Robson Street and had the fish tacos. They go well with Grey Goose. We met Peg (a true local) and he hooked us up with the key places to eat/party. We can easily recommend Glowbal for dinner. We originally were recommended Sanafir and went there but they were full. You will need reservations. However, their door person took the time to call Glowbal and get us a table and then directed us there by foot where we had a great time and meal. How about that! I give Sanafir an A just for that kind of service! We then went to the Roxy (as told to by our "local", Peg) but got there too late (as told not to be). The line was long and I'm betting the place rocks. Instead, we went for drinks at the Four Seasons. Nice. The next day we did the Vancouver Trolley blue and red line tours. ChinaTown for lunch gets no recommendation. Look, but don't eat. Gastown is nice to shop/saunter in and Stanley Park is not to be missed. Two trolley stops are within a short walking distance from the Metropolitan. "West" for dinner and then drinks at the Cloud 9 rotating restaurant will make all in your group happy campers. You'll need a cab. So what. Stanley park by trolley in the morning to eat at the Fish House and then back to the Metropolitan to finish getting ready to board the ship is an easy thing to do. Trust me, you will like the Metropolitan Hotel. If you don't, then you are spoiled and God bless you.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kylie13
Reviews.Content: We booked the metropolitan online, after reading some of the reviews on TA. What a fantastic choice! 1. Our room was very large, and featured a very comfortable king bed with soft sheets, a down comforter and lots of pillows. There was a balcony, but it was very small. The bathroom had a wonderful large shower and a soaker tub. 2. The valet, check-in and concierge made everything a breeze! We rolled up to the underground parkade, the valet took our car and then check-in took a couple of seconds. Very fast. Parking is 28$/per day, but so worth it because you never need your vehicle and there would be nowhere even remotely close to park your car overnight. The concierge was great if you needed to know anything about anything! He found us a movie theater close by and gave us show times, and on our last day helped us navigate to the ferries. 3. The location was awesome as well. Very close to great shopping, kitty corner to an underground mall, and one block from the art gallery. A short walk to Stanley park and the harbor too. 4. If you need a computer with internet, its pretty expensive. First 15mins are free but then they charge you 10$ for the next 15mins. However, i believe WiFi was free throughout the hotel. 5. The pool was neat, offered interesting views of the city. The fitness center had everything you would need. 6. We did not visit the restaurant as it was too expensive for us. 7. I wish it had a spa. My only regret is that we didn't stay longer! ** make sure you book online or compare prices We got a Luxury suite online for almost 600$ less than the hotel had it listed on the door of our room. We booked through Expedia and everything was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else average”
Reviews.Author: kwidjybo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 3 nights with my wife on our honeymoon. It was the last stop and I'll admit that the other 2 hotels we stayed in were terrific, so it had a lot to prove to us. The location really is spectacular, and that made the hotel worth it for us, but everything else was pretty average. The staff was friendly, but otherwise they were not particularly helpful. We used the concierge for some local info and it took 30 minutes for him to call us back and didn't have very good info at that. A second time we asked him for help with some local restaurants, and he seemed put out. The room we stayed in was pretty small. Our rate was excellent, but I've never seen so many charges for extras. There was construction going on next door but it didn't bother us all that much. We used the in-room movies and the picture quality was pretty bad. We walked pretty much everywhere from this hotel. The location really was wonderful. On the last day, we watched a TV show being filmed at the Art Museum a block away.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: meamers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropolitan the night before boarding an Alaska cruise. Since we were flying in from LA, we really wanted to minimize stress and desired a close location to the cruise ship port. As it turned out we literally walked to the ship! Also, the management upgraded us to an executive suite at no additional cost upon arrival. The room was fabulous: spacious, exquisitely furnished, and with a view of Howe Street to die for. We were able to walk to the nearby "steam clock" area for great dining. Check in was a little slow, but the staff was friendly and helpful. While it wasn't a cheap stay, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable three-night stay in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: td1208
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver from June 4 to 7. Hotel is in a good location downtown. We rented a car at the airport, and were nicely greeted outside upon arrival. Check-in and escort to room were very quick. Although we rented a car, we took the bus for short trips. Bus stop was just a few steps from the front door of the hotel, so very convenient. All ameneties offered were nice and everything worked well, including clean spacious room and closet; long cabinet-top to store luggage; LCD flat screen television; nice size desk; wired high speed internet access; comfortable king bed with down duvet, nice linens, and pillows; mini bar/fridge; business centre; fitness room; and large bathroom. Only concerns were variety of restaurants not being very close by (else, we missed them) and hotel parking at $28 per night (we were downtown after all). Otherwise, a very nice comfortable stay. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Overnight”
Reviews.Author: voigtcafe
Reviews.Content: We live in Vancouver, but for our anniversary we wanted to do something special, so we stayed at the Metro and went for dinner at Lift. It was an amazing evening and the hotel staff were SO kind and helpful. We mentioned that it was our anniversay upon booking online, and when we got into our room they had complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries, a card, and assorted treats just for us. It was so nice, espcially considering they have a package for people to buy that stuff. The room was perfect, modern clean and quiet especially considering the construction around. VERY comfortable bed and HUGE bathroom. Had breakfast at Diva, and it was SOOOO good, especially because we woke up so late no one was there! Really good eggs benny. We loved it and would go back if we had another reason to stay in a hotel in the city which we live!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: netheredger
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a 6 night stay at the Metropolitan. An excellent hotel in an ideal downtown location. Very friendly and efficient staff. Stayed on the 7th floor and the room was very modern, clean and well equipped. Bed was very comfortable and for a downtown hotel it was very quiet. Didn't use the restaurant but there are so many good restaurants of all types to choose from. What a wonderful city Vancouver is. Relaxed, liberal, friendly and stunningly beautiful. I look forward to returning one day and would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: fathead77
Reviews.Content: We contacted the Met to get preferred rates for a group of about 10 rooms (attendees to our wedding). Vancouver hotels generally run at about a 95% occupancy rate (especially during the spring/summer) so finding decent rates, at time, is tough. Even though our wedding was offsite, they gave us a great rate and upgraded our own room to a fantastic junior suite. The suite was big, comfortable with 2 flat screens, king bed with a large bathroom. Really a nice suite. Other rooms were nice as well. All quite comfortable with nice beds and decent decorations. Diva at the Met is the onsite restaurant and is well known in Vancouver for it's food, presentation and price (it ain't cheap, but the food is great). Marshall Mills is I one of the managers at the Met and the guy is fantastic. He responded quickly to us (as we live overseas) and help find and finalize rooms for all our guests. He was always available for questions and responded pleasantly to the most mundane of questions. The hotel itself is a smaller boutiquish hotel. The fitness room/pool areas are adequate but small, the concierge and doormen are very helpful (though the valet seemed moody). The Met is also ideally located for Van. 2 blocks from Robson Street, across the street from Pacific Centre, 1 block away form Holt Renfrew and steps away from the Art Gallery. The only minor complaint was that the service elevator was out of service and caused delays for elevator waits. Not a big deal. We couldn't be more pleased with our stay. Big props to Marshall and the rest of the staff at the Met. I work for a travel reservation website and will gladly recommend this hotel to everyone who asks where to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hambrrrglar
