Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and was very impressed. First, there are doormen to greet you. Next the staff were all very friendly and the front desk had apples. Our room looked very modern and sleek. It was well appointed with a flat screen tv and many bathroom amenities. The pictures can speak more than words. The pool is a plus; there was nobody there when we went around 9pm. As for the location, it was right across the street from the Four Seasons and about 3 minutes from the Fairmont. If these hotels are centrally located, then surely this one is as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: Hibit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice - one night upgraded to a junior suite and then a few days later in the holiday in a standard double. We found that the suite hadn't been updated and as a result felt 'bit late seventies' but it wasn't tatty at all and was very clean. The second double room had been updated and was great. The people were great as were the bathrooms. The pool was also nice. In terms of location its perfect. Its not the sort of hotel you would spend too much time within, but as a base for exploring Vancouver its just right.

Reviews.Title: “Rather tired (but clean) hotel which enjoys a handy location”
Reviews.Author: mooseloose
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Vancouver Delta Suites hotel but this time we thought we'd try a change. This hotel is rated very highly on tripadvisor but I can't say I had that positive an experience. The hotel does enjoy a very handy location, just across the road from the Pacific Shopping Centre and only a short walk to Robson Street or to Coal Harbour. Plus its rooms are very clean. Those are really the only positives (although they are good ones!). The hotel just seems very tired, the staff are not particularly friendly and for such a big hotel the reception area is very pokey and tucked away. There are 18 floors in the hotel and the lift (there are 2) take an age. This hotel does not enjoy any scenic views as it's surrounded by other buildings so unfortunately the rooms are very dark, dark enough for you to need to have the lights on at all times. We hadn't been forewarned of the building work which was going on right next door. They are working on the foundations at the moment so I think it's going to go on for a while. Work started at 7.30am and continued until about 8pm. A crane swung alarmingly close to the window every day - it just wasn't the view I was hoping for. Breakfast is horribly expensive and the service was poor - we actually left in the end. We were not greeted by the hostess as would normally be the case but simply firmly asked whether we had a reservation - I've stayed in a lot of hotels and I've never had to book for breakfast especially in a dining room which was actually almost empty. We realised that a family seated across from us had been waiting some time and still hadn't received any service so after a while we simply left. Very disappointing - however I can 100% recommend the weekend breakfast at Milestones restaurant either on Robson or down on English Bay, it's devine and only a third of the price. The hotel seems to particularly appeal to British pensioners, not a criticism - just an observation. So if you're in your 60s, British and like small, dark rooms then this is definitely the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in an above average location”
Reviews.Author: ChinookRiver
Reviews.Content: I'd have ranked the Metropolitan Vancouver hotel closer to a 3 star than the billed 4-star. The "suite" was just a room. The concierge was not at all knowledgeable about theatre options. We got better advice from the waitress at the Italian Kitchen around the corner. The lobby of the place was very comfort-challenged. Very small, no real place to sit to wait to meet anyone. Just two little backless couches And the Flat screen TV in the room that figures prominently in their room features write up was disappointing. As with all HD TV's there are a plethora of inputs for high quality video but all were disabled so that I couldn't use it to display output from a portable DVD player nor use it to look at images from my digital camera. And when we did purchase a film to watch it came through the low quality RF input so that the image quality was quite poor. This nickle and dime mentality does not befit a 4 star hotel. ...and $1.25 for a local call! Really! The best things about the hotel is its central location and overall cleanliness. Regarding the massive constuction project next door, we were there on a weekend and there was no activity of any sort going on so construction noise was not an issue for us

Reviews.Title: “WOW this hotel is excellent for service and rooms !! Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: nikki_raven
Reviews.Content: Got the room on Hot wire and wow is all i can say! Very friendly staff and the room was very very nice however the 2 single beds were too small so i asked to change rooms. They not only accommodated me but the bellman who brought the new keys assisted me to move up the the 17th floor . The room was slightly smaller but the bed was a queen and that was what i wanted! The bathroom was HUGE and t had a great lit up make up mirror,excellent t toiletries, HUGE comfy towels, and speakers so u can hear the TV. The vanity was huge and lighting was excellent. The hotel is in a central downtown area close to sky train and across the street from the Art Gallery and Pacific Center shopping center and a block to Robson street for more shopping and dining! '' The staff is very very good and i tipped well as they deserved it fr the professional and prompt friendly service~ The wireless internet was FREE !! Yeah!! Best of all they late check out i asked for was not only granted but they gave me until 2 pm!!! Also they stored my bags at no charge when i went shopping after i checked out. The only weird thing was that when i went out and put a do not disturb sign on the door i arrived back to find that someone had put a roll away bed in the room ???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and room!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rniadreamers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for a four-day holiday, and were very impressed by the service and room. Every need was met right away. The hotel supplied us with two fluffy bathrobes for our use during the stay. When we needed more cream for our in-room coffee service, the hotel sent someone with the creamer within minutes. When we needed more kleenex, someone appeared within minutes. At check-out when we needed a taxi, the hotel got one immediately, and loaded up our luggage in the car without our even asking them to do it. We had never experienced this kind of service in a North American hotel. It reminded us of the type of service one would get in a top Asian hotel. The room had a beautiful, spacious, modern, well-lit bathroom complete with both shower and a tub, and the room was beautifully decorated. We enjoyed walking from the hotel to some of the major sites, including the Vancouver Art Gallery (about two blocks away), Gastown (about 10 blocks), and to the Aquabus to see Granville Island which had one of the best public markets we've ever seen. Our only complaint, as other reviews have stated, was the very high prices (We've never seen them this high at any hotel that we've stayed at) for breakfast at the Diva Restaurant in the hotel. There is, however, a restaurant one block away, that had breakfasts at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent sleep, great location!”
Reviews.Author: evilbee11
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little worried... the hotel seemed a little old and worn around the edges... past glory days when it may have been swanky. That may be true, but it gave the place a character feel, like we were traveling through time and space and I should have a cigarette in a long holder and he should be wearing a carnation in his lapel. It amused me. The most important thing to mention here is that we had a fantastic sleep. The beds were the most comfortable we've found, and although we had the window open, were on the 15th floor and facing a construction site it was just a distant city hum we could hear. The bathroom was all chilly marble, which was fun. Taking a shower with the big, rain head and brushing up accidentally against the cold cold wall woke me up better than a splash in the face. We walked in any direction and found somewhere interesting, inexpensive and satisfying to eat within 5-7 minutes. I will warn that there are extra costs that add up... $28/nt for parking (oh, free valet... do it, because the parking spots are T-I-G-H-T!!!). $12/nt for wired internet which was slow like 1993. $25 for continental breakfast scared us off, so we went to cafes nearby instead. A good, solid, comfortable stay in an intimidating, beautiful city (I grew up there, and it still intimidates me). I highly recommend to those who who aren't ACTUALLY swank.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gotosan
Reviews.Content: I have always been very satisfied with the Met. Great staff, especially Oliver and Natalie. The Met also has a decent fitness facility, although I wish they would re-grout the men's shower, as befits a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: 3rdWorldFan
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online based on the great reviews and we werent disappointed. The hotel staff was very helpful and polite. It was first trip to Canada and they helped add the the wonderful experience. The hotels in a great location and if you enjoy walking, the nightlife isnt too far away. The hotel bathroom was amazing...and remarkably clean. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: anonymousWAState
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this website and the deal I got online for one night my husband and I decided to head to the Metropolitan in Vancouver from Seattle for Valentine's day weekend. The hotel is clean and nicely decorated. We especially liked the pool, hot tub and fitness facilities they also have. The bathrooms are huge! As others have mentioned the hotel is located in a great area and is close to everything. We were able to walk to most places. We did eat breakfast at Diva's and it was good, although not spectacular. There is an Italian pastry place withink walking distance called Sciue that I wish we had tried instead as it came recommended. Parking is $28 for 24 hours, which was reasonable for the city. If you're only staying downtown and can avoid bringing your car all together I would recommend it as the traffice is horrible. We brought our bikes also and were able to lock them to some metal railings in the garage. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JP_SEA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Metropolitan Hotel in early December '08 and enjoyed everything about the hotel and the staff. The location is excellent - across the street from Pacific Center and 1.5 blocks to Robson. We've stayed at numerous places in Vancouver and I rate this hotel on par with the Grand Westin and better than the Sutton Place. Rooms were big with a really comfortable king sized bed. Bathroom was clean with nice toiletries. We did not try the restaurant, so no comments. In terms of service, all of the staff were very helpful and knowledgable about the city. There was a bit of confusion with our reservations, so check-in took longer then one would like. However; the nice lady at the reception desk worked through all of the issues in a timely manner. And since we were traveling with our family we had a little one who was a bit ansy. The reception staff gave our niece a cute little moose stuffed animal which calmed her down in no time. Overall, a very good experience at the Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: red82gt
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Met From Jan 26th to the 29th. I found an excellent rate through Booking.com and chose this property due to its location and past ratings. My expectations for the hotel and for the price I paid were easily exceeded. I booked one of the twin rooms and had a room facing the northeast so the construction next door was not a factor as it was on the neighboring lot to the southwest. All of the amenities of the room were as described on the hotel website and were in good repair. The floor I was on was very quiet-to the point where I'm not even sure anyone else was on the same floor as me. The housekeeping was excellent throughout the property. The workout facilities were decent and the solarium allowing sunshine into the pool area was welcome on a cold winter's day. I did not try the restaurant at the hotel, nor did I use the concierge staff (I used to live in Vancouver ) but the parking attendants and the front desk staff were very accommodating and pleasant. The only regret about my stay is that the twin bed was a bit too small for me, next time I will book a King room. This will definitely be the first hotel I look for the next time I am booking for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: Welshcake2
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through an online company(agoda.com) for 2 nights but telephoned hotel direct for an extra night and got the same reduced rate of approx $140 inclusive of tax.Very well located hotel,nice size rooms with bathroom particularly spacious.Very clean and well serviced daily.Staff couldn't do enough to help.Being british we like our tea and a kettle and supplies were brought daily to our room with any other request we asked for.Concierge excellent.Would definately stay here again when in Vancouver.Diva restaurant was closed although we were not informed of this prior to our visit but plenty of places to eat around hotel.We stayed on the weekend and although my room overlooked a crane outside no work was going on and they were happy to move our room if we wished but we decided to remain as we were out most of the day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SED77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and what a find! We'd originally booked a normal double room, which was a great rate, but were upgraded to a junior suite, which was fabulous! (think they felt for us after we'd decided to drive straight from Banff to Vancouver in one day) The staff were extremely helpful and the bar next door - we didn’t eat in the restaurant, though menu looked great - were also very friendly. The room itself was gorgeous, with a huge bed, large bathroom and a separate sitting room with TV. The normal room I'd booked look really lovely too. It's location is perfect - not far to walk to the best shops and sights and the frontline staff were more than happy to recommend some great places to eat. We did the tour bus around Vancouver which was good. It's similar to the ones in London - a hop-on, hop-off approach. If I were to go back to Vancouver, I would definitely stay here again. There is building work going on next door - they're building a new hotel/apartment block - but this didn't deter our stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown”
Reviews.Author: poortje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days to citytrip Vancouver: great location just besides the Vancouver Art Gallery, a couple of blocks from old Gastown and the Waterfront. Proximity to the Skytrain as well. Hotel is fine, modern rooms and my hotel room offer included free wireless internet. Some construction work besides the hotel which did not prove to be much of a hassle. Friendly French concierge arranging for local hockey tickets last minute. Furthermore, a somewhat small gym (20 square meters) and a swimming pool (did not use the latter however).

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at the Met”
Reviews.Author: TOMxxx
Reviews.Content: Spent a 4 day weekend in Vancouver (which is, by the way, one of the most beautiful places in the world) and stayed at the Metropolitan. I selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor recommendations and the hotel website and could not have been happier. The location of the hotel is perfect - right in the middle of the city and within an easy walk to everywhere. While we tend to enjoy walking vs. using public transport, everything we wanted to see was either a close walk or a healthier walk...and a few places visited required a cab. The hotel iteself is modern but warm with beautiful rooms, huge baths with walk-in shower and large tub, a nice little balcony to get some fresh air and see the city, and incredibly comforatble beds! We asked for a high floor which was nice for views and to mitigate a big of city noise but to be honest, the noise was never an issue and you're in a big city - of course there is some noise. As far as the construction next door, we heard it but it was never an issue. The staff are very helpful and welcoming. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant which is well thought of in the city. Close by is Robson St. shopping, restaurants, bars, walks to the harbor and Stanley Park...a longer walk or easy cab ride to the aquarium (small but very nice and fun), Chinatown (get a little culture and good food), and Granville Island (great market and shopping). Some restaurant recommendations: Imperial Chinese (great Peking duck) but the highlights were dinner at Vij's (Indian) which was simply one of the best meals we've ever had and Vij, himself, works the room while you wait with delicious appetizers and great stories; Tojo's for sushi (we ate omakase at the bar) - the food was local, fresh, and almost art on a plate -- it is very expensive but sitting at the bar with Tojo cooking for you was a treat and worth every penny. And finally, JapoDog. That's right, Japanese Hot dog stand - best hot dog I've ever had at any ballpark, big city hot dog stand. Check out Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations Vancouver episode -- we followed his lead and he did us right! Go to Vancouver -- our dollar went a long way, the people are happy and friendly, the food is good, and if you come from a big overwhelming city like Phoenix, it is a refreshing reminder that there are still cities that can be big and little at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for business”
Reviews.Author: DrLPN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Metro in May 08 for business - I travel to USA and Canada each year at this time - and having a bad experience in 2007 staying at the Sheraton which was awful. The Metro was in a great location, I could walk to ,my meetings at the Australian consulate and other meetings in town, and also had lots of great restaurants nearby and shops across the road. I needed to use the meetings facilities with pretty short notice - the conference staff were exceptional- booked a room, arranged signs in the foyer, met my meeting guests and provided catering with very little notice and exceptional professionalism. I posted packages, sent faxes and even found good Australian wine to take ot a function on their recommendation. And hey, this place is worth staying just to use the pool! All in all I will DEFINITELY be back at the Metro in May 09. I've found my home in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joeygirl2
Reviews.Content: I booked the Metropolitan last minute using an online booking website. I saved up to 70 percent on the price and I wasn't sure what to expect. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was comfortable, bathroom was large and had all the amenities one would want. The bed was the softest, most comfortable bed I have ever experienced in a hotel. The location is great. It is close to the shopping and the business district. The staff were very friendly and the service exceptional. I was even happier to get to stay in the hotel for a fraction of the normal price. I would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Personable, knowledgeable staff AND Dog Friendly hotel in heart of Vanc”
Reviews.Author: River-Road
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. Most of the blasting that other reviewers complained of in previous reviews was complete when I stayed there, but I was on the other side of the hotel from the noise too. I was very limited in my choices of Vancouver hotels due to having to choose one that was near the location I needed to be at during the day, dog friendly, and on a government-approved list. That really narrowed my choices, but this one met all the requirements. When you travel with a pet though, I've learned you really need to ask all the right questions. I am getting really annoyed at having to sign a pet waiver once I arrive at the hotel that contains a bunch of items that were not mentioned to me when I originally booked. I was not given this waiver when I checked in, but rather in the morning by another front desk staff who told me that the housekeeper would not go into the room with the dog in there. Fortunately I met the housekeeper and she loved dogs so this didn't end up being an issue. The housekeeper was great with my dog and checked on her frequently during the day. This was wonderful for my dog. All the hotel staff were happy to see her and the concierge was able to recommend a nearby dog park that I wouldn't've otherwise known about. From a pet-perspective, this hotel was great (although if I hadn't met the housekeeper, my room may not have been cleaned). There was no extra charge for my dog to stay (nice), and there was no size limit on the pet (some hotels that say dog-friendly only refer to dogs to a max of 20 pounds). Every hotel has housekeeping issues (low pay and not being allotted a reasonable amount of time to clean the room are factors) and I'm a bit anal and detailed (used to work as a housekeeper) so I noticed that my glasses were just being rinsed out and turned upside down again rather than washed and replaced - GROSS! I called the front desk and was brought clean glasses, but the next day was the same problem. The bed was comfortable, there was a side bench to put my stuff on and the A/C was really useful because downtown Vanc is loud so opening the window made the room very noisy. The deck was typical of places where space is a commodity: tiny. The disadvantage of staying downtown is that some features that seem to come free with many hotels that aren't downtown (wireless for example) were charge items. This hotel had 15 min free internet, then had a fee after that. The nearby Fairmont had a business centre that charged for any use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: miabailey
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 1 night before boarding our cruise ship so we are unable to give a full comprehensive review but what we did experience was excellent. Lobby very modern and contemperary reception staff were very polite and helpful. Concierge was excellent advised us where to eat that evening how much it would cost to get to the cruise terminal by taxi, and when we were checking out she even helped take our bags out to the taxi. Our room was spacious modern and the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom again was very spacious with a nice large walk in shower. We had breakfast which was tasty waitress was very helpful and friendly and restaurant very clean with pleasant decor. We didn't get much of an idea of the location as weren't there long enough however it was near some very nice shops and malls with shops including Louis Vuitton, Cartier and Gucci and was also near to the pier with some nice restaurants overlooking the water. Overall we have no complaints about this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrspManchester
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a stay in Vancouver. Big rooms and very clean. Staff were very polite and helpful. Only ate breakfast in dining room but it was very good. We were a little wary regarding the construction noise but did not hear anything. We stayed on the 10th floor in a room at the front of the hotel. I would agree with other comments on this site regarding the lifts. At times you waited a long time for a lift which was not full.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Stournavigator
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we were somewhat concerned having read about the noise from the construction site next door but having stayed at the Met twice in September, I can report that we had no problems. We found the rooms to be clean and well appointed and the staff courteous and helpful at all times. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, upgraded upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: gams1000
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Metropolitan with spouse and 3 teens prior to an Alaska cruise in late August. Arrived in later morning and was offered a complimentary upgrade from a junior- to an executive suite and shown right to our rooms. With 2 tvs, two internet ports, extra bath, a dining table, microwave and bar sink, feather pillows, frette linens, fresh orchids in the bathrooms and plenty of couches, chairs, and space for all, the teens thought they'd hit the lottery (until we shooed them out the door 15 minutes later in order to bike around the city, poor things). Location of the hotel was very good from adults' perspective but, had we been staying for several more days, I suspect the teens might have preferred being closer to all the shopping hustle and bustle just a few blocks away. The construction mentioned on other posts must have been between phases while we were there as there was no work going on at all (just a big interesting pit in the ground). Bellhops, doormen and front desk were all friendly and helpful. Only negative we experienced in our 24 hour stay was that the scant 2 elevators serving the hotel can't keep up with demand at check out time (so get on the elevator even if it's going up because it may not have room for you on its way back down).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: kc707
Reviews.Content: Just back from Vancouver last week. My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel. It is in a terrific location- you can walk to all of the important parts of the city very easily. The rooms are very nice and we did not have any problems with noise from nearby construction even with our window left open at night. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Oliver at the concierge desk is great and able to arrange any tour or trip that you want. The hotel has a nice indoor swimming pool on the third floor. Also on the third floor they have internet available - free for the first 15 minutes of use. We didn"t eat at the hotel but for breakfast we ate at the White Spot which was only a block away and more economical. There are lots of restaurants nearby and several malls across the street which have food courts if you want to grab a quick meal. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gizmojen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel for two days in August. We loved it. I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews about all of the construction going on so I contacted the hotel and requested a room on one of the higher floors, as far away from the construction as possible. I also told them that we were celebrating our anniversary. We got to our room, which was on the top floor of the hotel, and there was complimentary cheesecake waiting for us with a card wishing us a happy anniversary. We heard very little construction noise. Not enough to even wake us in the morning. By the way, they are doing contruction everywhere in Vancouver in preparation for the Olympics. The room- the bathroom was AMAZING. Huge with a separate shower and a soaker jacuzzi tub. The bed was very comfortable and the TV (not that we spent much time watching it) was a nice flat screen. The hotel advertised that all room have ipod docks, but ours did not. Not sure if they would have brought us one if we would have asked, but we didn't need it. All in all, we loved the Met and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brightwell
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in downtown Vancouver. There was some building work but we couldn't hear it at all. The swimming pool is clean and changing rooms are super. We had a junior suite which was large and very clean. It's in walking distance from Gastown and Stanley park.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: MapleScotland
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say - we loved this hotel. We went on a recommendation from family, and they weren't wrong! Friendly, helpful staff who can't do enough for you and who treat you like royalty. A special mention for Doug the concierge who did lots for us. The hotel is in the perfect location so you are well placed to walk most places. Robson St (for shopping) is 2 minutes one way and Canada Place is 2 minutes the other way. The hotel looks fantastic and has a boutique feel. We had a lovely room on the 17th floor which was stylishly decorated and had a large marble bathroom with sliding doors. The was a separate bath and shower. I loved the Molton and Brown toiletries that the maid left for us. We stayed for 7 nights and the room was cleaned to a high standard every day. Probably the only downside is that you look out onto office blocks. I could see people at their desks hard at work. The drapes stop people from seeing into the room. There is a lovely swimming pool and jacuzzi and separate men's and women's saunas. Only the men get a steam room. It took us a few minutes to find out how to get into the changing rooms, but we got there in the end! You need to use your key card twice. The food at the hotel was nice. We never had breakfast at the hotel, but we did have a meal at Diva, which was amazing, and we had room service. Overall I would say a superb hotel that I would recommend to everyone looking for a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shapma4
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice - 4 nights on arrival in vancouver mid July and one night in early August. No complaints at all about the building works - we were on the 6th and 8th Floors (heard no noise and the works finish c5pm anyway). Only problem was when the elevator was broken in July but by August it had been fixed. Breakfast at Diva is good - expensive if you pay for it so negotiate B&B in the room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIwoman
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The rooms are just as described on the website, the bar area is lovely and the service is excellent. There was some building work going on just at the side of the hotel but the noise didn't come in through the double glazed windows. My husband was really taken with the little putting green and I liked the juliet balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: moonlighttravel
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Vancouver is the best hotel experience I have ever had in Vancouver. Personally I heard no noise, and the gentleman at the front desk made sure we would know which floor would hear the noise the most. After originally going to the first room they provided, we realized it was too small for the 3 of us, so we went downstairs, the hotel agreed and provided us with a two room suite at only a slight additional cost to us. It was beautiful room with hardwood floored dinning table, large flat screened T.V. and two bathrooms. The staff was just excellent, helpful in getting reservations at wonderful restaurants. I would stay no where else, the noise is not a problem, and the hotel is only two blocks from the action of Robison Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, shame about the building works”
Reviews.Author: haveboots_willtravel
Reviews.Content: This is the best of three similar class hotels where we've stayed in Vancouver. The room (although not huge) and the bathroom (with separate shower and bath) are comfortable and have good lighting. The hotel's restaurant, Diva, is one of the best in Vancouver for service and food. It also provides the hotel's room service, which was of very good quality and was delivered on an attractively set table - not something we usually experience in Europe. Location is very convenient, although the building works next door will be a big problem for the next year or so. We were on the 12th floor overlooking the building works and got woken up at 7-ish. This was not a problem for us, but if you're closer to the works or want to sleep in then you'll need at least a set of earplugs. If it were not for this, we would have given the hotel a rating of 5 (excellent). We've stayed here twice before and it will be top of our list if we visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Personally i liked it - despite the noise.”
Reviews.Author: RABSREVIEWS
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the Metropolitan both before and after our tour of The Rockies and found both times perfectly pleasurable especially on the second occasion when we were upgraded to an executive suite which went way beyond our expectations. I booked via the hotel,s own website taking up The Early Bird Option which saved 15% on the normal rate.A deal which could not be bettered by other travel sites. Check in each time only took minutes.Our room was spacious, with a lovely bathroom and exceedingly comfortable bed.There is a safe, coffee making facilities ( you have to ask if you want tea ) and sufficient storage space for clothes etc. The concierges were very helpful especially Nathalie who gave us some helpful advice on tours and restaurant recommendations such as Don Francescos ( Italian ) and Azia (Superb Asian Food ).We did not dine in the hotel,s own Diva restaurant although we did use room service once and the food was delicious although a tad pricey. During our stay there was only one lift working.This was no problem for us as we were on holiday and in no rush.However, not everyone seemed to take the same view and saw this as some sort of catastrophe. As previously mentioned by other reviewers there is construction going on immediately beside The Metropolitan of a new 48 floor tower block development which will not be finished until 2010.The work and the ensuing noise begins around 7 but we were on a higher floor both times and did not find it particularly intrusive.Altough other parts of the hotel may be more badly affected.The construction workers also close off the sidewalk during the working day but have traffic control on to allow you to cross the road safely. The hotel is within easy reach of most downtown attractions with the Pacific Mall right across the road. All in all i would use this hotel again but maybe for some it would be advisable to choose another option if they thought that noise would spoil their stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can surely do better in this wonderful city...”
Reviews.Author: GC_USA
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location I cannot find any reason why I would recommend this hotel to anybody, my observations are as follows: The lifts – One of the lifts was out of order and (as there are only two lifts to all floors) this caused some real delays and frustration for ourselves and other guests. After a few days we asked reception when the lift was going to be back in order and were told it was due to be fixed the very next day. This never happened and the lift was still out of order when we checked out 8 days later - I suspect it’s still broken now! The Room – I had read earlier reviews which stated that the rooms had been recently refurbished (last year as I recall), but in my book a new LCD TV, phone and alarm clock doesn’t equate to a refurbished room. The bathroom was very dated with a loo that looked like it had come from a 70’s sci-fi movie, the bath tiles especially looked aged and worn with plenty of mildew in the grout – not something you really want to see after a long 9 hour flight. To round things off there was a good layer of dust on most of the passé furniture. The Food – ‘Diva at the Met’ or, as it says on the pitch board outside ‘Diva–licious’ - they have to be kidding!! We ate there once and have to say that that food was mediocre for the price with service to match - it just seemed like the staff would rather be somewhere else. This cannot have been just my perception as every time I looked in at the restaurant (through the glassed partition from the lobby whist waiting for their only working lift) it was mostly empty, which was the case whether it was morning or evening. We did venture across to the Four Seasons, which has a far nicer restaurant, pleasant ambience and good food that is far superior to the Met’s offerings. Building site – There’s major construction work going on next door to the Metropolitan which is mentioned on a slip on paper placed in the room, and states (I paraphrase) that you may experience some construction noise from 7:30 am onwards. However, the truth is that the building work starts at closer to 6:00 am, so don’t expect any snoozing. Phone stolen! – Beware when checking-out and asking reception to store your cases, your property may be exposed to thieves. It was our last day in Vancouver and we had a late evening flight back to the UK, so we did the usual thing of checking-out and storing our cases with reception whilst we had a final look around the city. It must have been at this time that my mobile phone was stolen from my flight bag as it was the only thing of any value not locked in my main suitcase. I only noticed it was gone when I landed in the UK, which is good thinking on the thief’s – you can’t do a lot about a stolen phone when you’re 4500 miles away! You could say that I should have known better etc, etc, but I would expect that a hotel that markets itself in such a prestigious way would not have problems of this sort. I have tried to contact the hotel via their email address but I get a returned error message – perhaps their IT services are also manage by the same people who service their lifts!! Conclusion – I loved Vancouver and the parts of BC I saw, however, the Met was a big disappointment and I really cannot understand why this place gets such good reviews, simply because I found the hotel and service really below par. You can surely do better in this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: AliChris
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding night at the Met. As it was a Saturday night, we did not experience the construction that so many other have commented on. In fact, we found the room to be quite quiet. The room was very nice. Big comfy bed and large marble bathroom. The hotel sent up chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in honour of our wedding (held at another venue). We went to the in-house restaurant, Diva, for brunch the next morning and it was excellent. Since we are locals and work in the area, we often go to Diva for business lunches. It is consistently good. I would highly recommend it! During the week, they usually have a 3-course lunch special (changes daily) for approx $30. We booked the week prior on-line. I think it was around $200.

Reviews.Title: “Always love staying at the Met”
Reviews.Author: DrPaulW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Met for a couple days over a weekend and booked the king luxury room. I booked 60 days in advance, through the website, which gives you a slight discount ($200/night + taxes). The location of the hotel was perfect for me. Yaletown, Stanley Park, and Granville Island are all within 30 minutes by foot. There is also lots of shopping in the area. The room itself was nice. The king bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. The alarm clock had an iPOD dock to play music through. There are big windows with a nice view of the city. The TV in my room was a 27" rounded screen TV, which was a little suprising because I'm pretty sure they advertise LCD TV on their website. No big deal since I didn't come to Vancouver to watch TV. The bathroom was typically of the Met, very spacious and beautiful, with shower and bathtub. I have never eaten at a Metropolitan hotel, since the menu prices always seem very expensive ($23 for mac and cheese at the met soho in TO). At this hotel, the continental breakfast was like $18. I was only in town for a short time and didn't get to try out the restaurant, anyway, so maybe the food is just THAT good. The health club on the third floor is top notch. A small lap pool and hot tub are in a well lit atrium. There is also work out equipment with a rowing machine, bikes, weights, etc. The men's change room has a steam room and sauna (with TV). I was very impressed by the health club. There is also a squash court, but it was closed while I was there. Use of the health club is free for hotel guests. On the same floor as the pool, they have a business centre that has computers, printers, fax machines, photocopiers, and internet access (all complimentary). Around the corner is a small library. Looking around I also found a small fake-grass putting green outside on a terrace with putters and balls sitting around. Nice touch. The hotel staff that I met all were very polite and courteous, helping me hail cabs without even asking. The elevator was a little slow, and since they only have two elevators and one was broken, you might wait a few minutes before it shows up. Having compared the price I paid with other hotels in the area (the four seasons is across the street), I think the Metropolitan Hotel in Vancouver is a great deal. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: lavendergirl1962
Reviews.Content: I reserved a luxury King room. I had read a review that mentioned some construction noise; I called the hotel and asked for a room without noise. We were on the 15th floor. The Canadian in the elevator commented to me that this hotel has the slowest elevator in the city. So, correct! But, the construction noise was not a problem. After the valet brought our car, it is hard to get out of their parking entrance due to construction. The construction is right next door. Large tractors are working on an empty lot that is going to be a hotel. We were on the opposite side of the building. I did have the power go out in the bathroom, on our last morning, and we had to rough it to get out of the room before check-out. For the rate, I would book elsewhere. I received an AAA rate, and it was the highest I paid with the least amount of luxury. The Four Seasons is close by, so is Canada Place pier with a hotel. The bathroom was nice. A very large vanity area with lit make-up mirror and a bench. The tub was extra-long, but nothing special. The separate shower was nice. After staying at other luxury hotels on our trip, this hotel was my least favorite with two exceptions. The sheets were very nice. The Canadian breakfast at Diva was great. I called the hotel because we were traveling as a celebration of a graduation; I was trying to figure out if I needed a rental car, so I asked questions and referenced my daughter's graduation. This is the only hotel that did not acknowledge that celebration. Every other hotel in Canada and Seattle, upon check-in, asked us about our trip; I told them about our celebration, and each hotel did something nice to acknowledge our celebration. The check-in staff and concierge are not friendly or eager to help. I did get a tip from the reservation desk; they told me to add the Breakfast of Champions to my room for $25. It would include parking. The valet only parking is $28; the Canadian breakfast comes with eggs, toast or croissant, bacon or bratwurst, potatoes, orange juice, and a pot of coffee or tea. It was very nice and the service was very good. The breakfast is $25 a person. The tip from the reservations person was worthwhile. The hotel does charge a facility fee that they do not tell you about. Most hotels state upfront if they have a resort fee. The facility fee is $5.60. I hope they get a new elevator. Robson street shopping and a upper-scale mall are very easy to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Construction!!!! Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrst
Reviews.Content: Great city, wrong hotel. Overall hotel was above average, nice gym, amazing complimentary cookies, door staff was ok, concierge changed almost hourly and very weak. I like small private places but this place really doesn't hold up to the crisp personal service one would expect from a well reviewed hotel. Major problem was Construction literally against the building. A rude wakeup call at 7:30 am and loud enough to be annoying even if it were mid afternoon. I am not a fan of the ask for changes after you see the problem, when you know it was already known by the other party, I find this insulting and just checked out. Went to the Sutton Hotel and it was perfect, incredible service, and even the two to 3 blocks in each direction difference was night and day. Much nicer to be a couple of blocks further from Granville street and to be on on the other side of Robson. Much, much nicer. On checkout at the Met no appologies for the problem and I even had an extra facilities fee attached to my bill. Just laughed, said nothing, paid, left. Great move!! Big construction problem that has to be at least a year. Go Elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - some noise though”
Reviews.Author: loveItalyvisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan recently for 4 nights and were very satisfied with the room, service and general facilities. Location is good with easy access to shops and restaurants. It has its own quality restaurant (Diva at The Met) which is fairly pricey but is worth it for a special ocasion. Breakfast was fine but this can also be found in malls nearby. Only problem was that there is a major refurbishment/rebuilding of another hotel next door and this causes some noise from 7am onwards finishing by around 5pm. We received no advance warning about this and it looks likely to continue for some time - probably into next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here just make sure you check where your room is when you book”
Reviews.Author: Squiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for 3 nights during a trip of the USA and Canada. We arrived into Vancouver from Seattle to rain unfortunately – well, they do call Vancouver ‘Brollywood’ I guess! We were warmly greeted by check-in and the concierge which was a great start. The hotel lobby is very clean and well presented. We just booked a normal room but I had told them when I booked it that it was our first wedding anniversary so would appreciate the best room for the rate. We were given a room on the top floor which was wonderful. It was so spacious and had a HUGE bathroom with 2 sinks, a large shower and a hydro-bath. The room also had 2 sets of patio doors which opened out onto a double spacious balcony with a lovely view over the city. The hotel provide you with umbrellas to use whilst you stay there as they know it can be rainy in Vancouver. Thankfully during our stay, the weather suddenly changed and they had an all-time record high for that time of year with glorious sun and blue skies. The only set-back the hotel has at the moment (which isn’t the fault of the hotel) is that the Georgia Hotel 2 doors down are building ‘residences’ inbetween themselves and the Metropolitan. The building work didn’t bother us as we were on the top floor of the hotel and, at the moment, the building work is still deep into the foundations. It will become a huge problem to guests as the building work progresses further or if guests end up being lower down that we were so just a word of warning to you if you are considering staying – request a room away from the Georgia side and high up! The hotels location is superb. It’s directly opposite the Pacific Centre Shopping Mall which is soooo convenient. It’s also only about a 5 minute walk to Robson Street which has fantastic shopping. We went to the White Spot (a couple of blocks away) for a big hearty breakfast to keep you going all day! I’d definitely recommend going to Stanley Park and the Aquarium. If you are looking for nice places to eat then I can definitely recommend Joe Fortes Seafood and Chop House and also HIGHLY recommend Lombardos on Smithe St. – it’s a really lovely Italian Restaurant and serve amazing pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, quite ok”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel as a part of a delegation. Check-in was not too fast and was almost able to handle that we were part of a delegation who paid for all. Delivery of luggage was extremely slow - took an hour to handle my suitcase. Breakfast was okay with almost food enough for everybody. Very limited choices of fruit and hot food. Compared with other hotels I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in city”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: Great hotel downtown Vancouver. We live locally and tried it out for a night to get away from the kids. Room was spacious with one bedroom, large living room and a separate bath/shower in the bathroom which we love. Lobby is tiny but adequate. We have also stayed at Sutton Place one bedroom and it is alot larger with a full kitchen if you need one. Staff were friendly. If you are a tourist try to find a local to ask for recommendations for dining, there are so many great restaurants within walking distance....Don Francesco's, Wedgewood lounge, etc. I overheard the concierge telling a couple to go to the food court for dinner, they persisted and he told them to go to the Keg which is okay but there are so many more interesting places!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for 10 days during the last leg of our 3 week Canadian trip and really cannot fault it. The hotel staff and house keeping were great. They helped us out with organising trips, bus tours etc.The restaurant is award winning and deservedly so and the bar is really friendly. We found the restaurant and bar very reasonable. My husband tried out the Metropolitan's Business Suite which was very comprehensive. The Metropolitan is very convenient. Short stroll to the shops in one direction, or equally in the other direction you can sit and chill watching the sea planes take off and land either over lunch at Canada Place or one of the restaurants that front the sea. We didn't hire a car in Vancouver as I think it would be a nightmare - many of the roads are dug up for the forth coming metro. We used buses and found them really great for visiting Stanley Park etc. One word of advice - as there are building works going on at the adjacent hotel request a high floor. We asked and got a room on the 16th floor and the construction works didn't bother us. We loved Vancouver - there is something magical when you turn a block in a city and are faced with the beauty of the rockies. We will definitely return and would have no hesitation in rebooking the Met.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaisol
Reviews.Content: "The Met" met our needs while we were in Vancouver prior to a cruise that started there. It's located nicely across from a shopping center and close to the nice shopping area on Robson Street. Their restaurant, Diva, was OK but not super special. If I were to book a hotel pre-cruise again, I would definitely look more closely at the Pan Pacific or at the Fairmont Vancouver, both of which are located immediately next to the cruise ship terminal -- we could have wheeled our suitcases across the street (The Met was within walking distance of the terminal but not if you're pulling large bags). That said, I didn't even begin to compare the rates -- I'm sure The Met had a much more favorable rate, based on previous reviews, making the four-block taxi fare well worth it. Several coffee shops and dining options in the area. Walk down Howe street toward the terminal, and you'll fnd Scoozi's (445 Howe street). Neat place. Unpretentious, great-tasting food, and fun service. A bit closer to The Met is Sciue, another nice place for coffee and lunch (at the intersection of Pender and Howe).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travlersfrom_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel in April. The room was beautiful with a rich wood entry hall and spotlessly clean. The large well-lit bathroom with both tub and separate shower was welcome. Location is in the heart of downtown Vancouver with easy walking to both shops and restaurants. The pool and spa were great, and enjoyed. We ate both breakfast and dinner in the hotel dining room Diva. Both meals were excellent (a little noisy at dinner). The Metropolitan’s turn-down service does something more hotels should do, and that is instead of some stale candy on your pillow, they gave us fresh bottles of water each evening (smart idea!). We will return to this hotel on our next trip to Vancouver. M & J Tarzana

Reviews.Title: “Does the job very well”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivered really high quality at a very reasonable price. Well-decorated, comfortable rooms with great beds; every facility you could want from an excellent bathroom with a big tub to a coffee-making machine and plenty of TV choices; and unobtrusive but efficient house-keeping. For $233 dollars a night plus tax it really was great value for what in almost every respect is close to 5-star quality. The only reservations: it's not an attractive building from the outside and the rooms are a bit dark. Breakfast isn't the most generous in the range of what's offerered but decent value. These are just small criticisms, though. The service is cheerful and warm, the rooms are relaxing and the location is about as good as you can get in Vancouver for what the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigCat21
Reviews.Content: Spent Memorial Day Weekend here and it was great. The hotel is in the perfect location to explore the city. The staff was great, we got a fantastic Dim Sum recommendation from a bellhop, the concierge helped us find a great city wide tour and the bartender at Diva (their restaurant/bar) knows how to make a great bowl of loud mouth soup. The decor in the hallways and at the pool reminded me a little of the 80s but our room was great and the maid service was very good as well. Great all around stay in a fantastic town.

Reviews.Title: “Short break on the way to Whistler”
Reviews.Author: Doccrow
Reviews.Content: Arrived from London, rented a car and arrived at the hotel around 11pm local time. Free valet parking- great. Travelling with wife and sons age 10,11 years. Hotel put us in a junior suite. This had a lovely room for my wife and I with a sitting room for the boys, The sofa bed slept one ( or 2) and they provided a roll away bed. Central location for shops. Denny's for breakfast or the local Market place supermarket. Easy drive the next day up to Whistler. Arrived jet lagged and tired. Cookies and milk were waiting for the boys- nice touch. I booked 6 wks in advance by email and got a great discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rumpoleon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for one night at the beginning of a 1 month trip. It was a nice, typical business hotel. Small but very comfortable room with a tiny balcony. Nice Molton Brown amenities in the bathroom. We were able to walk everywhere and store our bags for the day. Excellent coffee at nearby Cafe Artigiano. Hotel has a nice looking pool and spa but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Met!”
Reviews.Author: Traveldonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Met for three nights at the start of a two week Vancouver/Vancouver Island honeymoon. The room was huge with the biggest bed we had ever seen and great views of the sky scrapers around us. The bathroom was huge with big bath and great shower. The left chocolate dipped strawberries in our room with a congrats card for our wedding which was a nice touch. It is a big hotel but has a great personal touch which makes you feel special. They were very helpful and the martinis in DIVA at the Met are great! Really recommend this as we had a brilliant time!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Leilani73
Reviews.Content: For our last night of our 10 day Vancouver/Victoria/Whistler trip, we decided to splash out on a little bit of luxury. We booked on-line directly with the Metropolitan after using Trip Advisor reviews and forums to narrow down our search, we went for the Breakfast of Champions package - as it included breakfast for 2, an upgrade to an Executive (Floor 11 and above - I think) King Room and an unknown "Welcome Amenity" On arrival we were impressed with the friendliness of the front-desk staff and even more impressed with the welcome amenity which turned out to be biscotti, strawberries,chocolate sauce and a hand-written welcome note waiting for us in our room. The room was slightly smaller than what we were expecting - we had to use a chair to store our second suitcase - hardly a big issue, and the bed was huge - with a duvet not a blanket - such a pleasant change! The marble bathroom was fantastic - with lots of mirrors - though thankfully from the shower cubicle you don't get a "full frontal" view! Whilst we were out eating dinner our used towels were replaced, the bed was turned down, a bottle of water was put by the bed, the radio was playing relaxing music and a card with the following day's weather was placed by the water. We don't normally stay in hotels - so all of this was quite a novelty. Check-out time was midday - so we made the most of the room and checked out at 11.50! Our only possible warning (which didn't impact on our Saturday night stay) was the construction work going on directly next door. A letter explaining that work starts at 7.30 Mon-Fri and at 10am on Saturdays was in the room. However, seeing that most of downtown Vancouver is a building site just now (and will continue to be so until Feb 2010), ear-plugs might be a good idea wherever you stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a chic modern hotel. Great marble bathroom with separate shower and bath. The rooms are a little on the small size and the view ,for the most part ,is office towers. The room service menu is very limited. The service is good. Beware of a mandatory spa fee where you use the spa or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: paco54
Reviews.Content: When asked to pay C$4.25 per 15 minutes at Mariott around the corner, I looked for another hotel. Discovered the Metropolitan hotel. What a wonderful place. Everything here is first class and the price is reasonable. For example: Local phone calls are free Internet is free Globe and Mail and other newspapers are free Valet parking in the hotel is complimentary ( need to pay for parking of course) Minibar is fully stocked, in fact one of the best I have seen world wide! The bed is very comfortable The bathroom has the best towels of any hotel I stayed at. Robe, sandals, shampoo etc is all first class. Special mirror for shaving Free bottle of water Staff is very friendly The gym is well equiped and the business center is open 24 hours Restaurant is top notch and the lounge is good while a little small Definitely my next stop when back in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MissTBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: We visit Vancouver about every 6 weeks from the interior of British Columbia. We searched for - and have now found - the perfect hotel to call "home" for our Vancouver weekends - the Metropolitan. The rooms at the Metropolitan are spotless, large and very well appointed. The staff is always accommodating and the hotel is very well situated for walking in the downtown or gaining easy access to major routes out to the suburbs. We have stayed in other very nice hotels such as the Hotel Vancouver and the Sheraton Wall Centre, but the Met beats them all and is generally a little less expensive. We highly recommend the Metropolitan - a great find - whether staying for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: trav3la
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here on our way back from Whistler & we have nothing but positive things to say about the hotel. The location is incredible- right in the heart of town mere blocks from Robson St, and right across the road from the fabulous Pacific Centre. The rooms were beautifully appointed, with very comfy beds & beautiful large bathrooms. The star perks promotion they have running currently makes you feel extra special, as does the impeccable service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: scotara
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel as it was very well appointed with great sized rooms and well furnished. We were in a higher room and had a huge bed which was lovely. Bathroom was large and very nice also. The room was kept very clean and linen was changed each day. The location is excellent, a block from Robson St, facing the Pacific Mall, a few blocks from Gastown, the train and ferry terminals. The staff were great also. I would definately recommend it and stay again if I return to Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Met”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we first arrived in Vancouver on our way to Whistler and again on our way back. It was a fantastic experience both times. First the reception staff were exceptional, going out of their way to help - both in terms of getting interconnecting rooms for us and ensuring we had the same configuration on our return, even though it was not specified on the reservation. They were friendly, helpful and very welcoming and we were also able to change the dates of our internet reservation without charge [although we did end up staying an extra night]. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed, although not exceptionable. There is construction work going on next door and a note in the room explaining but it did not interfere with our peace and quiet. The hotel restaurant is first class and I would stay here again just to be able to dine there! We have 2 teenage sons though and admittedly it did not really suit them, but then they only had to cross the road to be in the Pacific Place Shopping Centre which had a foodcourt to suit their tastes. The boys enjoyed the indoor swimming pool and the gym was good. The hotel is in an excellent position for walking anywhere in the downtown area, Gastown, the ferry to Granville Island etc. We would all be very happy to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: DanTheMan73
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the location and ratings, plus a great deal for a weeks stay. It doesnt appear to be as big as you might think but that takes nothing away from a great hotel in great location. You are in walking distance of every major attraction and everything else is only a short taxi away. Vancouver is a fantastic city and this hotel does it justice. Apparently the food at the Met is supposed to be amazing but for some reason we never got around to it...maybe next time! Make sure you check out Grouse Mountain and the Capilano Bridge tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: nataliatiyad
Reviews.Content: We paid C$265 (room only) per night for 4 nights in a deluxe King bed room and were happy with what we had. The bed was big and very comfortable. The TV had a wide range of PPV films which we used a couple of times. The bathroom was the most ergonomic we'd ever used. Everything seemed to be just in the right place and it was a good size, totally fitted out from floor to ceiling with marble tiles. Our 'patio' window opened out on Howe Street, a busy thoroughfare but we didn't have a noise problem. The hotel is a couple of blocks from Robson St main shopping area. It was in a good location for getting to the waterfront, the main museum and restaurants ( try Keg Caesars, 595 Hornby St, about 5 mins from the hotel for great steaks). We took one breakfast in the room, the rest of the time we ate breakfast out. There was plenty of choice closeby. Room Service was usually efficient, though one request went unsatisfied. The food was OK but nothing special, certainly not good enough to tempt us into the much vaunted Diva restaurant at the hotel. The hotel has valet parking which was useful to us, though pricey ( like all Vancouver parking) at C$28 perday. We noted that the hotel appears in the Titan Travel Connections 2008 brochure at around £56 per person per night. At this price we think it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Met”
Reviews.Author: emmasmom8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Met from Sept 13 through Sept 23 and had a great experience. We picked this hotel because of its' central location and were very satisfied. I believe this is one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. The sheets and down comforter were wonderful. Great service from the staff. I loved the newspaper left at your door every morning and the water left every evening in your room. The Molton Brown amenities were great. Wish we could get these in the States. Asked for and received a room on a higher floor (14th). Really cut down on any traffic noise from the street. Also, I've noticed past reviewers complain about the elevators and I really must disagree. We NEVER waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The business center is great for checking e-mail - we did not need to drag our laptop with us. Also, the in-room safe is great. Did not eat at the restaurant but did order a piece of the Stilton cheesecake and took it up to room (you MUST try it!). Location is excellent for making use of Vancouver's public transportation - what a deal - for 8.00 you can travel almost anywhere you want to go in one day. A bit pricey but would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: foxbeliskey
Reviews.Content: We had this booked by our Agent but it was fabulous. Fantastically helful reception staff and conierge. Lovely rooms and great location - right in the centre of downtown. Would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: PamNewYork
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful stay here and if you include the price we paid (great deal on Expedia) I'd rate it 5 stars. The room was clean, crisp, modern with a great view of downtown. The location was perfectly central to all the activites I planned and the concierge there was exceptional. Oliver, who has 25 plus years of experience, went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay at the hotel and even when we left to Vancouver Island to get married. He even called the place we were staying after we left to ensure we got great service. If that's not exceptional then I don't know what is! Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone. We actually stayed 1 night at the Fairmont a few streets away when we returned from Vancouver Island and it paled in comparison in terms of service, ameneties and the actual room.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: missjax
Reviews.Content: Our check-in experience was perfect. A young man named 'Jeremiah' took care of our business flawlessly then gave us valuable information about the area and even changed money for us. He was adorable-professional but also 'your friend away from home'. We had two occasions to need personal attention and someone was at our door in less than 5 minutes. There is coffee and newspapers at the business center on the 3rd floor (you can print out your boarding pass) and there are plenty of inexpensive places to eat near the hotel. We are US citizens-retired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: cisterna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for any trip to Vancouver. The location is especially great for a pre or post cruise spot. Easy taxi ride from the airport, great rooms, comfortable beds & linens, nicely appointed bathrooms. The balcony is very small but a nice addition if you like to people watch and just view the hustle and bustle on the streets below. Housekeeping was superb. The hotel bar is GREAT- and the appetizer menu is pretty good. We did not eat at the famous "Diva" restaurant simply because we dine out so often at home I don't care to spend exorbinate amounts of money on fine dining when I am on vacation (unless I am in Europe). Great location if you love to walk and explore the many great areas such as the old gas lamp district, the cruise terminal, the famous shopping/dining area (Robson street), the largest Sears (don't laugh) in the world, great buidings surround the area and of course the City of Glass is magnificant! If not you can easily take the "Hop on Hop off" open air trolley that is only 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like The Metropolitans In Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: While Vancouver is one on the great cities in the entire world to visit, The Metropolitan Vancouver does not match this city's majesty. We have stayed at the both the Metropolitan Soho and the Metropolitan Hotels in Toronto, and we were expecting the same elegance and panache in Vancouver. The exterior and lobby of the hotel are quite imposing, and we checked in with high expectations. However, although we upgraded to one of their better rooms, it was disappointing to experience a room of copious dimensions with boring, outdated furnishings. The room had absolutely no style! It looked like thousands of hotel rooms at chain hotels all over North America. Everything was clean and worked well, but for the price we paid, we were expecting more than the ordinary. The highlight of the room was a large bathroom with a separate shower and tub. The service at the hotel was warm and accommodating, but fairly uninformed. I was compelled to tell the concierge about the new restaurants I discovered. My information was attained from "The Vancouver" magazine. One would think this would not be hard for a concierge to find. I did enjoy working out in their health club which was well equipped. The restaurant, Diva, is quite good but over priced and past its prime. If you can get a great price, consider staying at The Metropolitan Vancouver. If not, take your chances elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Stay at The Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: kitgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at The Metropolitan Hotel in Vancouver. We enjoyed being upgraded to a larger room which was very elegantly decorated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We didn't have a chance to eat at the dining room in the hotel, but were very close to other restaurants in the area. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from The Pacific Centre Mall and very close to Robson Street. We would definitely stay at The Metropolitan again. The location is great and easy walking distance from the cruise ship terminals. We walked to Stanley Park, Chinatown, Gastown and Yaletown in one day.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel in June for 3 nights and have mixed feelings about the accommodations. The hotel personnel were very friendly and tried very hard to be accommodating but somehow did not come across as highly competent. The concierge also put a lot of effort into helping us but often just consulted the Zagat guide or used the internet - google. There are two very slow elevators here - okay if you are not in a hurry. The lobby is a little jarring always busy and full of people hanging around or trying to check in or out. The front doors were always wide open even when it was raining. The rooms were spacious - we booked two connecting rooms. One of the rooms appeared recently renovated and was very nice, the other was a little tired and seemed oddly decorated. The bathrooms were also above decent but oddly shaped, again one was much nicer than the other. The lowlight - our room faced the street and we were on the eighth floor (about halfway up) and there was a lot of street noise from both buses that stopped and started and souped up cars that raced down the street at night up until at least midnight and often beyond. This noise began again around 8 a.m. There was very little noise from other guests, which was great but we could hear the pinging of the elevator when people got on or off on our floor. Breakfast and parking were expensive. The workout area was so-so. The elliptical equipment was located in the pool area (which was small but fine to use), which was not ideal as it was a bit humid and noisy from some small children swimming. We did not use the pool but I think it was more than adequate. The weight equipment was a little outdated and a little worn. The location was close to the Vancouver Art Gallery and right across the street from the Four Seasons, which had a pool and japanese garden that we enviously eyed everyday. It is a short walking distance from Robson Street (overrated) and Canada Place. If you like a more urban experience with an active nightlife you will like it here. During our stay there appeared to be a number of tour groups of older Europeans staying at the hotel - very cosmopolitan. I would consider staying here again but most likely would be willing to try another property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Psykiya
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is walking distance from the cruise terminal, the sea bus, SkyTrain, and needless to say, bus transportation. The location couldn't be better to explore the city. Everywhere we went, we always ended up within a few blocks of the hotel :-) The rooms are spacious, clean, and well furnished. The bed is very very comfortable! The bathroom is also very nice and clean. I liked coming to the room every night and finding the weather card on my pillow. This was a nice service. The minibar was expensive -like in most hotels- but they had two bottles of water free. Nice touch as well. The restaurant was EXCELLENT! We went for dinner one night and the service and the food were above our expectations. We never went for breakfast or lunch, so I can't comment on that. Oh, the towels were big and *good*! (I hate towels that look pretty but don't dry....) The concierge service was ok. We wanted to go to Victoria and the "only option" they knew was the tour. They didn't know how one could go by public transportation.... (About $100/person cheaper!). Since we were so close to the station, we went there and asked. It took the same time as the tour, but MUCH cheaper!!!! We took a taxi early in the morning, and we didn't have any problem because the taxis line up in front of the hotel at 5:00am, so all you have to do is leave the hotel to find your transportation readily available. In front of the hotel is the Four Seasons, which connects to a nice mall (Pacific Center). There you find an internet cafe at London Drugs for $6 an hour. We loved the room and the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware downgrading for smokers”
Reviews.Author: expat0z
Reviews.Content: Booked our 5 night stay in executive king suite online. We were given the option of smoking or non and both being smokers we chose this option. When we arrived at the hotel we were told only one floor was smoking and that floor did not have executive rooms. Were given a tour of both rooms and although we preferred the executive to deluxe we chose the latter. On registering we asked about price difference in the rooms and were floored when told it would be same rate. What do you do in this situation? Walk streets looking for another hotel? We decided to grin and bear it. Apart from this our stay was comfortable and staff were extremely helpful. Because this hotel is centally located unless you absolutely need a car would advise using excellent transport system Vancouver has and forget the car. At $28 a day (we needed to hire one for return trip to U.S.) parking is way over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; OK service”
Reviews.Author: diverliz
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is in a great location. Overall, it was worth the price, but only because we got 30% off our room through Expedia for a four night stay. I'd probably try other places if I had to pay full price for this hotel. The executive King room had been remodeled recently and had a very comfy bed, nice bathroom, and a flat screen TV. The room was supposed to come with free internet, but it took several conversations with the staff to make that happen. Make sure you bring a print-out showing in your reservation that you're supposed to get it free, otherwise it could be more of a hassle. Apparently this wasn't the first time that this happened with an Expedia reservation. The staff ranged from unhelpful to delightful, depending on who was at the desk. The restaurant in the hotel (Diva) was superb with witty and very attentive wait staff. The pool was too warm for real lap swimming but the exercise equipment in the gym was of pretty high quality and was well maintained. There were a number of aerobic machines, an olympic weight bench, and a universal weight machine. There were always taxis waiting outside and the hotel is about a block and a half away from the #19 bus that takes you to Stanley Park. We ended up walking back from the Aquarium in the park and it probably took thirty minutes. There's an ATM around the corner and lots of shopping right across the street. The Beluga whale encounter at the Vancouver aquarium was quite a treat. I highly recommend it and the aquarium itself as a place to spend a half day or so.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: NottsAli
Reviews.Content: We had seen mixed reviews about the metropolitan hotel, but we had a fantastic time there. The hotel is fantastically located, right in the centre of town, 5 minutes walk from everything pretty much. The checkin was efficient, my request for a room on a high floor was honoured and the room itself was huge by anyone's standards (deluxe/standard room). The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom again very large and well furnished. The staff in the business centre were extremely helpful and let me check my email for free every day. The spa was lovely with fantastic views of the nearby buildings through a glass roof. I found all the staff to be outstandingly courteous in every respect. The icing on this hotel's cake, however is its restaurant, diva at the Met. Ive eaten in a lot of restaurants around the world, and this was one of the best meals I have ever had. For 250 CAD for two including wine it wasnt cheap, but it was worth every penny. In Thomas Haas they have one of vancouver's finest pastry chef's and you really can tell. The service here was very personal, and the restaurant decor is so cool and sophisticated its very impressive. In summary, this was a fabulous hotel in every way, and with some of the great deals on offer I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: LMouse
Reviews.Content: We had heard great things about this place and although it was fine, it did not live up to expectations.
