The hotel seemed very empty so why did we get such an average room when I am sure there were way better ones available? The room was tired and not fantastically clean. Bed was good and bathroom spacious, though hairdryer was not much good and shower was not the best either. The location was good, easy to walk to most things, and the breakfast was good. The service was lacking to say the least. We arrived by cab and the two doormen stood there chatting as we dragged our cases up the steps, not even mentioning there was a ramp round the corner. the check-in was totally impersonal. The concierge recommended some good places to eat, though he seemed to have a limited knowledge. On the day we left, the door staff loaded our bags into the car while we freshened up. On arrival at the airport the driver unloaded and we only had half our stuff and someone elses had been loaded up. This was a nightmare and so stressful and they were totally blasse about it and we really felt they didn't care at all. We had to send the taxi back to the hotel with the other peoples luggage (let's hope they weren't leaving then and in a rush) and wait out front in a rainstorm to get our stuff delivered from the hotel. I was in tears and it totally ruined the end of our holiday. They did not even apologise or appreciate our concern. They have what could be a great hotel here, but the staff were just terrible, with the exception of the waiters at breakfast. We loved Vancouver, but if we go back - we won't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: J2X
Reviews.Content: We are a couple (both 37 yrs old) who have traveled to many locations both in North America and abroad. As a result, we have had many different experiences with a wide variety of hotels. Before we book anything we always read the reviews of other Trip Advisory members to decide on our final selection. We booked our reservation through EXPEDIA and I cannot tell you what a pleasant experience it was. We booked a Executive Suite online based on some recommendations. When we arrived, there was some confusion as to the type of room we had pre-paid for. Automatically, I assumed the worst – but much to my surprise, the good people at the MET bent over backwards for us. We were given a “Deluxe room” as there were no Executive rooms left…. but as compensation – we were given breakfast vouchers for the restaurant for the complete duration of our stay. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The room was not overly lavish but the understated sophistication of the room was more then what we expected. Finally, we found out that the difference between Executive and deluxe rooms consisted of a Flat panel TV and lounge chair. (On our second night….a room became available and we were moved to the Executive style room – and we were able to keep the restaurant vouchers.) Top notch hotel, staff, and experience! We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good gotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: Following the various positive reviews I decided to give it a try.In a nutshell this a 3 1/2 star hotel, maybe pushing 4.The pricing is adequate.The room pleasant even if it could do with better soundproofing and a better cable selection.I am not convinced this is te best choice in the city as there are newer and better located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug3379
Reviews.Content: This is a very high-class hotel which would have normally been out of my price league had I not received such a great offer as I found online. I was concerned about the homeless problem in Vancouver, especially after reading many reviews of other hotels where guests would find homeless people in the hall, eating off the leftover room service trays, etc. The Met has door staff at the front doors so there is little chance for anyone to get in who should not be there. My room was fantastic and one of the best I have ever had. Size was awesome, the bed was very comfortable,, the bathroom was as big as my bedroom back home! Separate bath and shower, plus there was a speaker in the bathroom so that you could hear the tv while in the shower etc. Location is fantastic - only a couple of blocks from the action of Robson St as well as the water in the other direction. My only downfall to staying here was that due to the high-class quality of this hotel, the room service menu was too expensive for me to make use of, and some of the staff were a bit too snooty. But all in all, I had a great stay here (4 nights) and would recommend it to those looking for a high class hotel, and would also stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ubu_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked it via [--] so I got a reasonable rate. The room was very comfortable, the pool is an asset (especially when it is raining outside) and the location is unbeatable - close to everything, and right across the street there is the Pacific Mall, where we could have (cheap) breakfast every morning. I would stay there again, I had no complaints (smooth check-in and check-out etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Metropolitan, but there were Shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Doublevs
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here (March 14-17) in celebration of our wedding anniversary and found it to be a good, clean, reliable hotel in a great central location for downtown Vancouver. Now, as for our culinary experience in Vancouver, we found that the food was very, very good and we really didn't have a bad experience at any of the restaurants where we ate. In downtown, West Restaurant & Joe Forte's (spectacular oysters) for dinner and The Keg on Thurlow St for cocktails were all excellent. We also had a very good dinner at Coast Restaurant (chef was a little salt-happy) in Yaletown and great lunches at Dockside Brewing Company on Granville Island and Al Porto Ristorante in Gastown. Getting back to the hotel, we are probably being a little tough with our rating and would lean closer to 3 1/2 stars if we had that option. But, there was not really anything to set it apart and justify a strong above-average or exceptional rating. The staff was always friendly and courteous and the rooms are well maintained. But, things such as: 1) inconsistent maid services (shorting us bath towels, not always leaving bottles of water with the turndown service or failing to replenish the soap), 2) needed maintenance to the whirlpool and swimming pool ceramic tile (especially at the water line) and, 3) elevator issues (slow on the best of days, but an actual problem when one of the two went out of service for maintenance during the final three days of our stay), need to be addressed in order for this hotel to truly be considered a four-star location. We wouldn't avoid this hotel on a return trip to Vancouver, but given all of the other options in the area we would probably take a look at what else is available before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: jffyaroundworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in summer 2003, still remember the luxury treatment enjoyed at Metropolitan. Best location in town, large clean room, did I mention the free limousine service around town? Look no further, will stay again next time in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Met”
Reviews.Author: sklsk8s
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay was top-notch!Room was comfy and clean and the front desk staff were first rate. Overall this downtown property really "Met" my needs. Thx and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Lndzy13
Reviews.Content: We looked at many hotels before booking with the Metropolitan and we extremely pleased with out stay! Considering I became engaged during our stay I would definitely recommend the hotel for a romantic or couples trip. The bar/restaurant has excellent drinks and the staff were more than willing to answer any question we had. The room was very nice and didn't look like a typical hotel room. There were marble accents, a separate shower, and a sliding door. The light in the closet was very nice! Also Molten Brown products and terry cloth robe were a nice touch. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Steve Winter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metropolitan for a few days while visiting family in Vancouver over Christmas. We chose the hotel on the basis of the Tripadvisor rating and reviews and were not disappointed. The place is well located, well priced and easily lives up to its four star rating. Staff were friendly and helpful. Absolutely no qualms about recommending this one.

Reviews.Title: “SCABIES BUGS”
Reviews.Author: dead
Reviews.Content: Seattle Washington- HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE Date: 12/01/2006 Reviewer: I stayed the Metropolitan Hotel infected with scabies. A few after days later when I got home my bodies are itching all over including the private places. At first I thought I was allergy to something. Then the itches gotten so bad I went to the physician and was told contracted scabies through commonly hotels/motel towels and bed sheets. Scabies lays eggs inside the skin and eats it from inside out. It causes the bodies (from neck to toes) itches very badly and the skin swallowed before you even scratch it 24 hours a day. Scabies cannot see it with the naked eyes. It is a horrible painful experience; wish on nobody. The lotion apply to the body is very toxic and dry up the skin very quickly. This is a very serious problem. DO NOT go to this hotel. The bed and towels appear to be clean or white. I spoke with the Metropolitan Hotel manager name Jeremy who would not admit they had a problem with the hotel. He is unwilling to work with you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Treina
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. We stayed over the weekend and found everything from the service to the accomodations absolutely fabulous. Spacious room and the pool and sauna were a great way to wind up a busy day. Room service provided me with the best cheesecake I have ever tasted! If you stay, the Stilton cheesecake is a must! Also a great location, central to shopping and dining, making everything easily accessable by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoG30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of October. It was my first trip to Vancouver and I found this hotel to be perfectly located for exploring the city. The room was very clean, spacious and very quiet (although my room faced the back of the building which probably helped) - the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a separate bath and walk-in shower (and Molton Brown shampoo!). The hotel had great facilities - I ate dinner at Diva at the Met and found the food to be very good. Breakfast was also good - I would highly recommend the French Toast. All staff were very helpful and welcoming each time I arrived back at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paul and Tammy
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way. modern spacious room, big bed, big bathroom , molton brown toileteries in bathroom. If you want a good cheap breakfast then go to the Hudson Bay Trading company for a fresh cooked breakfast cooked while u wait(top floor restaurant). They even have a hot water geyser for a proper cup of tea

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: johnivan521
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of October 2006 after reading some positive reviews. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the Metropolitan. The hotel is located directly across from the Four Seasons on Howe Street and is very close to the Vancouver Art Museum and the Robson Street shops. The staff was very professional and warm from the moment I checked-in (very late at night). Upon arriving at my Executive King room, I noticed it was very clean and modern. The room included such amenities as an LCD TV, wired high-speed Internet connection, Molton Brown toiletries, small balcony, and light controls at each bedside. My only gripes with the room were both telephones in the room had operational problems: one phone did not work at all and the preset buttons to call the front desk, etc. did not work on the other phone. Also, the alarm clock in the room was difficult to set but on a positive note did include a CD player. I ordered room service for lunch one afternoon and the quality, presentation, speed of delivery, and professionalism were all excellent. The price for room service, well, as typical, was very high. Also, if you need to use a computer with an Internet connection, you can go to the business center downstairs during operating hours and use a modern computer at no charge. The next time I visit Vancouver, I am definitely going to come back to this hotel because of its cleanliness, professional and warm staff, and location.

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous stay at The Met”
Reviews.Author: cgymember
Reviews.Content: Our family just finished a 5-night stay at The Met. Our 2 kids and we have adjoining rooms (2 twins/1queen configuration). The location of the hotel just can't be beat. We're only 2 blocks from Robson St. and just across from the Vancouver Art Gallery (if you're in the city the Raven show on Native arts is a must see). Because we have our car with us everywhere we go is only a 10-15 min ride (Granville Island, Grouse Mtn., Kits area). If you're into shopping then the Pacific Centre Mall is just across the street. The staff was one of the friendliest we've ever encountered. From the bell person, front desk to the concierge, everyone was very sincere and so helpful. One note about the garage though - it can be quite challenging to manouver up/down depending on your size of vehicle. If you don't mind paying the valet it would not be a problem. We had dinner at Diva and it was definitely fine dining there; we also tried Cin Cin on Robson and all of us preferred it over Diva for the food and ambiance (the staff at both are equally professional). We highly recommend the sablefish and tiramisu at Cin Cin. About the bed in the room. The kids loved their twin beds and slept very very well. Our queen mattress was creaky and sagging once you sit on the edge and we are definitely not big people! After the 1st night sleep my back felt like someone had stepped all over it the whole night. After the 2nd night I knew I had to phone management about it. Natasha (front desk) was very nice and helpful and sent someone up in about 2 mins. Then an 'engineer' was sent up as well to see about the problem. We left for our day's activity but can tell they had replaced the mattress by the time we returned to our room in the evening. The replacement was a nice firm one and we had no problem after that. If you're a shower person then you would really like the walk-in shower in the bathroom. The living/bed part of the room is not that spacious but the larger than most marble-tiled bathroom more than make up for it. All in all, staying at The Met would definitely enhance your trip in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: M1azza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, easy to get to the harbour and the shopping area. The staff were very friendly and even gave us an upgrade on the room without us asking and without being charged. The room was newly decorated and felt very modern and warm. The bathroom was gorgeous. I would definately recommend this hotel and we got a good price on the hotels own website. If you are in Vancouver a good restaurant at a cheap price is the Steamworks company just at the beginning of gastown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown accomodation”
Reviews.Author: QBowser
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent couple of nights at the Metropolitan Hotel, we were looked after to the very highest of standards. The Hotel is ideally located in Vancouver downtown and the staff ensured that our every need was catered for. Canadian hsopitality at its very best!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but beware - double doesnt mean double!”
Reviews.Author: marcandgary
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - fantastic rooms, very large. would definately stay again. However, beware - we booked a 'double' room through the airmiles web site. when we got there, the hotel's definition of 'double' is a 'twin' - two single beds. We had to pay an extra $10 CDN per night to 'upgrade' to a proper double (ie, one big bed)!. Airmiles refunded the difference, but I didnt think the hotel staff were very understanding of this - it was kind of 'well, thats what our doubles are... end of story'. rooms are a little noisey - the insulation around the balcony door wasnt great - but it didnt keep us awake. i dont think even trpple glazing and the best fitting doors in the world would have kept out the noise of the Sun Run starting at 7.30am on the sunday morning we were there - or indeed the Pot Smoking festival on the day we arrived - but that was not the fault of the hotel. overall, i would recommend this hotel. huge bathroom. one other point - the parking is $25 CDN per day - not exactly cheap, but it seems fairly typical. there are lots of car parks near the hotel, but they dont advertise overnight rates - only 'earlybird' rates before 8am. factor this charge into the hotel price if you have a car to get a true reflection of the cost of the room. we booked early and got the room through airmiles for about fifty GBP plus parking - pretty damn good for the location, which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not really child friendly”
Reviews.Author: Erdna
Reviews.Content: I must say I have mixed feelings about the Metropolitan. I would like to leave a few points for future travelers: I was traveling with two underage students. The hotel has adjoining rooms allowing for easier chaperoning. However, the fitness facilities are for ages sixteen and over. This is particularly upsetting since my students would have liked to make use of the facilities, and I work hard everyday to instill in my students the value of quality daily physical activity. It disturbs me to see blanket age discrimination especially when it comes to healthy wellbeing. I would much prefer a supervisory policy to their current one. Not able to use the fitness equipment, we attempted to use the in-room gaming system. Whenever we tried to purchase a game to play, the screen would turn blue and return us to the main menu. The system didn’t work for us, but the front desk made sure we weren’t charged for any of it. The hotel does offer internet. It’s not wireless in the rooms, and it costs about $10 a day. It is however free and wireless in the hotel lobby. The concierge service was useful in helping us find our way to and from various tourism sites in the city. However, an error regarding the direct return bus (only travels in the mornings) could have cost us our flight home. On the positive side, the rooms are really nice. The beds are soft, and the bathrooms are enormous. It is a very nice hotel, and the staff was very pleasant and accommodating. They have porters and bellmen to open doors for you and carry your luggage. Like many of the reviews here, I must agree that the front-desk staff is truly excellent. They checked regularly to see how we were enjoying our stay. I also observed many other guests checking out. It was obvious they enjoyed their say. We were able to drop our bags off before check in allowing us to tour around without our burdensome luggage. The hotel is downtown and walking distance to many attractions. It’s about 30 minutes from the Airport, and 10 minutes from Stanley Park by taxi. All in all, I would definitely return here for business or vacation with my wife, but not with children.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: BdevilDan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan for a week long conference in May. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from a shopping mall and a couple blocks from the Convention Center/Cruise Station. The rooms had a comfortable bed and high-quality linens. The bathrooms were large and had seperate showers and deep tubs. The hotel also has a small but well-equipped business office. There is no wireless internet, so remember to bring your ethernet cable. Also, enjoy the restaurant (Diva at the Met). The tasting menu was fabulous and the stilton cheesecake is one of the best desserts I have every had. Would definately consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDH
Reviews.Content: The Metroplitan was our first stop on our trip to British Columbia. From the minute the taxi pulled up at the entrance, we were treated to the most attentive and friendly service. The 16th floor room was spacious, stylishly appointed and very quiet. Complimentary continental breakfast in the Diva restaurant was excellent and again, excellent personalised service. Location is superb, less than 5 minutes walk to Canada Place and although we didn't need to book anything via the Concierge, they were still enthusiatic in volunteering advice and personal recommendations. This was a superb start to our holiday and we won't look any further when returning to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Damn...Wish I knew about Trip Advisor Before Picking this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had a horrible experience and am upset I didn't know about Trip Advisor until I returned home. Was complaining to a neighbor who said she lives by the recommendations on Trip Advisor because they're from real people - not arrogant travel writers. My views on the Metropolitan hotel pretty much mirror the guest from New Hampshire that wrote in December. Very outdated furnishings, definitely smelly rooms & floors. Blake at the front desk was very pleasant and moved me twice without any problem. The bartender said the hotel used to be a Mandarin Oriental Hotel 10-15 years ago, but it doesn't look like a dime has been spent in it since then! Was in town for a convention at the Hotel Vancouver a few blocks away. It looks nice but is really old. Some friends that stayed there said it's quite stuffy & has small rooms & really small bathrooms. Now that I know about Trip Advisor, I'm going to use it ALL the time!

Reviews.Title: “Straight from the 70's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had heard good things about this hotel and stayed at a nice Metropolitan in Toronto, but this one is NOT worth the hype. From the time you step out of your cab on a busy street filled w/panhandlers - just steps from the outdated lobby (decor from the 70s), I felt tricked by these reviews. If I wouldn't have arrived after 6pm and had to incur a cancellation charge, I would have gone somewhere else. It feels like an old apartment building - tiny dark elevators, and the floor my room was on had a bad odor. Got into the room to find more outdated things....with a few touches trying to give it a modern, hip feel...but failed. It's like they want to be a "W" hotel but on "the cheap." My first room faced an alley and was quite dark so I requested a change (very nice people at the front desk) and got a room overlooking the buys, noisy street I arrived on. Still very dark, as the hotel is surrounded by skyscapers (felt like a NYC hotel). The best thing about the hotel is their restaurant - Deva - which I had heard & read about. GREAT food outweighs the averarage service and outdated look. Walked across the street to see the Four Seasons hotel for my next visit, but it didn't seem to be much better - very dark and outdated (actually has an escalator in the lobby and chandeliers from the 70s). I found the Delta Suites to be a nice surprise (a Canadian chain)...clean, modern, and nice rooms (all suites), but a scary location. I'm okay with it as I won't be walking around the hotel, but I wouldn't recommend it for women traveling alone (drug/skidrow just a couple blocks away). If only the Delta building was where the Four Seasons was...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, restaurant and staff”
Reviews.Author: VacationingProf
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a couple nights at this hotel. We loved it so much we're surprising the in-laws with a quick getaway there for Christmas! The staff were fantastic, esp. the restaurant staff (Laura D and Lance in particular). We were given a free upgrade to a suite, which was spacious and really nice. The food in the restaurant was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great food, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never had service as prompt, or as professional as the staff at the Metropolatin. Room service arrived within 10 minutes, the bellman within 2 minutes. The restaurant is great, and the staff very attentive. The rooms, although not huge, were nicly appointed and very clean. I would retun there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Suberb Service”
Reviews.Author: travelwise5
Reviews.Content: Even though we arrived in Vancouver at 11:00 am, our room was made available. Believe it or not, they read my e-mail "preference" request and provided us with a room on a high floor and supplied hypo-allergenic pillows. I am not use to such service. The room was very well apointed and quiet. The location was suberb- right across from the Four Seasons Hotel. We used the indoor pool and sauna. The sauna had a TV, which was a nice touch. They provided a map, towel and bottled water for our walk around Stanley Park. We ate at the hotels restaurant- "Diva at the Met". Although the restuarant was expensive, the food and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Excellent service. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: rleelee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location was great! The service was fantastic! Everyone was so kind. The concierge ( woman w/french accent) had wonderful restaurant recommendations. The front desk service was impeccable. I can't say enough. I felt as if I was staying @ a 5 star. The rooms were clean ( we had 2 adjoining ) , but they were dated. The price was right and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan, you can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: KevinHPNC
Reviews.Content: ***Winner: TripAdvisor's Best Review with Photos Contest, week of August 25th, 2005*** First, I would like to say that of all the hotels that I have ever stayed in, the Metropolitan had the friendliest and most courteous staff, the most comfortable rooms, and was located in a prime spot of the city. With that being said let me move on to my review and, hopefully, helpful information and tips for future travelers to Vancouver. HOTEL: The hotel offers everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel and then even exceeded typical standards in other ways. For example, they offered free towels and bottled water at the front entrance for those guests “on the run”. This may seem a very small gesture but it’s in these that separate the overrated from the understated. They may not be huge skyscrapers with fountains in the center or grand chandeliers hanging in the lobby but they have the hospitality that you will remember long after you leave. Located on the 3rd floor is the recreation room consisting of a good size pool and a most welcoming jacuzzi after a long day's walk through the city. The gym is located in the same area as the pool but the cardio is in a seperate room right next door. The most amazing thing at the Metro is the squash court directly below the pool area complete with viewing area. Staff: From the moment of check-in to the last day of checkout, we were greeted with constant smiles and hellos. The front desk was very courteous and patient. Through other people’s advice as well as those here on Tripadvisor, I have learned to ask for rooms on the higher floors (avoiding traffic noise of the city) and away from the elevators (also avoiding the noise from the elevator lifts). I have also learned asking for a corner room will usually grant you more space. Having this all running through my head, I asked the clerk for these and was responded to with, “No problem.” The room we were given was on the 16th floor on the opposite side of the elevator and arranged in the corner with three other suites. I thought to myself, “A suite? We didn’t reserve a suite.” Then I realized that not only did the clerk fulfill my requests but she also upgraded us. Just goes to show that it doesn’t hurt to ask and sometimes even awards those that do. The doormen are particularly helpful when departing and arriving back to the hotel. They seem to always be there to open the door and greet you on your return or wish you a good day on your departure. There was one gentleman in particular that I wish I could remember his name that would actually dart from wherever he was standing to open the door for us. He is an Asian man that looks to be in his forties. You will know him when you see him, just look for the smile he always wears. Also, when you request valet to retrieve your car, don’t expect to stand around very long. Every time we asked for our car, it was pulled around in a matter of minutes after the valet disappeared down the elevator. Housekeeping maintains the cleanliness of the hotel from your typical chores such as making the bed and replenishing towels and cloths. They also tidy the place up for you in the process. The first afternoon we returned to the hotel, we found all of our tour guides in a neat stack on the desk, my bathroom necessities were no longer scattered around the countertop but were almost perfectly arranged on a tray next to the sink. ROOMS: The rooms are just the right size to relax in after a long day of walking around the city. There is plenty of room for 4 people and plenty of drawer space for over a week of clothing. The bathrooms are exceptionally large and very nice. There is a walk-in shower as well as a bathtub. There is one sink nestled below a huge tri-fold mirror. A perfect mirror for one to ensure they look their best. The best feature is something that is lacking in most city hotels. The room has a small balcony that you can stand out on and take in the city, maybe even snap some photos of your surroundings without the obtrusion of glass. RESTAURANT: Metropolitan has a small restaurant at the front called “Diva at the Met”. It is an upscale restaurant with prices to match. The Salmon will run you about $30. We did not try it out since the majority of the menu is seafood of which I am not a fan. I’m more a meat and potatoes person. We did read many recommendations from other online sources that Diva’s has some of the best cuisine in Vancouver. LOCATION: Location is everything and the Metropolitan is located at the heart of it all. Gastown is just a short walk away and has tons of souvenir shops with many handcrafted Indian items. There is also the steam clock located toward the center of Gastown that is well worth hanging around at the top of the hour for a musical treat. The Cruise Ship Harbor is within sight from the hotel and is only a few blocks down from the Metropolitan. There is really not much to do in the way of shops but it is a great place for pictures of the harbor. We found ourselves sitting at the end watching yachts sail past and sea planes take off and land from the water. One hint for a beautiful scene right outside of the Metropolitan is to wait until sunset, walk left of the awning over the entrance and look down the street to the Harbor. The sun and shadow play off the huge sails above the dock while outlining the mountains on the other side of the water. Sky Tower is located a short walk above Gastown and is the prime spot to head up in for great panoramic shots of the city. If you travel during the summer, head here early in the morning before the summer haze has settled over the mountains in the distance. Robson Street is one block over for the shopping fanatic that has stores from one end to the other. Strangely enough, they have a Sears on Robson Street that is more like a Macys than the Sears we have back home. Stanley Park is less than a 10 minute drive from the hotel and gives you a great escape from the city to a natural preservation. Don't underestimate the park size, this is a very expansive park with a lot of things to do. Plan on 2 or more days if you want to see all it has to offer. Reflecting back on the stay at the Metropolitan, there is no doubt in my mind that this will be the place we will come back to on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel from the 25 - 28 June 2005 and again from the 1-3 July 2005. What a good decision that was! I wanted our stay in Vancouver to be special so picked what I hoped would be a nice hotel. We were not disappointed! I was travelling with my husband and 3 teenage daughters and now Vancouver is their favourite city... The hotel is close to everything, Canada Place, Robson Street, the Gaslight District and across the street from a shopping mall. The staff are extremely helpful and efficient and we loved our rooms. Enormous, comfortable beds and a beautiful modern bathroom. The only criticism we do have though, is that the pullout sofa was not extremely comfortable - but to be fair, we didn't find a comfortable one anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively throughout Canada I can honestly say that the Metropolitan was the best hotel i have stayed at by far. The accommodation was excellent. The room was huge and luxurious and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The Diva at the Met restaraunt was superb. The meals were magnificant and the service matched. The hotel is located in the centre of downtown vancouver within easy walking distance of all the major attractions, restaraunts and bars. We stayed for a week and found no need for a car. Having stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver previously, and been extremely dissapointed with the service, this hotel was a joy to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Review.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Met for 6 Nights, I would rate it on a scale of 1-10, a 9.0 or approximately 4 Stars out of 5. First of all, I've booked my trip via Travelocity and on the confirmation page (which I printed out) has the wrong address to the Met. It lists it as 655 Burrard St, which is like 2 blocks away from the actual address. I was traveling alone and came downtown via public transportation, and 655 Burrard is actually the Hyatt or Hilton. If anyone at the Met is reading this, I would recommend that you call up travelocity and have them change it. For those who want to save a buck, Instead of taking the Airporter Bus $12 CAD or Limo/Tax service $40+ CAD, Just grab the 424 Bus at the airport and transfer to the 98B bus and get off Georgia St and walk like a couple Blocks to the Met for only $3.25 CAD. Now I'm not cheap now, I just dont like getting ripped off by these taxi/shuttle services. The Lowdown on the Met: - I believe there's only one entrance to the Hotel If there was a 2nd, I couldnt find it. - Hotel has 1 Bank of Elevator (2) only. - Hotel has 18 Floors, 17 and 18 I believe are the suites? - Diva Rest is connected directly to the Hotel via Lobby - Wireless Internet Access in Lobby Area (Free) - Wired LAN Internet Access in Each Room or at Business Center - Daily Newspaper on your Front Door each Morning upon Request Upon Arrival and check in, the reception desk was very receptive and prompt. I requested a higher floor and my request was granted without any problem or add'l cost. I also asked if they had a daily newspaper and without hesistation, the person who I was talking to expeditously went out of his way to get me one. I also requested w/o any problem that I get a daily newspaper on my door in the morning. Oh, btw: The hotel will authorize your credit card for like $500 dollars for incidentals, so make sure you have enough credit on your card, wouldnt want you to look embarassed when your card gets declined. My Room, on the 16th Floor. I was expecting a grand view of the city, but my view was obstructed by another high rise business building. My room was facing North West towards Stanley Park, I'm not sure if any of the other rooms facing in anyother direction has a view or not. I guess this was somewhat expected being in the downtown area, so this was no big deal for me. For those who want a view, it seems like you're going to have to find a hotel that goes up atleast 25 stories. Good luck. Anyhow, the room, was okay, plenty of lighting and clean. However, when I drawn back the window shade, I saw a big moth and it was flying in the room. I was going to call the front desk, but decided not too and it seemed that if I didnt bother it, it didnt bother me and I realized that the hotel window actually open as some other reviewer mentioned so during that night I had the window open and it flew out and that was the last I've seen of it during my stay. Having a window that can open was pretty unique for a hotel, but it can be noisy b/c of all the traffic in the downtown area and at 16 stories up, the wind was howling. So if those who want fresh air, its a plus. With the window closed, there was hardly any noise in my room so no need to worry about that. Other reviewers mentioned that there's a terrace, The room I got didnt have one, so no comment on that. The bathroom, very nice. It has both a bathtub and a shower. Next to the tiolet is a phone (if you have any problems, haha) and a knob that lets you listen to whats on the television. During my stay, I had that knob open to its fullest so that I can listen to the news when I'm in the bathroom and at other times I had it on the music video channel. Also, The floor was marble. The Elevators, I'm pretty use to 4 elevators in hotels, but this hotel only had 2. Since I'm on the 16th Floor, it may seem that it may take forever for the elevator to get up there, but in reality It takes atmost 1 minute for me to catch it. So instead of 15 seconds, that 1 minute may seem like 5 minutes for most people. I would recommend that they put in 2 more (if thats possible) b/c if the hotel was at 100% capacity, people will be bumbing into each other b/c 2 elevator wont be able to handle the capacity/demand. Internet Access, free of charge Wireless access in the lobby area. It also works in the Diva Restaurant. Connection time is almost instant with a pretty strong signal from the access point(s). What would be awesome if they could put in AP's on each floor, so that customers can get access in their rooms. Dream on People, even thou its possible and awesome, it would prob require rewiring the building with each floor getting 4 Ap's, so not including the 1st Floor, its 17 Floors x 4 AP's for a total of 68 AP's. So prob not worthwhile doing that, but having free access in the lobby and restaurant is nice b/c most hotels dont provide these services if any at all. As for charging for LAN Internet Access, thats bascially how it goes for every hotel. The Location, Walking distance to Canada Place to the North and the Ferry Service to head up North Vancouver. Walking distance to Plaza of Nations to the East if you want to catch some greyline tours. Walking distance to Chinatown/Gastown to the NorthEast. Walking Distance to Stanley Park, about 15-20 minute walk to reach the seawall on the northend. Walking distance to Robson (2 blocks south) for the shops. There's a drug store that also sells drinks and snacks across the street on the corner so I would go there to get your snacks instead of snacking on the inflated hotel stuff inside your room. For those who are coffee fanatic, there's a Starbucks and Timmy Ho's (Horton) on Dunsmuir just `1.5 blocks away. If you need help, you can talk to the hotel's Concierge, he seems very nice and from what I can tell, very knowledgable. I personally didnt talk to him b/c I pretty much did my homework on the place but I overheard him helping out other guests when I was waiting for my tour bus to pick me up. The Diva, like they advertise, diva-licious. Visited the Diva two times. The first time, I had the Grilled Wild Sockeye Salmon w/ Duck Fried Rice. The Salmon was nicely colored red (as sockeye should be) and rich in flavor and taste. For those who dont know, sockeye salmon is the best type of salmon there is around and is disingiushed by the deep red color vs pink. Sockeye can only be found in the wild and not farm-raised due to their susceptibility to disease. So when you see Sockeye Salmon on the menu, you know your getting the highest quality salmon avaliable, and remember if when your being served something that doesnt have that deep red color and looks pink, send it back and get a refund. :) Anyhow this dish I would rate a 10/10, but the presentation needs a little work. The duck fried rice should be in laid out in a bed with the salmon right over it, when I got mines, the duck fried rice was in a dome like shape wih the salmon right on top of it, so when I cut into the salmon, it literally almost fell out over the plate. The second time I had the Flat Iron Beef Steak, Had mines medium done. Came out perfectly, 10/10 for taste and 10/10 for presentation. I wanted to try out the RibEye Steak, but didnt have time, maybe on my next visit next year. Oh, almost forgot, the wait staff was really nice and attentive. The morning Hostess/Manager was really nice too, when I came down for lunch at 11:30am (yeah early) there was no wait staff avaliable so she took my order and even served me my soup. So to sum up: The Met Hotel: 9/10, Would get a 10/10 if they had 4 Elevators and if the hotel was a bit higher. I have no Comment on the Swimming Pool, Business Center and Fitness Center because I didnt use those services when I was there. The Met is probably one of the better hotels, but not the greatest. Would I come back here? I'll Probably try to find another place even better, if not, fall back on the Met. The Diva: 10/10, you cant go wrong with the food here. Would be nice if the restaurant opened up at 6am (I'm a morning person), but no big deal. Would I come back? Defintely, Yeah Maybe a little pricy/inflated, but until I find some other place with the same quality, I'll stay with what I know is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vancouver, and we're SO happy that we stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout the stay. When we told the concierge that we wanted to visit Chinatown, he even cautioned us about the safest times and places to plan our visit around. Most helpful, as we found out from others later. The hotel itself is immaculate, and the rooms are quite large and comfortable. The location is within walking distance of the Robson Street, the major shopping area of the city. There are a number of great restaurants and sites nearby. The hotel's own restaurant is noteworthy. In fact, for 2005, it won Vancouver Magazine's Best Hotel Restaurant award, and honorable mention for best desserts and one other category (which I unfortunately can't remember). Having eaten there twice (I don't usually eat in hotel restaurants), I was quite pleased with the creativity and the quality of the food. When returning to Vancouver, I have no doubt we will stay at the Metropolitan again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: world_citizen61
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week vacation to beautiful Vancouver, using the Metropolitan Hotel as our home base to see the region. We relied on the tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The Metropolitan is located in the most convenient location of Downtown Vancouver, close to Canada Place, Robson Street, Gastown, Stanley Park and Granville Island. All these places are within a 5-20 minute walking distance. We had a very basic room, but it was chic, and very comfortable. The bed and bedding were one of the most comfortable I have experienced during travel. There was some street noise but it usually diminished later in the evening. The service was exceptional, with rapid and friendly responses to our requests. The food at the restaurant, Diva, was good, but the service was somewhat slow and the prices very inflated. Finally, a trip up to Whistler, the Aquarium at Stanley Park, and the Space Museum are all worth visiting if you are accompanied by children.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Euro-style with an Asian touch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Early one June morning my husband and I took the Am Trak Cascades train from Seattle to Vancouver for an overnight stay and a look at the city, before training back to Seattle late the next day. Previously I had searched trip advisor for a centrally-located, reasonably priced, four-star boutique hotel and noted The Metropolitan was highly rated. I then telephoned the hotel directly and booked a standard room at $259 Canadian (subtract 15% for price in US dollars). When we arrived, we were, without a request, upgraded to a room with a huge private balcony with table and chairs. The hotel is tastefully decorated in modern Euro-style with an Asian touch. Our bedroom was odd shaped but spacious and the bathroom was quite large, all marble, with expected amenities and lots of towels. The beds were very comfortable and our room quiet for ease of sleeping. All areas and furnishings were very clean without any noticeable wear. The third floor business center is staffed and there is no charge for the first fifteen minutes so it's quite easy to check one's e-mail. The spa, also on the third floor, seemed to be heavily used by guests. The staff was cordial, not overly warm, but certainly helpful, especially the concierge. Nice restaurants & many, many shops are within easy walking distance, as is the Five Sails area near the convention center. American dollars are accepted everywhere, at varying rates, but we used our credit card as much as possible to avoid transactional losses. I recommend the Metropolitan, if one is looking for a boutique-type hotel that is well-located, attractive, quiet and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Mother and daughter weekend at the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: schnapperhead
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for a girl's weekend in the city (June 9-13). I got a very reasonable deal at luxurylink, and we were very happy with our room. The bathroom was fabulous, and our beds were heavenly. The room was serviced 2x's daily. Once in the morning and a turndown service which entailed robes on the bed, a bottle of water for each, the sheets pulled back, music turned on, and a little card forecasting the following day's weather (I thought that was a nice touch). On the weekdays, we received a newspaper outside our door. And we found that the hotel was in a perfect location for all of our needs (we were total tourists). Although, I have to say I was a little annoyed with reception when I checked in. At first they couldn't find my reservation, and asked with a snotty attitude if I was sure I wasn't looking for the Royal Crowne Plaza (OK I'm 30 but look 22.). But after seeing how well a slightly older gentleman in front of me (~40 years), I found that I received somewhat of a lesser standard even after they found my reservation. Thankfully my mom was treated well even though I was paying. Our breakfast was included, so every morning we ate at their restaurant Diva, which was a good deal as prices were pretty expensive for breakfast. We loved at Alane at Diva, who gave us his card when we told him we had reservations at CinCin, telling us he knew both of their managers. And when we asked to speak with their manager (Sebastian), he was so nice. He frequently checked our table to see how we were doing and then gave us a complimentary madeira which he had picked out to compliment the desserts we had ordered. It was wonderful. If I ever return to Vancouver, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment, what happened?”
Reviews.Author: selectguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Met twice last year and had great experiences, - spring and summer last year, it seems like the life is gone from the place, service is missing and no one cares. I asked to speak to the manager, never had a call back for a bad service slip up. Rates are high and the rooms are pretty basic. I will find somewhere else to stay for my trips to a city I love. too bad Metropolitan you really were something! J. Murray.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: ozam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan and part of a one week honeymoon in British Columbia. We found the hotel to be extremely nice. The rooms are large, the linens are very very nice, and the bathrooms are tile covered with seperate showers. Rates are very attractive relative to other downtown hotels (parking was included) and the Metropolitan's location is outstanding. It is exactly what I think of when I imagine a botique hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Hotel-Great!”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great weekend in Vancouver BC. The Metropolitan Hotel was wonderful. Very quiet,great beds and bathrooms are huge. Try for a room with a small balcony,the fresh air is nice rather then the canned air. Had a tasting meal at Diva at the Met rest. on site. Wonderful meal,what a chef. The pool and spa area was relly nice and relaxing. No steam bath for women,men only. My only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dstx4
Reviews.Content: Again using the comments from Tripadvisor we booked the Metropolitan Hotel. It was outstanding!!! The staff was very friendly and they went out of their way to serve us. The rooms were BEAUTIFUL!!! We had a king bed with the softest down comforter. The Fette robes were a nice touch! The bathrooms were huge with both a tub and a shower. There was plenty of closet space to store things. The best part was the fitness room, pool, and sauna opened until 11:00!!! This gave us plenty of time to eat dinner, explore the city, and return to the jacuzzi and relax. The Metroplitan was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: lovewestcoast
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Metropolitan for two nights following a week long ski trip in Whistler. From the moment we arrived I could tell it was a great hotel. The location on Howe Street is very centrally located which makes it easy to explore many of the great areas in Vancouver such as the waterfront, Stanley Park, Gas Light/Lamp, Yaletown, Granville Island, etc. The hotel lobby felt quaint and intimate for a city hotel. The front desk was very professional and the concierge (Nathalie) was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable - she helped us find some great restaurants and other things to do during our stay. The elevators were very speedy which we appreciated since sometimes they are slow in hotels with many floors. Our room was very nice (#1504), beautiful marble bath - all marble on floor, walls, shower with separate shower and soaking tub. The shower stall was quite small which was fine for us but if you are tall or overweight you may have to squeeze in. The Frette bathrobes and the towels were very nice. We also enjoyed the bathroom amenities. The room itself was a bit outdated - carpet was a weird peach color (very clean - just a bit worn and outdated color) and the curtains and furniture need to be updated. The king bed however was wonderful! There were four large king size down pillows, crisp linens, and down comforter with duvet. The room also had a Sony CD clock radio which was nice since we had some of our favorite CD's with us. Some of the rooms (including ours) have a very tiny balcony - not enough room to sit out there but nice to leave the door open when the weather is nice out. I would highly recommend getting the "Breakfast at the Met" package which was only $20 more than the standard rate and included full breakfast for two including tax and gratuity in the Diva at the Met Restaurant. The food was very good but the service in the Diva Restaurant was slow, cool, and unattentive (seems strange since the Front Desk and Concierge have very high standards of service). You have to ask everytime you want something (water, more coffee, etc. - the waiters rarely came by our table on either day to check on us - we had to flag them down constantly). We did have one problem in our room - once we put our valuables in the safe we could not get it back open. I called the front desk and they immediately sent the manager up to fix the problem - it did take him a while to fix it. He was very apologetic as we were almost late for our dinner reservation because of the problem. Right after he left room service showed up with a nice bottle of wine - compliments of the manager - very nice touch! I would highly recommend this hotel and definitely plan to stay there on my next visit to Vancouver. Hopefully they will renovate their guest rooms soon.
